		<item>
		<title>Glasses, Glasses on My Nose!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/07/29/hello-world/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Jul 2010 07:28:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Two third of our household (that makes my husband and I) are wearing glasses. So, I guess it was no surprise that the little guy was so into glasses.

While I wouldn't say that it's a totally good thing (judging from the number of times he threw and brake our glasses), I say it calls for a fun project  together.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>cardboard</li>
	<li>black marker</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, I drew a pair of glasses on the cardboard then cut along the line.

[caption id="attachment_10" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Drawing the pattern"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/01_glasses_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-10 " title="01_glasses_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/01_glasses_01.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Drawing the pattern&quot;" width="300" height="215" /></a>[/caption]

Fold on the left. And on the right. There you go, the glasses are ready!

[caption id="attachment_12" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to wear!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/01_glasses_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-12" title="01_glasses_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/01_glasses_03.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Ready to wear&quot;" width="300" height="229" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad, the little guy couldn't really participate. Still, he was excited enough to be the model. He was all giggling when I put the glasses on him!

[caption id="attachment_11" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Trying on the new glasses"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/01_glasses_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-11" title="01_glasses_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/07/01_glasses_02.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Trying on the new glasses&quot;" width="300" height="276" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-07-29 07:28:44</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>About</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/about/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 29 Jul 2010 07:28:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?page_id=2</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Isn't it ironic that when we send our kids to a child care or a school, we demand so much from it? It has to have the right number of teachers and teach our kids enough to get them ready to be the next candidate for presidency without giving them too much pressure.  And those are probably just two among the long list of things that our kids' school has to promise us, let alone actually provide to our kids.

Yet, when we have our kids at home with us, we simply just turn on the TV and let their eyes be glued to the screen. Educational, you think, but what ever happen to a great time together with our kids?

Now is a good time to take the remote  control away (or perhaps, hide) and have some fun with our kids. Get our kids' hands dirty and forget about those ugly stains on their clothes. Make way for creativity, never mind the mess it creates. Even cleaning up could make a great avenue to have fun together.

Don't worry about which activity is good for which development. Even the most trivial activity could benefit our kids and ourselves. Parenting doesn't always have to be about guilt and doubt. It is an experience like no other.

School of Fun is written by Nicole, a mother of a toddler who dreads the concept of sitting still. She is temporarily trading days in the office for days at home with her son and all his quirkiness. Together with her son, she enjoys having fun with scissors, glue sticks and paints. She loves her son's excitement as they make something out of nothing. She believes that it is the best way to exercise her son's little gray cells and little fingers. She also believes that as she keeps him busy, she is actually spared from any possible tantrums that would drive her crazy. And yes, she LOVES crafting!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Bean Here, Bean There</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/04/bean-here-bean-there/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 04 Aug 2010 04:36:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beans"><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=16</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's hard to get anything done in the kitchen if you have a tail as busy as my little guy. So, here's what we did to keep him occupied in a safe place.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>mung beans (kidney beans are equally fun!)</li>
	<li>plastic container</li>
	<li>metal container</li>
</ol>
<strong>Red flag</strong>:

I made sure I was there with the little guy for the first few minutes. I didn't want him to swallow any of the beans or to put inside his nose or ears. I only stepped away from him once I was sure that he had no interest to put the beans inside any parts of his body.

<strong>Let the fun begin!</strong>

Basically, we just put some water inside the plastic container. I threw in some beans and let his little hands pick the beans. Once picked, I got him to put the beans inside the metal container.<em> Clang! Clang! </em>Oh, how we loved the sound of it!

[caption id="attachment_17" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Bean Here, Bean There"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/02_beans_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-17" title="02_beans_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/02_beans_01.jpg?w=225" alt="&quot;Bean Here, Bean There&quot;" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

<div id="_mcePaste" style="position:absolute;left:-10000px;top:173px;width:1px;height:1px;overflow:hidden;"><img src="/2010%20FILES/Photos/cybershot/2010_07/DSC02478.JPG" alt="" /></div>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>16</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-04 04:36:50</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>bean-here-bean-there</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>

		<item>
		<title>Float, Float Your Boat</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/07/float-float-your-boat/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 07 Aug 2010 14:43:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=22</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The weather had been atrociously hot and this little guy was simply dying to go out. He was so bored that he turned cranky.

Say, wouldn't it be nice to take a dip at the nearest swimming pool? Yet, I had no intention to bake him under the scorching hot sun!

Oh well, if we couldn't go to the pool, we could always bring the 'pool' near! So, out we brought our dear ole pail. Pour in some water, and throw in some bathtub toys for more fun.

[caption id="attachment_25" align="aligncenter" width="221" caption="Rain, Rain, Come Today!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/03_float_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-25" title="03_float_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/03_float_02.jpg?w=221" alt="&quot;Rain, Rain, Come Today!&quot;" width="221" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

A paper boat would also be great... :)

[caption id="attachment_24" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Waiting for the Titanic Moment"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/03_float_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-24" title="03_float_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/03_float_01.jpg?w=225" alt="&quot;Waiting for the Titanic Moment&quot;" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

In the end, the little guy didn't seem to show any interest to get himself into the water. He enjoyed observing how the balls and the boat floated around. We made waves together, and waited for the boat to sink.

And the best thing? This whole outdoor thing, which didn't really require us to step out of the building and walk under the sun, really floated his boat!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>When We Ran Out of Idea...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/07/when-we-ran-out-of-idea/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 07 Aug 2010 14:57:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=28</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Just bring out the paint and let our fingers have some fun! After all, didn't Picasso say that "Every <em>child</em> is an <em>artist"?</em>

[caption id="attachment_29" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Little Picasso in Action"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/04_fingerpaint_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-29" title="04_fingerpaint_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/04_fingerpaint_01.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Little Picasso in Action&quot;" width="300" height="204" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>28</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-07 14:57:16</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-07 14:57:16</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<item>
		<title>Pick-a-Bean!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/07/pick-a-bean/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 07 Aug 2010 15:22:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beans"><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=31</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Start spreading the beans. It's time for some bean-sorting games!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>a variety of beans (we used mung beans and kidney beans)</li>
	<li>muffin tin</li>
	<li>metal container</li>
</ol>
<strong>Red flag</strong>:

Every time we played with beans, I made sure I was there with the little guy for the first few  minutes. I didn’t want him to swallow any of the beans or to put inside  his nose or ears. I only stepped away from him once I was sure that he  had no interest to put the beans inside any parts of his body.

<strong>Let the fun begin!</strong>

We started it off by putting different beans in different muffin tin holes. In no time, the little guy was busy moving beans from one hole to another empty hole. In less than 5 minutes, we had different beans in each hole.

[caption id="attachment_34" align="aligncenter" width="231" caption="In You Go, Beans!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/05_sortbeans_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-34" title="05_sortbeans_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/05_sortbeans_01.jpg?w=231" alt="&quot;In You Go, Beans!&quot;" width="231" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The next task was to get him to pick similar beans and put inside the metal container. It was not that difficult to get him to do just that. He seemed to be particularly interested in the kidney beans. So, he happily picked all the kidney beans and put inside the metal container. The first few times he heard the sound the bean made when it landed on the metal container, he giggled. He just looooved that 'clang! clang!' sound!

[caption id="attachment_35" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Pick-a-Bean!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/05_sortbeans_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-35" title="05_sortbeans_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/05_sortbeans_02.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Pick-a-Bean!&quot;" width="300" height="250" /></a>[/caption]

When he finished, he poured all the kidney beans back to the muffin tin. And guess what, he got a different type of 'clang! clang!' sound to love!

We play this game pretty often and he seems to like it very much. You should see how he smiles from ear to ear whenever he sees me taking out the muffin tin and the metal container!

This game can keep him entertained for at least half an hour. That's pretty good for me to take a breather...*<em>wink, wink</em>* Now that certainly makes this mummy smile from ear to ear, too!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Wait, Mr Postman!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/11/wait-mr-postman/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2010 06:05:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=38</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Been noticing that the little guy has started a new hobby: collecting small items and putting them inside anything with a hole... It was no wonder that our mailbox became one of his favorites. Every time we went downstairs to check our mailbox, he would ask me for the key and try to open the mailbox. Of course, each time I had to lift him up and help him put the key inside the keyhole. Ah...  the excitement that he showed when he found something inside... it's contagious!

So, when we finally got ourselves an empty cereal box, I was so excited to start this new project with him. So excited that, in the end, I didn't bother to paint the box like I planned earlier. We just played with it straight away!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>an empty cereal box</li>
	<li>scissors and cutter</li>
	<li>old brochures or any junk mails (for the mails)</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First I cut a slit in the cereal box. I made it wide enough so that he wouldn't get frustrated trying to push the mails down through the slit. While I was cutting the slit, I let the little guy drew on the old brochures. That kept him from trying to take my scissors or cutter.

[caption id="attachment_39" align="aligncenter" width="297" caption="Mr Postman Has Chosen His Mailbox"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/06_mailbox_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-39" title="06_mailbox_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/06_mailbox_01.jpg?w=297" alt="&quot;Mr Postman Has Chosen His Mailbox&quot;" width="297" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Next, I showed him how to put the mail in the mailbox and how we could open the mailbox and collect all the mails back. No doubt he was a fast learner! He happily pushed the mails, took out all the mails, and did it all over again. He found out how fun it was to shake the mailbox, too!

[caption id="attachment_40" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Mr Postman in Action"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/06_mailbox_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-40" title="06_mailbox_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/06_mailbox_02.jpg?w=225" alt="&quot;Mr Postman in Action&quot;" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>38</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-11 06:05:56</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-11 06:05:56</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>wait-mr-postman</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1282111248]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>07_dragonfruit_03</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/11/42/07_dragonfruit_03/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2010 06:13:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_03.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Make way for the truck!]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>43</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-11 06:13:09</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-11 06:13:09</wp:post_date_gmt>

		<item>
		<title>Fun with Dragon Fruits</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/11/42/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2010 06:15:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=42</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA['Twas probably the season of dragon fruits! And thanks to a certain someone, we suddenly had lots of dragon fruits at home.

The exotic look seemed to beckon the little guy's curiosity. No matter where I put the dragon fruits, as long as he could still see them, he would try to reach for these fruits.

So, out we took our truck loader and pail. Let us show you how dragon fruits could be lotsa fun!
<ol>
	<li>Get your truck to load each fruit

[caption id="attachment_43" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Make way for the truck!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-43" title="07_dragonfruit_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_03.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Make way for the truck!&quot;" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]</li>
	<li>Pick it

[caption id="attachment_44" align="aligncenter" width="226" caption="Pick &#039;n Check"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-44" title="07_dragonfruit_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_01.jpg?w=226" alt="&quot;Pick 'n Check&quot;" width="226" height="300" /></a>[/caption]</li>
	<li>Throw it in (Thankfully, none of the fruits were 'hurt' in this exercise! We could still safely eat all of them.)</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_45" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Slam dunk!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-45" title="07_dragonfruit_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/07_dragonfruit_02.jpg?w=212" alt="&quot;Slam dunk!&quot;" width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>42</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>42</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Along Came a Ladybug</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/11/along-came-a-ladybug/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 11 Aug 2010 06:44:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=51</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Just the other day, we watched <a href="http://entertainment.xin.msn.com/en/tv/channel-5/programmes/nsc-2010.aspx?cp-documentid=4100748" target="_blank">National Science Challenge 2010</a> on TV. I saw that one of the teams used quite an interesting way to explain friction: using yarn, straws and cardboard paper. Basically, the team made use of the friction between the yarn and straws to make the cardboard climb up and down. Since them, I was so tickled to make one with the little guy!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>a paper plate (or cardboard)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>yarns</li>
	<li>straws</li>
	<li>clear tapes</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

I drew a ladybug on the paper plate and let him color it using markers. I chose to use paper plate as the little guy always seemed to be comfortable holding and doodling on it. You see, he loved to do all these fun activities while sitting on the couch. As long as he seemed comfortable holding and doodling on it, I could be assured that my sofa remains safe... *grinz*

[caption id="attachment_53" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Pink Ladybug"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-53" title="08_friction_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_01.jpg?w=212" alt="&quot;Pink Ladybug&quot;" width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

After he has done coloring, I cut out the lady bug.

[caption id="attachment_54" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Free Ladybug"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-54" title="08_friction_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_02.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;A Free Ladybug&quot;" width="300" height="233" /></a>[/caption]

I took 2 small straws, and using clear tapes, attached them at the back of the lady bug. Do check out how I positioned the straws. The position matters to ensure that the lady bug could climb up and down. Then, I put in the yarn.

[caption id="attachment_55" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Positioning the Straws and Yarn"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-55" title="08_friction_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_03.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Positioning the Straws and Yarn&quot;" width="300" height="216" /></a>[/caption]

Finally, we went to find a door knob. All we had to do then was just alternately pulling the left and right side of the yarn with the right angle and our ladybug climbed up. As soon as we let the yarn loose, the ladybug would slide down.

[caption id="attachment_56" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Here Comes our Ladybug!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-56" title="08_friction_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/08_friction_04.jpg?w=225" alt="&quot;Here Comes our Ladybug!&quot;" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Now, all we need to find is just a place with 2 hooks so that we could have 2 competing ladybugs and see which one is the fastest!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Box &#039;Em!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/18/box-em/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Aug 2010 06:11:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=61</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Obviously, the little guy still hasn't got over his <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/11/wait-mr-postman/" target="_blank">new hobby</a> of putting things into any box. When he saw me carrying an empty tissue box, he quickly snatched it. He shook the box, and took a peek inside. Then, he looked around, as if looking for something small enough to stuff his new box.

I gave him some clothes pegs and he was straight away one happy chap!

[caption id="attachment_63" align="aligncenter" width="199" caption="To box or not to box..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/09_box_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-63" title="09_box_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/09_box_01.jpg?w=199" alt="&quot;To box or not to box...&quot;" width="199" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He was so excited about this whole boxing things that he started looking at the possibility of putting himself into the box, too!

[caption id="attachment_64" align="aligncenter" width="201" caption="Robo-box in Action!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/09_box_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-64 " title="09_box_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/09_box_02.jpg?w=201" alt="" width="201" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was kinda cute when he walked around with the box on one of his feet. He also loved the sound when he stomp his foot, together with the box.

Now I'm tempted to get him another box so that he could have similar boxes on both feet. Can't wait to finish another box of tissue!!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>10_turtle_04</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/18/turtlely-awesome-egg-carton/10_turtle_04/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Aug 2010 06:32:30 +0000</pubDate>

		<item>
		<title>Turtlely Awesome Egg Carton!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/18/turtlely-awesome-egg-carton/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 Aug 2010 06:33:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=69</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I still remember how I was grinning ear to ear after my trip to Ya Kun Kaya Toast the other day. The generous lady at the counter granted my wish of having egg cartons, without the eggs! It was like winning a prize! You see, I've been wanting to make something from egg cartons, but the thought of having to buy a lot of eggs always scares me! I do bake occasionally. Yet, unless I have to feed half a dozen people or more, I don't think I would ever finish the eggs fast enough!

Anyway, I brought home 2 egg cartons. I was so excited that it took me quite some time to decide which one I would want to make first. In the end, I blindly took one paint out from the box. I've got myself green paint. Ha! It wasn't difficult to decide then! A turtle we should make!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg carton</li>
	<li>paper (for the limbs, we chose orange)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>glue (you could also use clear tapes)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>paint</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

[caption id="attachment_70" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-70" title="10_turtle_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_01.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Getting ready&quot;" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

First, we cut out one egg carton.

[caption id="attachment_71" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One egg carton..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-71" title="10_turtle_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_02.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;One egg carton...&quot;" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Next, I let the little guy painted it. He used the brush, but after a while, he decided to use his fingers instead. Still, he was perfectly happy with what he was doing. He even looked proud of his artistic achievement!

[caption id="attachment_72" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Go, Green!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-72" title="10_turtle_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_03.jpg?w=225" alt="&quot;Go, Green!&quot;" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The last touch was to add the head and four limbs. We used orange paper for all. I helped him draw the eyes and mouth, too. See how cute it looks!

[caption id="attachment_73" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Turtlely Awesome, ain&#039;t I!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-73" title="10_turtle_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/10_turtle_04.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Turtlely Awesome!&quot;" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>69</wp:post_id>

		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=77</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We recently watched Toy Story 3. There was a scene where Andy played with a rocket made out of a box. When I watched that, I knew I got to make something similar for the little guy!

So, the hunt for the right box was on ever since we stepped out of the cinema. It wasn't that easy, I tell ya! It was either I couldn't find the right size or I could not carry it home (it became tricky as I always have the little guy tailing me).

Thankfully, we didn't really have to wait for long. It was one fine evening and my hubby brought home an empty laptop box. It was just the right size and it was light enough for the little guy to carry around.

[caption id="attachment_79" align="aligncenter" width="203" caption="Found the box!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-79" title="12_rocket_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_01.jpg?w=203" alt="&quot;Found the box!&quot;" width="203" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

So off we went to make our own rocket.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>empty cardboard box</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>paper plates</li>
	<li>muffin liners</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out one big circle in the middle. It fitted the little guy nicely. He could easily bring it up and down 'round his waist.

[caption id="attachment_81" align="aligncenter" width="218" caption="Testing the Big Circle"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-81" title="12_rocket_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_02.jpg?w=218" alt="&quot;Testing the Big Circle&quot;" width="218" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Then, we prepared the paper plates for the wings and the muffin liners for the rocket base. I realised I should have made a cone for the top. Too bad the little guy was getting a bit impatient by then. I had no choice but to quickly get the rocket ready.

[caption id="attachment_82" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Assembling in progress"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-82" title="12_rocket_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_031.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Assembling in progress&quot;" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_83" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Tada!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-83" title="12_rocket_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/12_rocket_04.jpg?w=300" alt="&quot;Tada!&quot;" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I thought it would look nicer if only I could have the chance to wrap it with aluminium foil! But, well, the little guy just couldn't wait to play with it!

To infinity and beyond... buzz!!!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Jovial Jellyfish</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/20/jovial-jellyfish/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 20 Aug 2010 06:04:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=90</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We had some bubble wraps lying around from the laptop box that my husband brought home the other day. Whenever they caught my eyes, I'd stop and pop some of the bubbles. I simply love popping bubble wraps! Too bad no one at home seems to share my excitement yet. Or maybe I should enjoy this period, before anyone fights with me for bubbles to pop!

Anyway, I thought I would spare some bubble wraps for the little guy and make something fun to play with... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg carton</li>
	<li>bubble wrap (for the tentacles)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>glue (you could also use clear tapes)</li>
	<li>paper (for the eyes, or you could also get some wiggle eyes)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>paint</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out one egg carton to paint. Like usual, I let the little guy do the painting.

[caption id="attachment_91" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Painting it red..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/13_jellyfish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-91" title="13_jellyfish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/13_jellyfish_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Painting it red..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Ever since I introduced him to paint brush, he seems to like it a lot. Every time he sees me taking out the brush, he gets excited. Gone has the day of finger painting! He doesn't even like it when he has a drop of paint on his finger! He would start talking gibberish, asking me to clean it or at least, pass him a wet tissue.

Whenever he sees me taking out the paint bottles, he would search for the brush. He would go near the drawer where I usually keep the brush and try to reach it. Sometimes he even went all out, finding a stool to help himself reach the drawer. So, brushes he shall get... Well, I guess that's okay, as long as he doesn't poke anyone or any part of his body with that long brush. Of course, he thought it wouldn't be fun if he didn't poke  the egg carton. Like this...

[caption id="attachment_92" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Poor jellyfish..."]<img class="size-medium wp-image-92" title="13_jellyfish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/13_jellyfish_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Poor jellyfish" width="300" height="225" />[/caption]

That explains why our jellyfish has a hole on the head... :S For a while, I thought of getting another egg carton and doing it all over.

But, guess what, it turned out really cute after we pasted the bubble wrap tentacles and eyes! I bet it wouldn't look as cute if the little guy didn't poke the head! Hee hee...

[caption id="attachment_93" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Our jovial jellyfish"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/13_jellyfish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-93" title="13_jellyfish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/13_jellyfish_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Our jovial jellyfish" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>90</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-20 06:04:46</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-20 06:04:46</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>jovial-jellyfish</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>

		<title>His Very Own Coffee Bear</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/his-very-own-coffee-bear/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 09:38:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paper-plate"><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=105</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Look what we found! This was probably the very first craft he made.

It was very simple, even for a 14-month old. Just give him a paper plate with a picture. We chose bear. Paint the bear with glue and let him sprinkle some coffee powder onto the plate. Teach him how to shake the powder inside the plate, too. It would surely get him to giggle! Let it dry and pat any excess.

Voila! A coffee bear with nice smell and texture!

[caption id="attachment_106" align="aligncenter" width="170" caption="Beary Beary Easy Craft"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/16_coffee_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-106" title="16_coffee_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/16_coffee_01.jpg?w=170" alt="Beary Beary Easy Craft" width="170" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We also made another one using tea from tea bags. This time round I got the honor of having my husband to draw for the little guy. That easily guarantees 100% cuteness! Even if it was an owl!

[caption id="attachment_107" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Sprinkle and Spread..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/16_coffee_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-107" title="16_coffee_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/16_coffee_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Sprinkle and Spread" width="300" height="257" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_108" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Hoot... hoot..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/16_coffee_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-108" title="16_coffee_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/16_coffee_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Hoot... hoot..." width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>105</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-23 09:38:07</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>his-very-own-coffee-bear</wp:post_name>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Butterfly in the House]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Butterfly in the House</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/fly-butterfly/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 10:05:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paper-plate"><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=103</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>Bah-teh-flai... bah-teh-flai...</em>

It's kinda difficult to encourage the little guy to say butterfly when he doesn't see butterflies that often. Back when I was a kid, it wasn't that tough to find butterfly. Just step outside and chances are you would get to see at least one within less than 5 minutes.There were even times when I kept caterpillars to observe the whole metamorphosis (uhm, except that I usually missed the last part.. :P butterfly flies... what do you expect?!)

Occasionally, we do get to see butterflies here. Not enough, though. We've got to count on butterfly parks to see butterflies frequent enough...

Hey, that calls for a craft-making time!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>paper plate (for the wings)</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>food coloring</li>
	<li>self-raising flour</li>
	<li>salt</li>
	<li>water</li>
	<li>toilet roll</li>
	<li>brochures/newspaper (to decorate)</li>
</ol>
<ol>
	<li>paint</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we prepared our puffy paint. We mixed equal amount of  self-raising flour and salt. Then we added some water to make it into paste. Using a few little drops of food coloring, we made several colors to play with.

We also drew 2 curves on the paper plate.

[caption id="attachment_111" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-111" title="15_butterfly_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

In case you're wondering why we had another paper with a picture of butterfly. Well, it was more to get him used to painting with puffy paint. Trust me, for a boy who kept saying "Eekss... " whenever he dipped his fingers inside, that was necessary! It also served well to distract him when I needed to cut the paper plate later on.

[caption id="attachment_112" align="aligncenter" width="256" caption="Sticky paint.. (for now)"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-112" title="15_butterfly_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_02.jpg?w=256" alt="Sticky paint.. (for now)" width="256" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

After a while, he found that mixing colors was more fun.

[caption id="attachment_113" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Butterfly in my palette"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-113" title="15_butterfly_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Butterfly in my palette" width="300" height="215" /></a>[/caption]

Hehehe.. but that doesn't mean he didn't proceed to the next stage, which was to paint the paper plate.

[caption id="attachment_114" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Preparing the wings"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-114" title="15_butterfly_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Preparing the wings" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

No doubt, it was super messy when he was done painting. That explains why I didn't get to take any pictures. I was worried that he would start hunting the camera with his sticky fingers!

Anyway, basically, after cleaning up, we put the colored paper plate inside the microwave for about a few seconds. Of course, the paint instantly puffed. Nice and dry!

We called it a day after cutting the wings out. The following day, the little guy continued. We glued some torn brochures onto an empty toilet roll. I also helped him to stick the eyes. I was so tempted to use wiggly eyes, but I also didn't want the wiggly eyes to drop off and end up in the little guy's mouth.

[caption id="attachment_115" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready for part 2"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-115" title="15_butterfly_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready for part 2" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

We also put on 2 antennas. Now we've got a butterfly in the house!

[caption id="attachment_116" align="aligncenter" width="244" caption="Butterfly in the House"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-116" title="15_butterfly_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/15_butterfly_06.jpg?w=244" alt="Butterfly in the House" width="244" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>103</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>fly-butterfly</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<title>Little Dino in 3D</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/little-dino-in-3d/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 10:13:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=120</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[They make everything in 3D nowadays... So, my dear husband made this lovely dinosaur using Playdoh.

[caption id="attachment_121" align="aligncenter" width="265" caption="Little Dino in 3D"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/17_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-121" title="17_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/17_dino_01.jpg?w=265" alt="Little Dino in 3D" width="265" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

That was surely a work of art!

The little guy, on the other hand, is a strong believer that dinosaurs have gone extinct. Wanna guess how long that poor little dino survive?

Barely 5 minutes after I kept the camera away! I couldn't even bear to put up the "after" pictures!]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Grafitti Art</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/grafitti-art/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 10:17:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=124</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Look what happened when someone was feeling arty-crafty.

[caption id="attachment_125" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Graffiti Art by Yours Truly"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/18_wall_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-125" title="18_wall_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/18_wall_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Graffiti Art by Yours Truly" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Apparently, he found one big dot and he colored it. He then continued. To the right.. then, to the left... up and down.

And, no, it wasn't a piece of paper. It was our WALL.

Lesson learned: Never ever leave a toddler with a crayon!

*<em>I'm so glad they have invented washable crayons!</em>*

Can't imagine if he used marker, instead! Or maybe that would be the easiest and fastest way to get my husband to repaint the whole house. Hee hee.. *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_128" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="On Paper, thankfully"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/18_wall_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-128" title="18_wall_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/18_wall_02.jpg?w=225" alt="On Paper, thankfully" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>124</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-23 18:17:57</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<title>19_ladybug_01</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/ladybugs-in-our-garden/19_ladybug_01/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 10:34:10 +0000</pubDate>

		<item>
		<title>Ladybugs in Our Garden</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/ladybugs-in-our-garden/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 10:43:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=132</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Upon finding out the <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/grafitti-art/" target="_blank">graffiti art</a>, I knew that taking away his crayon would not help. Instead, I gave him a piece of paper. I taught him how to color sideways, i.e. using the side, rather than the tip of the crayon. To him, it was a novelty. So, he spared me from his tantrum. Phewwww.... :)

[caption id="attachment_133" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Art of Distraction"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-133" title="19_ladybug_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Art of Distraction" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Now... what crosses your mind when you saw that picture? Me, I saw a patch of grass! Just need some bugs to make it more colorful!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>red paper</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>white paper (for the eyes, or you could also get some wiggle eyes)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>bottle caps</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out the wings from the red paper. Then, we glued them on the bottle caps.

[caption id="attachment_134" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Unidentified Bugs"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-134" title="19_ladybug_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Unidentified Bugs" width="300" height="206" /></a>[/caption]

Then, while fervently praying that the little guy would not decide to use the marker anywhere else, I taught him how to make the spots on the wings.

[caption id="attachment_135" align="aligncenter" width="210" caption="Dot.. dot..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-135" title="19_ladybug_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_03.jpg?w=210" alt="Dot.. dot..." width="210" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I helped him paste the eyes and there you go, ladybugs in our garden!

[caption id="attachment_136" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ladybugs in Our Garden"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-136" title="19_ladybug_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/19_ladybug_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Ladybugs in Our Garden" width="300" height="202" /></a>[/caption]

Did the markers claim any victims, you ask? Nope. Yayy... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<item>
		<title>Do-It-Yourself Tent and Tunnel</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/23/do-it-yourself-tent-and-tunnel/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 23 Aug 2010 10:51:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=138</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Who needs expensive tunnel and tent if you can build your own?

[caption id="attachment_139" align="aligncenter" width="226" caption="Come, Visit My Tunnel"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/20_tent_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-139" title="20_tent_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/20_tent_01.jpg?w=226" alt="Come, Visit My Tunnel" width="226" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

		<item>
		<title>It&#039;s Magic! Pepper Magic!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/26/its-magic-pepper-magic/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Aug 2010 13:45:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=143</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We decided to try out this <a href="http://michellesjournalcorner.blogspot.com/2010/07/preschool-science-pepper-and-dish-soap.html" target="_blank">Pepper and Dish Soap Experiment</a>. After reading that entry, it was just so hard to resist trying it out. I know the little guy would love it. As long as it involves water, he would definitely love to watch what I would be doing with full attention!

The fact that my little guy is not even 2 years old makes my life easier. At least for now, I have a valid reason why I could skip the part about explaining the science behind. Hee hee...

So... there we were, in the living room, ready to get wet and peppery. I let the little guy use our pepper grinder. He was so excited about it. He kept twisting and twisting, spreading pepper all over the place. Both of us sneezed a few times...

[caption id="attachment_144" align="aligncenter" width="192" caption="Twisting Left and Right"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/21_pepper_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-144" title="21_pepper_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/21_pepper_01.jpg?w=192" alt="Twisting Left and Right" width="192" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And when he finally got to dip his fingers and watch how the pepper floated away, he went "Wowwww..." with his cutest voice.

[caption id="attachment_145" align="aligncenter" width="186" caption="Magic Fingers!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/21_pepper_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-145" title="21_pepper_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/21_pepper_02.jpg?w=186" alt="Magic Fingers!" width="186" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hahaha... he must be impressed with himself! No doubt. I was very impressed, myself! I wish  they taught all this stuff back in my school days... I would probably have been a more diligent student!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"600";s:6:"height";s:3:"751";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:22:"height='96' width='76'";s:4:"file";s:93:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/08/22_caterpillar_04.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1280320339";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:3:"125";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:17:"0.033333333333333";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_image_alt</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[An Even More Abstract Caterpillar]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Creepy Caterpillar</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/26/creepy-caterpillar/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 26 Aug 2010 15:19:04 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=148</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Say, who doesn't like Eric Carle's famous book, <a href="http://www.eric-carle.com/rev-VHC.html" target="_blank">The Very Hungry Caterpillar</a>? Both the little guy and I love this book, even though we don't really own one.

I think Eric Carle simply knows how to win children's hearts through his choices of colors. And don't forget about all those fruits! One apple, two plums, and so on... it is just the perfect book to accompany the little guy while having his meal. I know, not a very good practice, but well... it works!

Since we still have some egg cartons, we thought it would be nice to have a very hungry caterpillar that we could call our own.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg cartons</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>white paper (for the eyes, or you could also get some wiggle eyes)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>pipe cleaners</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_149" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting Ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-149" title="22_caterpillar_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting Ready" width="300" height="183" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out 4 egg cartons to paint.

Next was to color the egg cartons. The little guy already knew what to do the moment he saw the paint brush.

[caption id="attachment_150" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="Starting Off with Green"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-150" title="22_caterpillar_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_02.jpg?w=198" alt="Starting Off with Green" width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We didn't use palette this time round. We used baking tray to put our paint. When the little guy happily swept his brush to color his caterpillar, I was so excited to see another caterpillar on the tray... :)

[caption id="attachment_151" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Caterpillar on a Tray"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-151" title="22_caterpillar_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Caterpillar on a Tray" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, to this little guy, painting would not be fun if nothing ended on your fingers, hands or even face!

[caption id="attachment_152" align="aligncenter" width="239" caption="Face Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-152" title="22_caterpillar_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_04.jpg?w=239" alt="Face Painting" width="239" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Okie, I admit it. He actually only did the green one on his cheek. I was responsible for that red nose... *grinz*

Still, I say he loved how he looked then!

[caption id="attachment_153" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Loving it!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-153" title="22_caterpillar_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Loving it!" width="300" height="289" /></a>[/caption]

Once we were done coloring, I helped him put on the eyes and antennae. This how our caterpillar looks:

[caption id="attachment_154" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Creepy Caterpillar"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-154" title="22_caterpillar_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Creepy Caterpillar" width="300" height="213" /></a>[/caption]

There were some leftover on the baking tray. So, we took some papers to stamp on it. Check out what we've got on our first and second attempts!

[caption id="attachment_155" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Very Abstract Caterpillar"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-155" title="22_caterpillar_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_07.jpg?w=300" alt="A Very Abstract Caterpillar" width="300" height="219" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_156" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="An Even More Abstract Caterpillar"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-156" title="22_caterpillar_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/22_caterpillar_08.jpg?w=300" alt="An Even More Abstract Caterpillar" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Wheee... Now we have a creepy caterpillar and 2 abstract caterpillars! We love all our caterpillars!

Obviously, none of them was hungry. But we surely were hungry after all the hard work!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Eencey Weencey Spidey</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/28/eencey-weencey-spidey/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 28 Aug 2010 07:54:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=165</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Lately, the little guy had been asking for the markers. Of course, such episodes usually ended up with some meltdowns. I know if I let him have the markers, something is bound to be stained. That is why I rarely let him play with markers, unless I'm 100% confident that I would be next to him, watching every movement he makes with each marker.

Like when we made this spidey...

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg cartons</li>
	<li>white paper (wiggle eyes work great, too!)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>black wool thread</li>
	<li>glue</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out an egg carton. Only then I quietly handed the marker to the little guy. I kept a watchful eye, while praying that he would not stain anything.

[caption id="attachment_166" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Preparing his ammunition..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-166" title="24_spider_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_01.jpg?w=212" alt="Preparing his ammunition..." width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

A few minutes passed by... he had diligently completed the coloring part. He made some scribbles on a cardboard, but nowhere else... pheww...

[caption id="attachment_167" align="aligncenter" width="213" caption="Almost done!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-167" title="24_spider_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_02.jpg?w=213" alt="Almost done!" width="213" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He continued scribbling when I was busy putting on the eyes and legs.

[caption id="attachment_168" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Hullo, Spidey!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-168" title="24_spider_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Hullo, Spidey!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

He scribbled quite a good deal on the cardboard. See what we could even make out of that cardboard!

[caption id="attachment_169" align="aligncenter" width="222" caption="Psst... I&#039;m undercover!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-169" title="24_spider_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/24_spider_03.jpg?w=222" alt="Psst... I'm undercover!" width="222" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>eencey-weencey-spidey</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[His Fave Part: Corner Parking Space]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>174</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-28 16:04:01</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-28 08:04:01</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>25_racetrack_02</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>172</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/25_racetrack_02.jpg</wp:attachment_url>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[His Fave Part: Corner Parking Space]]></wp:meta_value>

		<item>
		<title>Race Me, If You Dare...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/28/race-me-if-you-dare/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 28 Aug 2010 08:10:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=172</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It actually made a difference when you have a husband who appreciates the little kid inside you.

Like my husband.

He called it "creativity". I called it...well, having fun and sharing the fun with the little guy.

Anyway, ever since he noticed that I was into cardboard, he brought home some from his office. He also made sure that whenever he opened any package, he kept the cardboard intact.

Like this keyboard box, which I turned into a racing track... :)

[caption id="attachment_173" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Vroom... vroom..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/25_racetrack_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-173" title="25_racetrack_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/25_racetrack_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Vroom... vroom..." width="300" height="246" /></a>[/caption]

You bet, the little guy loves it! He even loves the corner parking space the most. And to think that I almost cut that part out! Hee hee... It was initially the compartment for the keyboard's USB receiver, I think... Just add a door, and it nicely changed into a parking space... :)

[caption id="attachment_174" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="His Fave Part: Corner Parking Space"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/25_racetrack_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-174" title="25_racetrack_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/25_racetrack_02.jpg?w=300" alt="His Fave Part: Corner Parking Space" width="300" height="275" /></a>[/caption]

Now, if you could just excuse me, I need to figure out what to do with the rest of the card boards... :S Can't risk to have the house turn into a junk yard!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_image_alt</wp:meta_key>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>A Fishy Tale</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/29/a-fishy-tale/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 Aug 2010 08:25:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=182</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It was raining outside then. A very heavy rain... and there was no way we could go out to the playground. Even stepping out of the door could get us wet!

To me, I was grateful we were indoor. Safe and dry. To the little guy, it was such a torture when he couldn't get out of the house! Well, I understand that feeling... If I have as much energy as he has, I would probably throw a fit, too.

Out were all our kits... just to ensure that nobody got frustrated (the little guy, for not being able to go out... me, for having to deal with his tantrum).  Since it was all wet outside, I couldn't help but to think about making a fish... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg cartons</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>cotton buds</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out one and a half egg carton. The half part was for the tail.

[caption id="attachment_183" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Saved for the rainy day"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-183" title="27_fish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Saved for the rainy day" width="300" height="202" /></a>[/caption]

I thought it would be a great time to introduce him to cotton bud painting. Just for a change from the usual paint brush.

<strong>Red Flag:</strong>

When I introduced him to cotton bud painting, I was perfectly sure that he wouldn't stick the cotton buds up his nose or ears!

[caption id="attachment_185" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Cotton bud, his new magic wand"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-185" title="27_fish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Cotton bud, his new magic wand" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad, after a while, he didn't seem to be interested in the cotton buds anymore. He took the paint brush and showed his loyalty to the ol' paint brush.

[caption id="attachment_186" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Back to the brush"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-186" title="27_fish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Back to the brush" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

While he was busy painting, I took one cotton bud and swapped it on a paper. I think it looked pretty artistic. Won't you agree with me?

[caption id="attachment_187" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Mommy&#039;s artwork"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-187" title="27_fish_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Mommy's artwork" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, the little guy has always had this philosophy that "everything that mommy touches or has must be more interesting than anything else". He took over the cotton bud and started making dots on my artwork.

[caption id="attachment_188" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Mine! Mine! Mine!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-188" title="27_fish_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_05.jpg?w=225" alt="Mine! Mine! Mine!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I thought to myself, there goes my masterpiece. But hey, look what we have when he was done! A nice cloud and  raindrops... :)

[caption id="attachment_189" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="We&#039;ve got raindrops!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-189" title="27_fish_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_06.jpg?w=300" alt="We've got raindrops!" width="300" height="292" /></a>[/caption]

And don't forget about the little fish!

[caption id="attachment_190" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fish Ahoy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-190" title="27_fish_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/27_fish_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Fish Ahoy!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>182</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-29 16:25:20</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-29 08:25:20</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>a-fishy-tale</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1283145817]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
