		<item>
		<title>Track Ball Painting</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/29/track-ball-painting/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 29 Aug 2010 08:41:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=192</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I don't know about you, but it's tough to keep my little guy away from all the gadgets around the house.

At the tender age of 1, he already knew his way to our phones, keyboards, remote controls, and so on. And don't ever think of fooling him with a broken gadget! We tried giving him an old, broken mobile phone... it only took him a day to get bored of it! I guess the LEDs and all the sound these gadgets made were the selling points.

When my husband brought home his trackball mouse, we both know it may not be a great idea. But, little did he know what happened to it next... *<em>grinz</em>*

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>ball (we used the ball from the trackball mouse!)</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>baking tray</li>
	<li>glue and paper (or stickers)</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_193" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A ball and a paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-193" title="28_ball_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_01.jpg?w=300" alt="A ball and a paint" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the fun begin!</strong>

We started it off by putting the paper on a baking tray and putting a few drops of paint on the paper.

By then, the little guy was already very anxious to know what we would be doing with the ball. The ball was already on his hand.

I showed him how we could make a nice paint smear effect by rolling the ball left and right, up and down.

At first, he chose to simply rub the ball across...

[caption id="attachment_194" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Rub-a-dub-dub..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-194" title="28_ball_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Rub-a-dub-dub..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Then, it got more interesting when he knew he could simply lift up the tray and let the ball roll around.

[caption id="attachment_195" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A nice paint smear effect!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-195" title="28_ball_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A nice paint smear effect!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

When we were done, we cut out some stars from a paper. Like usual, the little guy was excited about using a glue stick.

[caption id="attachment_196" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Sticking stars"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-196" title="28_ball_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Sticking stars" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We pasted the stars... and here what we have to frame... :)

[caption id="attachment_197" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to frame"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-197" title="28_ball_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/28_ball_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready to frame" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>192</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-29 16:41:10</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-29 08:41:10</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>track-ball-painting</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1283145716]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Cat and Mouse Problem</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/30/cat-and-mouse-problem/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Aug 2010 05:17:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Primary School]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="primary-school"><![CDATA[Primary School]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=200</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Believe it or not... the following is a question posed to primary school students in Singapore:

<em>If a single cat catches two mice in three days, how many cats would it take to catch 100 mice in 30 days?</em>

My husband and I read it on <a href="http://www.straitstimes.com/" target="_blank">The Straits Times</a> (Saturday, Aug 28 2010). When we first saw that question, it was just as scary as watching another episode of a horror movie!

Of course, having completed our own primary school examination years ago, we managed to put an answer next to that question mark. Yet, we couldn't confidently say that we would be able to answer that question if we were still in primary school.

But, anyway... reading that question near midnight tickled us to make jokes out of it! We concluded that the most sensible answer to that question would be:

<strong>It depends.</strong>

Seriously, it does! Think about the following:
<ol>
	<li>What if we could make the cats work overtime? Say, if we offer them more perks, maybe a single cat could catch more in less than 3 days...</li>
	<li>What if the environmental agency intervenes? You see, 100 mice is a serious problem! You can't simply wait for 30 days!</li>
	<li>Shouldn't we take into account the diminishing marginal utility? The cats might no longer care about any single mouse by the time they reach the 10th day!</li>
	<li>What if this whole thing about cat catching mouse is considered as cruelty to animals? No, I'm not even talking about the mice. Although I'm no fan of cats, I'm concerned about the cats here! Who knows... mice could pose hazards for cats!</li>
	<li>What types of cats and mice are we talking about here? It's been nearly 70 years and Tom still hasn't managed to catch Jerry!</li>
</ol>
Hee hee... you could see how lame we've become by the time we listed number 5! But here's the bottom line:

To all our fellow parents, good luck to all of us! If you think you're done with all those math problems once you left your school days, think again... And it doesn't get easier!

Okie... I can safely assume if, at this point, you are still scrolling down the entry, you may still be curious about the answer to the above question ... :) Here's the answer to guarantee you a good night sleep tonight:

It's five. We need five cats to catch 100 mice in 30 days. You could trust me on that. That's the model answer... :)

Or are you just anxious? Here's something to make you feel better.

The above question was a brain teaser for primary school students to see if they qualify for Gifted Education Programme... :) Now don't get too worried about your kids' future. Tomorrow will take care of itself... ;)<em> </em><em></em>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/30/gone-fishin/29_fish_02/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Aug 2010 05:27:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_02.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[The more fishes, the merrier]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>207</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-30 13:27:01</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-30 05:27:01</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>29_fish_02</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>203</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_02.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
								<wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Gone Fishin&#039;</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/30/gone-fishin/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 Aug 2010 05:38:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=203</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Obviously, we were still into fishes. Another rainy day, another fish game to play... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>colored papers</li>
	<li>marker (to draw the eyes)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>double tape</li>
	<li>magnet</li>
	<li>chopsticks</li>
	<li>yarn</li>
</ol>
<strong>Red Flag:</strong>

I might not consider starting this project with the little guy if I thought he might be interested to poke himself or anyone with chopsticks.

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we drew a fish on a colored paper.

[caption id="attachment_206" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One fish..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-206" title="29_fish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_01.jpg?w=300" alt="One fish..." width="300" height="231" /></a>[/caption]

I cut it out and used it as a template to cut out more fishes using other colored papers.

[caption id="attachment_207" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The more fishes, the merrier"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-207" title="29_fish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The more fishes, the merrier" width="300" height="227" /></a>[/caption]

We attached magnet behind each fish using double tape.

[caption id="attachment_208" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Magnet on our fish"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-208" title="29_fish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Magnet on our fish" width="300" height="233" /></a>[/caption]

We then prepared our fishing rod using chopstick, yarn, double tape and magnet.

[caption id="attachment_209" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The fishing rod"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-209" title="29_fish_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_04.jpg?w=300" alt="The fishing rod" width="300" height="184" /></a>[/caption]

It didn't take a long time to get the little guy into fishing. He truly enjoyed catching and throwing the fishes back.

[caption id="attachment_211" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Catch..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-211" title="29_fish_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Catch..." width="300" height="229" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_210" align="aligncenter" width="216" caption=".. and throw back"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-210" title="29_fish_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_05.jpg?w=216" alt=".. and throw back" width="216" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He kept fishing every now and then. It's one great pastime to him! Sometimes we put the fishes on a tray, pretending that it was a pond.

[caption id="attachment_212" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Our little pond"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-212" title="29_fish_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Our little pond" width="300" height="210" /></a>[/caption]

We also learned that it was great to make lots of fishes. Sometimes, the little guy could turn murderous. Instead of throwing the fish back, he would just tear it into pieces... :S

[caption id="attachment_213" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Was a fish..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-213" title="29_fish_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/29_fish_08.jpg?w=300" alt="Was a fish..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>203</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-08-30 13:38:17</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-08-30 05:38:17</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<item>
		<title>Chalk-a-Sketch!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/31/chalk-a-sketch/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 Aug 2010 09:28:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=216</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The last time we visited IKEA, this box of chalks was among the things we bought. Nothing fancy, I'd say. But think of the possibilities of things that we could do with the chalks!

[caption id="attachment_217" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Our little treasure"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-217" title="30_chalk_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Our little treasure" width="300" height="260" /></a>[/caption]

I know, in case you're wondering if I had actually failed to notice, it obviously shows that the chalks are not meant for children under 3. But, well, for once, could I just decide to be a little adventurous with the little guy, while still trying my best to keep him safe? Or perhaps, it should be the other way round: keeping the chalks safe from being swallowed by my little monster? Hee hee...

So, off we went outside the gate. After looking at what I could do with those colorful chalks, the little guy happily took one blue chalk and started doodling next to me. He didn't seem to mind about getting dirty! For a toddler who cries "Eeeks!" every time a drop of paint wet his fingers, that was incredible!

[caption id="attachment_218" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Getting down and dirty"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-218" title="30_chalk_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Getting down and dirty" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He even laughed when he saw his "blue" hand.

[caption id="attachment_219" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Something bluey on my hand!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-219" title="30_chalk_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Something bluey on my hand!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Boy, didn't we have so much fun with the chalks!

And, certainly, when you have someone who is artistic in your family, it's just hard not to pull him in to join the fun. So, after enough nudging, I managed to get my husband to draw: an elephant!

[caption id="attachment_220" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="An artist at work"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-220" title="30_chalk_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_04.jpg?w=300" alt="An artist at work" width="300" height="193" /></a>[/caption]

It didn't take long for him to complete his masterpiece. The cutest elephant I've ever seen! The little guy added some blue streaks above the elephant's head, too. Those streaks  turned out nice, like a splash of water on the elephant.

My contribution? Well.. I drew the grass... *<em>wink, wink</em>*

The little guy, however, thought that the masterpiece was not yet completed. He took his magic blue chalk again, and started doodling again.

[caption id="attachment_226" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="More bluey..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_061.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-226" title="30_chalk_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_061.jpg?w=300" alt="More bluey..." width="300" height="254" /></a>[/caption]

Nevertheless, I still think the elephant, including all the out-of-place blue streaks, is worth preserving. And I mean, keeping it for a day or two. Or more... a few weeks, perhaps. A month...

So, you could imagine how my heart broke when my husband decided that it was time to clean up. Sob sob... time to wave bye-bye to the poor elephant... &gt;_&lt;

Unlike me, the little guy got excited about the whole cleaning thing. He took that pail of water and splash! There went our elephant...

[caption id="attachment_222" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Farewell, Elephant!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-222" title="30_chalk_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Farewell, Elephant!" width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption]

Sob sob... give me back my elephant.

[caption id="attachment_223" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The last memory of our elephant"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-223 " title="30_chalk_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/08/30_chalk_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The last memory of our elephant" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<title>31_pig_05</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/02/the-two-little-pigs/31_pig_05/</link>

		<item>
		<title>The Two Little Pigs</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/02/the-two-little-pigs/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Sep 2010 04:34:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=230</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy is one of those picky eaters who need to be entertained during meal times. I'm not complaining about how much or how little he eats. It's just that it's so difficult to keep him in his high chair.

So, since early this year, our dining table has changed its look into... uhm, well, like a kids' table!

Other than displaying the little guy's artworks (I've run out of perfect wall space  to display them...), it also has some pictures of cute farm animals and fruits. As he slowly learns to speak, these pictures turn into flashcards. He would randomly point a picture and try to impress me with any new words he learns.

Sometimes he scores... like when he pointed his fave fruit, banana and said, "nana..."

Sometimes he didn't... like when he continued pointing at all the other pictures while still saying "nana..." Hee hee...

Still, not bad for an effort to make him stay seated for at least 5 more minutes...

Until, one day, he pointed to one picture of a pinkish piglet and while putting on his cheekiest smile, said "mama..."

Ouch... *<em>speechless</em>*...

Hahaha... Kids say the darndest things, don't they! Was it because I was wearing pink ? Or maybe that's how I should know if I've been eating or acting like a pig.. :P

Anyway, since he was into piglet, why not make something <em>piglet-y</em>?

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg cartons</li>
	<li>white paper (wiggle eyes work great, too!)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>rubber bands</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_231" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-231" title="31_pig_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready..." width="300" height="231" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out the egg cartons. The next step was of course, his favorite: coloring.

[caption id="attachment_232" align="aligncenter" width="175" caption="Red here, red there"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-232" title="31_pig_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_02.jpg?w=175" alt="Red here, red there" width="175" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Notice that we had 2 egg cartons? Yup, that's right. We painted 2 egg cartons red. I know, it's supposed to be pink for piglet. I was just so excited to start that I forgot about mixing in some white.

And, there you go, the first egg carton: Pretty Piglet

[caption id="attachment_233" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Oink!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-233" title="31_pig_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Oink!" width="300" height="243" /></a>[/caption]

And here's the second one: a piglet's snout!

[caption id="attachment_234" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Snout! Snout!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-234" title="31_pig_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Snout! Snout!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The two rubber bands on the side of the snout are for easy wear. Too bad it wasn't really that easy to get the little guy to pose with the snout. He ran away whenever I slipped one of the rubber bands on his ear.

If I could just trick him to wear the snout long enough to take a better picture... :S

[caption id="attachment_235" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="No snout for me!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-235" title="31_pig_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/31_pig_05.jpg?w=198" alt="No snout for me!" width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>230</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<item>
		<title>Feeling Crabby?</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/06/feeling-crabby/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Sep 2010 15:36:38 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Not anymore!

[caption id="attachment_242" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Eat-Me-Not!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/32_crab_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-242" title="32_crab_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/32_crab_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Eat-Me-Not!" width="300" height="216" /></a>[/caption]

Inspired by the chilli crab that we had a few weeks ago, we added a new little  creature to our egg carton animal collection.

It's pretty much similar to how we made our <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/18/turtlely-awesome-egg-carton/" target="_blank">turtle</a>. You can give it a try, too! :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>A Dino in the House!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/09/a-dino-in-the-house/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Sep 2010 04:20:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=245</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There's a dinosaur in our living room!

Yup, we thought dinosaurs went extinct years ago. But, now we have one in our living room.

It all started when we finally managed to collect 2 empty tissue boxes.

Let us bring you through the details.. :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>two empty tissue boxes</li>
	<li>paper (we used brochures, which happened to be green - perfect color!)</li>
	<li>markers</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_246" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="&quot;Hatching&quot; Equipment"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-246" title="33_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Hatching Equipment" width="300" height="248" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we glued a piece of paper underneath one tissue box. We then drew a dinosaur's footprint. A BIG one!

[caption id="attachment_247" align="aligncenter" width="201" caption="Dino&#039;s Footprint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-247" title="33_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_02.jpg?w=201" alt="Dino's Footprint" width="201" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We then made another dino's footprint using the other tissue box and another piece of paper.

Next, we cut the footprints out and look what we've got!

[caption id="attachment_248" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Pair of Feet!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-248" title="33_dino_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A Pair of Feet!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The best part was that we didn't need to wait for months or years for our little dino. And when he finally cracked out of his eggs, my, how he roared and stomped!

[caption id="attachment_249" align="aligncenter" width="168" caption="Roarr! Beware of the Little Dino!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-249" title="33_dino_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/33_dino_04.jpg?w=168" alt="Beware of the Little Dino!" width="168" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>Buzzy Bee!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/09/buzzy-bee/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Sep 2010 05:05:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=253</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's been some time since we last painted anything. Somehow the little guy lost his interest in painting... :(

But, it's time to make another bug! So, out we brought our egg cartons and art kit... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg cartons</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>white paper (for the wings)</li>
	<li>pipe cleaners</li>
	<li>clear tapes</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_254" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting bee-sy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-254" title="34_bee_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting bee-sy" width="300" height="195" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut out two egg cartons to paint. Take a closer look on our egg cartons. You would notice that we've put some clear tapes on certain parts.

[caption id="attachment_255" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Taping around"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-255" title="34_bee_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Taping around" width="300" height="261" /></a>[/caption]

The next part was of course, painting. Surprisingly, the little guy took the brush on his own and started painting. I guess, having been away from the brush and paint for quite some time makes him interested in painting again! :)

[caption id="attachment_256" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Hello, Yellow!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-256" title="34_bee_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Hello, Yellow!" width="300" height="214" /></a>[/caption]

There wasn't much to paint, actually. Yet, he was still into painting. So, he continued painting with the leftover on another piece of paper. Well, that was until he found out that the tapes on the egg cartons could be peeled off!

[caption id="attachment_257" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Peeling Off"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-257" title="34_bee_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_04.jpg?w=212" alt="Peeling Off" width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He was right, anyway. The tapes were meant to be peeled off. The areas covered by the tapes were to be painted black. We didn't use paint, though. <em>I </em>used marker. Notice it was "I", not "We"? Well, I took over for this part, as I didn't want our bee ended up more like a zebra. Or, worse, a black horse.

Next, we glued the pipe cleaners on the bee's head.

[caption id="attachment_258" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Antenna-Ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-258" title="34_bee_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Antenna-Ready" width="300" height="258" /></a>[/caption]

And lastly, we put on the wings. Tadaaa!

[caption id="attachment_259" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to buzz!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-259" title="34_bee_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/34_bee_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready to buzz!" width="300" height="228" /></a>[/caption]

Tempted to add a stinger, but well.. it might be too sharp for the little guy. So, with no stinger, our buzzy bee here is probably the friendliest bee in the neighborhood... hee heee... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Mini Portable Aquarium</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/14/mini-portable-aquarium/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 14 Sep 2010 05:09:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=266</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Thanks to the public holiday on Friday, we had an awesome long weekend last week... :)

It was pretty an eventful weekend for all three of us, even from Thursday night! We had a wedding dinner to attend on Thursday night, a half-day seminar on Saturday morning and an outing on Saturday afternoon.

It wasn't the little guy's first time to attend a wedding dinner. But I would say it might be the first time after he became so ... uhm, active (although sometimes I think "active" is an understatement). True enough, being a friendly and loud little chap, he shouldn't have any problem with the wedding dinner. There would be so much other noise that no one would actually be able to single out his noise anyway. Still, I sensed the need to get him to learn how to sit .. no, not demurely - <em>that's probably too much to ask for</em> - ... just quietly.

The half-day seminar was, of course, another thing to consider. I recalled that the two speakers are rather soft-spoken. Put the two of them plus our little guy in one room, and voila... you've got chaos!

So, there started our search for something fun to occupy our little guy. And look what we found at the bookstore.

[caption id="attachment_267" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The latest loot"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/36_aqua_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-267" title="36_aqua_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/36_aqua_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The latest loot" width="300" height="237" /></a>[/caption]

Cute, eh? Certainly it wouldn't be fun without the aquarium... ;)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>blue corrugated plastic board</li>
	<li>color papers</li>
	<li>stickers (ours was of sea creature theme!)</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_268" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/36_aqua_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-268" title="36_aqua_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/36_aqua_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready..." width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We chose blue corrugated board as that would spare us from having to color the whole board. Using the plastic board also turned out to be a great idea, as we could reuse the stickers... :)

We cut out the blue corrugated board to the size that can nicely fit into his toy bag. I'll share with you about the toy bag next time... :)

Then, we prepared the coral, seaweed, etc to decorate our "aquarium".

Although the stickers can definitely be reused after we stick them on the plastic surface, I wasn't that sure when we first started this project. I initially even thought of lining all of them with velcro! Anyway, in the end, I lined all the stickers with glossy-surfaced cards. So, the stickers didn't really stick on the board. The good thing is that I could show the little one how each different fish has different way of swimming. But the bad thing, they easily fall off... :(

[caption id="attachment_269" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Mini Portable Aquarium"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/36_aqua_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-269" title="36_aqua_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/36_aqua_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Mini Portable Aquarium" width="300" height="175" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy obviously loves it! At least, for the first few minutes each time I take it out from the bag... :P

Although it didn't really last him throughout the events on Thursday night and Saturday morning, it did keep him still for one <em>glorious </em>hour!

Or maybe less than an hour... I'm not sure now... :P Come to think of it, he kept switching from one toy to another. But the important thing was that he didn't make so much noise and he didn't go too far from us... :)

Any casualty, you ask? Well, on Thursday night, we lost one unidentified fish (I couldn't even remember how it looked!). And on Saturday morning, one tiny green starfish fell down and the little guy trampled on it. It was black when I found it, so it was immediately put off-duty from our aquarium.]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_id>278</wp:post_id>

								<wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Talking Dino</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/16/talking-dino/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 16 Sep 2010 04:37:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=273</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yes, we admit it. We are still into dinosaurs. And dragons.

And we've been keeping some empty cereal boxes for some fun since the last time we watched <a href="http://www.mistermaker.com/make/Cutting/Box_Puppet/step1" target="_blank">Mister Maker</a> on TV ... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>two empty cereal boxes</li>
	<li>white papers</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>clear tapes</li>
	<li>marker</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_274" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Another dino-hatching in progress..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-274" title="37_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Another dino-hatching in progress..." width="300" height="237" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We first wrapped the two boxes with white papers. The reason? Well, just because we know it is important to read the food labels, it doesn't mean we want to see any food labels all over our dino's face... :P

I let the little guy take over for the next part: coloring. Check out our new crayola washable finger paints! Not as thick and vivid as our previous paint collection, but most importantly, just as washable... :) Considering how skillful our little one in splattering paints all over our sofa and walls, we always know what to look for each time we buy paint for him!

[caption id="attachment_275" align="aligncenter" width="186" caption="Sticky and green... great recipe for Dino!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-275" title="37_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_02.jpg?w=186" alt="Sticky and green... great recipe for Dino!" width="186" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Once he was done, here how the boxes looked.

[caption id="attachment_276" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Dino-ready.. soon"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-276" title="37_dino_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Dino-ready.. soon" width="300" height="180" /></a>[/caption]

It surely looks sticky and wet, doesn't it? We let them dry on a dryer rack for a while.

And while I was away to put them on the dryer rack, this was what happened to our poor toilet.

[caption id="attachment_277" align="aligncenter" width="147" caption="Long Tail: His Masterpiece"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-277" title="37_dino_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_04.jpg?w=147" alt="Long Tail: His Masterpiece" width="147" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Lesson learnt? Never leave a toddler screaming for a tissue paper to clean his hands, even if they don't look dirty to you. If he asks for it, let him have it. Or else, he'll source for it somewhere else.

Anyway, once the boxes were dry, we put them together, using clear tapes as a hinge. We also added two eyes and two ears. We drew the nose... and there you go, our new dinosaur!

[caption id="attachment_278" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Silly-looking Dino"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-278" title="37_dino_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Silly-looking Dino" width="300" height="267" /></a>[/caption]

If you are tickled to say that it looks more like a cow that eats too much green than a dino, just keep it to yourself, will ya?! I promise I'll draw better next time... ^_^

It was a great idea to use small cereal boxes, after all. They fit our little guy's hands nicely and he loves putting his hand inside to open and close the dino's mouth.

Now all we needed to do next was to engage our "puppet master", aka my dear hubby. Trust me, he could even make our green co - uhm... dino dance!

[caption id="attachment_279" align="aligncenter" width="238" caption="Dino-dancing for the next Cultural Night"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-279" title="37_dino_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/37_dino_06.jpg?w=238" alt="Dino-dancing for the next Cultural Night" width="238" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Away for Meeting</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/20/away-for-meeting/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 20 Sep 2010 04:30:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=283</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The folding chairs are not in the usual place.

My soft toys are missing.

...

It's time for Detective Mommy to investigate. The little guy must be up to something!

[caption id="attachment_284" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Something is brewing..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/38_toy_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-284" title="38_toy_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/38_toy_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Something is brewing..." width="300" height="295" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, he surely was up to something!

[caption id="attachment_285" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Soft Toys Meeting: Evidence #1"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/38_toy_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-285" title="38_toy_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/38_toy_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Soft Toys Meeting: Evidence #1" width="300" height="209" /></a>[/caption]

Hehehe... I particularly like the way he put the duck in the middle, but in upright position. At first, when he went to put the duck in the middle, it looked as if all the other soft toys were waiting for their meal of the day: roast duck... :P But then, he insisted on getting the duck to 'sit' in upright position. It didn't look that bad when he managed to get the duck to sit properly... :) See, all the soft toys were just meeting up to have a tea time together... :)

Detective Mommy shall retire then... ;)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>39_car_02</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/22/vroom-vroom-painting/39_car_02/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Sep 2010 05:06:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>

		<item>
		<title>Vroom... Vroom Painting!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/22/vroom-vroom-painting/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 22 Sep 2010 05:17:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=289</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is probably the saddest looking car. Ever.

[caption id="attachment_290" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Out of Whack"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-290" title="39_car_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Out of Whack" width="300" height="187" /></a>[/caption]

A kind person gave it to us from a thrift store. It wasn't in prime condition when it was passed to us. Yet, it still looked great! It was also easy to identify the car as a highway patrol, with the lights on the roof of the car. It immediately won the little guy's heart, especially with the doors and the trunk lid that could be opened.

The little guy toted the car about with him nearly every time we went out. It was also his fave on the <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/28/race-me-if-you-dare/" target="_blank">racing track</a>. Of course, it also means that the car endures hard time. It had suffered countless serious falls from a height and it had smashed nearly every wall in our house.

Now, the trunk lid is no longer there. Forget about the lights, too. They went missing on the second day.

Still, the little guy loves it. Although he doesn't really bring it around anymore, he often plays with it at home.

And we thought it would be great to pay our tribute to this amazing car by taking it in one of our art sessions... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>car</li>
	<li>cookie cutter</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_291" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-291" title="39_car_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready..." width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We first put the paint on a cookie tray, our favorite palette... :P With a little encouragement, the little guy then let his car roll in the paint, getting all the four wheels wet with paint. He probably thought it was strange that for the first time ever, his mommy asked him to put the car on something sticky!

[caption id="attachment_292" align="aligncenter" width="213" caption="Car, the Brush of the Day"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-292" title="39_car_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_03.jpg?w=213" alt="Car, the Brush of the Day" width="213" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

After seeing how I drove the car all over the paper, he took over the car and started painting with it.

[caption id="attachment_293" align="aligncenter" width="234" caption="Vroom... vroom..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-293" title="39_car_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_04.jpg?w=234" alt="Vroom... vroom..." width="234" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was messy. Really messy. The little guy also used his little fingers every now and then.

[caption id="attachment_294" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Sticky Mess"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-294" title="39_car_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The Sticky Mess" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Don't worry about the car. It wasn't difficult at all to clean it after we finished painting.

He somehow left the left side empty. It was good, though. I was thinking of getting him to try painting with the cookie cutter, too.

[caption id="attachment_295" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Quack!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-295" title="39_car_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Quack!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And, there you go... after all the 'hard' work...

[caption id="attachment_296" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Yet another masterpiece"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-296" title="39_car_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/39_car_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Yet another masterpiece" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>289</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-09-22 13:17:49</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-09-22 05:17:49</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>vroom-vroom-painting</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1294123538:15431286]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[15431286]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>jabber_published</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1285132669]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_old_slug</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<title>The Birthday Bear</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/23/the-birthday-bear/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Sep 2010 01:56:47 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We're celebrating the 4th birthday of Frosty the Bear today... :)

Cake and candle are of course mandatory. The cookies came as a pleasant surprise in our mailbox... :)

[caption id="attachment_304" align="aligncenter" width="240" caption="Birthday Bear and the Cake"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/41_bdaybear_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-304" title="41_bdaybear_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/41_bdaybear_01.jpg?w=240" alt="Birthday Bear and the Cake" width="240" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Birthday present? Well, since Frosty couldn't eat the cake and cookies, the little guy worked hard to... blow the candle and eat a slice of cake plus a piece of cookie.

[caption id="attachment_305" align="aligncenter" width="213" caption="Cookie Monster"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/41_bdaybear_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-305" title="41_bdaybear_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/41_bdaybear_02.jpg?w=213" alt="Cookie Monster" width="213" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And here are the birthday hug and kisses...

[caption id="attachment_306" align="aligncenter" width="255" caption="Smooch!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/41_bdaybear_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-306" title="41_bdaybear_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/41_bdaybear_03.jpg?w=255" alt="Smooch!" width="255" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:post_id>312</wp:post_id>

		<item>
		<title>Introducing Yarn, Our Latest Brush</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/26/introducing-yarn-our-latest-brush/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 26 Sep 2010 01:28:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=310</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After the abstract <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/22/vroom-vroom-painting/" target="_blank">Vroom... Vroom Painting</a> that we had the other day, we thought it would be nice to do another abstract painting. This time round the car stayed in the garage. We used yarn, instead... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>yarn</li>
	<li>toilet paper roll</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>plastic container (or, palette)</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We used a plastic container for our palette. For no particular reason. Just for a change... :)

Earlier, I thought I would use water to thin the paints. Too bad, the little guy just didn't have the patience to wait for me to get the water. He quickly took the yarn and played with it.

[caption id="attachment_311" align="aligncenter" width="216" caption="The yarn is mine!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-311" title="40_yarn_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_01.jpg?w=216" alt="The yarn is mine!" width="216" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I taught him how to dip the yarn and swirl it around our drawing paper. Our yarn was rather stiff, so what he painted looked more like colorful stripes. Still, an abstract.. :)

[caption id="attachment_312" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Painting with yarn"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-312" title="40_yarn_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Painting with yarn" width="300" height="270" /></a>[/caption]

We also took a toilet paper roll and tied the yarn around.

[caption id="attachment_313" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Tie the yarn around the ol&#039; toilet paper roll"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-313" title="40_yarn_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Tie the yarn around the ol' toilet paper roll" width="300" height="245" /></a>[/caption]

We dipped in the toilet paper roll, but we couldn't get much color. Obviously, there wasn't much paint left in our palette. So, we brushed paint on it, using a paint brush.

Then, we rolled our toilet paper roll around our drawing paper. Wheee.. ^o^ Check out the trail left behind!

[caption id="attachment_314" align="aligncenter" width="202" caption="Yarn Yarn Vroom!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-314" title="40_yarn_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_04.jpg?w=202" alt="Yarn Yarn Vroom!" width="202" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was really fun! I think we'll do this again next time with thinner paints. I bet it would be fun dripping some paint using yarn, too!

[caption id="attachment_315" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Up for Auction... ;)"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-315" title="40_yarn_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/40_yarn_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Up for Auction... ;)" width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>310</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<item>
		<title>While He was Down with Fever...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/27/while-he-was-down-with-fever/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 27 Sep 2010 03:07:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=319</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The poor little guy was down with mild fever yesterday... :(

Although the fever was kinda expected, due to his booster jab the day before, it was still awfully weird ... and heart-breaking to see him so quiet. Just imagine if you have a toddler who is usually like a little tornado in the house, but suddenly did not want to stay anywhere too far away from his bed. Sleeping. Or simply staring at you.

My day was peaceful, but it was just too... quiet.

But it wasn't an unproductive day... :) We had a short finger-painting session after lunch... ;)
<p style="text-align:left;"></p>


[caption id="attachment_320" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Warm Fingers can Paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/42_abstract_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-320 " title="42_abstract_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/42_abstract_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Warm Fingers can Paint" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>319</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-09-27 11:07:23</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-09-27 03:07:23</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>while-he-was-down-with-fever</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Tracing Craze</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/30/tracing-craze/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 30 Sep 2010 03:29:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=324</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Here's the latest craze in our home:

[caption id="attachment_325" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Tracing!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/43_trace_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-325" title="43_trace_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/43_trace_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Tracing Anything" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Yup! Tracing is the newest craze. We trace almost anything we could find. Cookie cutters, lids, and the little guy's favorite: his own hands!

[caption id="attachment_326" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Hands and Lid"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/43_trace_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-326" title="43_trace_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/09/43_trace_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Hands and Lid" width="300" height="288" /></a>[/caption]

Tracing his hands would make him giggling. Non stop.. :D

Obviously, he hasn't started tracing himself. He just loves holding the object while I trace and best of all, being 'traced'.. :)

Now if we could just find our color pencils... it'll be fun!]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Mommy: Look! An Ant! *<em>pointing to an ant on the floor</em>*

Ant: !!!

The little guy: Smash! Smash! *<em>smashing the floor blindly</em>*

Ant: --- *<em>this would be the part where we usually have the long annoying beep in a hospital scene on TV with a dying man</em>*

The little guy: *<em>smiling cheekily</em>* Wheeeere?

Mommy: *<em>speechless</em>*

And no! This <strong>isn't</strong> a part of the syllabus for our School of Fun!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>School of Fun Goes to the Kitchen</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/04/school-of-fun-goes-to-the-kitchen/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Oct 2010 07:12:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beans"><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=336</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Uhm, okay... probably not the real kitchen. We can't bring the sofa to the kitchen, so we bring the "kitchen" to the sofa... :)

Monday is usually a hectic day. After all the fun and excitement during the weekend, we usually have lots of things to clean, wash, iron and the list continues. Sometimes, being tired after having less sleep during the weekend, the little guy turns rather cranky, too. And that adds... no, not just adding; it multiplies the workload!

That is why on this particular Monday, when I saw him so engrossed watching his favorite show, Hi-5, I quickly took the bean sprouts to the living room. Although I like bean sprouts and I do know that they are healthy, I am no big fan of cooking bean sprouts. It is simply because of those wiggly ends that I'd rather remove before eating. I just can't imagine myself eating them. So, you could imagine the effort to snip these if I buy a pack of bean sprouts! No fun at all.

Anyway, there I was at the living room, faithfully snipping one after another, when suddenly the little guy started looking. Obviously there was no more music for him to dance to as the Hi-5 show just ended. He observed what I was doing and finally took one bean sprout. And snip. Then another bean sprout. And snip...

[caption id="attachment_337" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The New Kitchen Assistant"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/44_kitchen_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-337" title="44_kitchen_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/44_kitchen_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The New Kitchen Assistant" width="300" height="239" /></a>[/caption]

It turned out to be a great activity! He actually enjoyed snipping the bean sprouts for about 15 minutes or so. We found ourselves chatting over the bean sprout snipping and when he suddenly started that contagious laughing craze, we couldn't stop laughing!

Not bad. In the end, we had one busy and happy toddler, one happy mommy (at least that snipping wasn't that boring) and bean sprouts for dinner! And nope, considering his age that is way below the legal age, I didn't find anyone knocking at our door for this "child labor"... *<em>grinz</em>*

Finally, as a token of appreciation, I let him be a soldier for the day, complete with the helmet, stick and tent... :D
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_338" align="aligncenter" width="223" caption="The Soldier of the Day"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/44_kitchen_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-338 " title="44_kitchen_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/44_kitchen_02.jpg?w=223" alt="The Soldier of the Day" width="223" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>336</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-10-04 15:12:51</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-10-04 07:12:51</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>school-of-fun-goes-to-the-kitchen</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1295333184:15431286]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[15431286]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Lots of Helping Hands</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/06/lots-of-helping-hands/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Oct 2010 05:07:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Hand Prints]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hand-prints"><![CDATA[Hand Prints]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=343</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It was raining this morning. Yet, contrary to popular belief, we were still pretty productive. Or maybe today was just an exception... :) After all, it is hard to resist not to make anything nice looking at those stacks of colorful "<em>hands</em>" that daddy meticulously drew and cut for us the other night. We really appreciate his helping hands!

[caption id="attachment_344" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Lots of hands!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-344" title="45_hand_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Lots of hands!" width="300" height="240" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>colorful papers (to make the hand prints)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

Basically, once all the hand prints are ready, we just need to let our imagination run wild. Choose your color and how you would like to position the hand prints... and voila, you'll get all sorts of things to admire!

Like these awesome creatures...

[caption id="attachment_345" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The C-ly crab"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-345" title="45_hand_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_03.jpg?w=300" alt="The C-ly crab" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_346" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The D-d Dino"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-346" title="45_hand_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_04.jpg?w=300" alt="The D-d Dino" width="300" height="215" /></a>[/caption]

And these creatures happily joined the rest of the alphabets that we've made... :)

[caption id="attachment_347" align="aligncenter" width="243" caption="A is for Apple"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-347" title="45_hand_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_05.jpg?w=243" alt="A is for Apple" width="243" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_348" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="B is for Butterfly"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-348" title="45_hand_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/45_hand_06.jpg?w=300" alt="B is for Butterfly" width="300" height="216" /></a>[/caption]

Now, if I could just remember how I managed to get my husband to cut those colorful hands... we'll be running out of<em> </em>hand prints soon. Hee hee... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>343</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>lots-of-helping-hands</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Serving Green Cookies</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/11/serving-green-cookies/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Oct 2010 05:21:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=355</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I must admit that I just can't wait for the days when I could bake cookies with the little guy. I imagine that it would be fun and messy, at the same time.

But, well, until I have the full confidence that nothing with raw eggs goes into his mouth, we shall just make do with Playdoh... :)

[caption id="attachment_356" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Ingredients"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/47_cookie_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-356" title="47_cookie_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/47_cookie_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Ingredients" width="300" height="227" /></a>[/caption]

And yup, even if our cookies had to be green... :P

[caption id="attachment_357" align="aligncenter" width="226" caption="Green, Squishy Cookies, Anyone?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/47_cookie_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-357" title="47_cookie_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/47_cookie_02.jpg?w=226" alt="Green, Squishy Cookies, Anyone?" width="226" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Gee... how I wish I could be more creative!

Take a look at what my husband could do within only a few minutes! And this was done while still keeping the little guy pretty entertained! The little guy didn't leave his seat even after the picture was done! I bet he was impressed with the picture, too!

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_361" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Smiley Faces"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/48_smile_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-361" title="48_smile_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/48_smile_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Smiley Faces" width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

It must be really fun being creative. Just one marker and a piece of paper and wow... the thousands of possibilities you could create!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>School of Fun Goes Digital!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/11/school-of-fun-goes-digital/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Oct 2010 05:38:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=363</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We went to visit the Supreme Court buildings last weekend. The buildings would be transformed into the new National Art Gallery soon, and so an open house was held to let everyone experience the historical buildings.

Our favorite was of course the activity corner for children. And that was where we could doodle on the touch screen monitor... :)

[caption id="attachment_364" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Experiencing Digital Doodling"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/49_digital_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-364" title="49_digital_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/49_digital_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Experiencing Digital Doodling" width="300" height="212" /></a>[/caption]

If only we could have one at home... hehehe, there would certainly be less mess to deal with! Well, unless you're talking about the sticky fingers that would be landing some marks on the screen... :P

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Monsters in the House!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/13/monsters-in-the-house/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 13 Oct 2010 05:59:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=368</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Who would have ever thought of keeping these unassuming items for weeks?

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_369" align="aligncenter" width="242" caption="A treasure or a hoard?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/50_monster_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-369" title="50_monster_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/50_monster_01.jpg?w=242" alt="A treasure or a hoard?" width="242" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Me. Yes, me!

Call me a hoarder, I've been keeping these clips for the past few weeks. Mind you, getting one requires me to wait for a week! And sometimes, when it takes us more than a week to finish the whole bread, it feels like a long wait! Even worse, when the little guy decides to play with the clip and break it, we'll have to wait for another week... :'(

So, yup... I gave up after collecting two. I thought I've collected more than two, but I simply couldn't find the rest.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>clips</li>
	<li>markers</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

I thought the opening side of the clip would make a great monster's mouth. So, I got the little guy to put some glue on the side with the price tag.

Unfortunately, in the end I had to take over. Apparently, the little guy was more interested in poking the clip's  "mouth" with the glue stick. I certainly couldn't afford to lose any of these two precious clips! Not if that means I have to wait for another week to get the replacement!

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_370" align="aligncenter" width="195" caption="No wonder it&#039;s called a glue stick"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/50_monster_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-370" title="50_monster_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/50_monster_02.jpg?w=195" alt="No wonder it's called a glue stick" width="195" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Next, we pasted the clips on a piece of drawing paper. Add the eyes, hairs, etc. The little guy doodled something that looked like a shell of a snail. So, I added antennas for the "snail".

Now, scream at the top of your lungs, people! We've got monsters in the house!

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_371" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Monsters!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/50_monster_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-371" title="50_monster_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/50_monster_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Monsters!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>368</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_name>monsters-in-the-house</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>51_train_02</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/19/374/51_train_02/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Oct 2010 04:23:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_02.jpg</guid>
