		<item>
		<title>Train Tracks that (Could) Grow</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/19/374/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Oct 2010 04:35:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=374</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[School of Fun had just had a visitor: our little guy's cousin from Japan... :) So, for the past few days, we took a break from making crafts. The two boys quickly declared themselves as partners-in-crime, ransacking the whole house. Haha... :D

Still, it was fun watching them together playing ... and fighting. I guess our little guy still learned something during this "break" after all. He seemed to enjoy the company of someone of about the same size as him and as cheeky as him.

Now that the cousin had gone home, it was all quiet at home. Well, except for that Shinkansen's announcement that came out from the bullet trains miniature that he gave to our little guy. Considering that it is something new in the house, the little guy kept playing with it, day and night. He would turn on the train and let it roam around.

The fact that the train carries 3 cars also make it more fun to play with. The little guy would swing one to the left, while turning the other one to move forward in another direction. And the other one? That is for mommy to find... &gt;_&lt; Yup, sadly, we could rarely see all the 3 cars link together. You see, it's always easier to detach the 3 cars than to attach them. Go figure! As soon as we link the three cars, the little guy would be happy to detach them...

[caption id="attachment_375" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Go, train #1!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-375" title="51_train_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Go, train #1!" width="300" height="213" /></a>[/caption]

Anyway, since the little guy kept insisting that it was a car and not a train, I decided to built a track from old boxes. I thought the track would show the obvious difference between a car and a train.

[caption id="attachment_376" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Keeping it on track"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-376 " title="51_train_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Keeping it on track" width="300" height="166" /></a>[/caption]

We also took the train's box to make a longer track. I guess it'll grow longer if we could find more boxes... :P

[caption id="attachment_377" align="aligncenter" width="154" caption="Long but not winding track"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-377" title="51_train_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/51_train_03.jpg?w=154" alt="Long but not winding track" width="154" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The track was indeed awesome! It gets even more fun when we put one side higher and let the train travel down the slope.

So, has the little guy started calling it a train, you ask? Nope. He still insists that it is a car, just like any other friction-powered car he has. Hee hee... :P In his dictionary, the only train he knows is that big, long <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Mass_Rapid_Transit_%28Singapore%29" target="_blank">MRT </a>we could see from our windows.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>One Day in the Office...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/20/one-day-in-the-office/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 20 Oct 2010 09:32:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=385</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Help.

Our house has been turning into a thrift store lately...&gt;_&lt; Or, at least, almost. We have tons of second-hand goods. All we need to do now to qualify as a thrift store is just to start selling. Hee hee...

My dear hubby brought home an old typewriter last weekend. There is no more ink on the ribbon. Otherwise, it's still working perfectly.

The good thing is that it immediately wins the little guy's heart. Every now and then he would sit in front of the typewriter and start playing with the keytops. His favorite is, of course, the automatic space bar, which is the easiest to press.

But, today, we thought of doing something different with the typewriter. We invited our soft toys for a pretend play. We pretended that we were in the office. We got our soft toys together on the sofa and dressed our bears and duck up. We also brought along our typewriter.

[caption id="attachment_386" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One day in the office..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/52_work_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-386" title="52_work_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/52_work_01.jpg?w=300" alt="One day in the office..." width="300" height="223" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy got very excited to see all of them well dressed. So, he asked to wear his shirt, too. Luckily, he didn't ask for any bow tie or shawl like what the bears wear.

Next, being a super-friendly colleague, he taught his "colleagues" how to use the typewriter. Hee hee... I love the serious face he put as he started his lecture.

[caption id="attachment_387" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="This is how to use the typewriter"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/52_work_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-387" title="52_work_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/52_work_02.jpg?w=300" alt="This is how to use the typewriter" width="300" height="261" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>385</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-10-20 17:32:35</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-10-20 09:32:35</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>one-day-in-the-office</wp:post_name>

		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>

		<item>
		<title>53_castle_02</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/24/no-cinderella-story/53_castle_02/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 24 Oct 2010 06:44:02 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_02.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[The Long-awaited Castle]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>395</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-10-24 14:44:02</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-10-24 06:44:02</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>53_castle_02</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>394</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_02.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/10/53_castle_02.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>No Cinderella Story</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/24/no-cinderella-story/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 24 Oct 2010 06:57:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=394</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[What we're about to show you took us many days to complete! Nearly two weeks, in fact!

Of course, the first few days went by with the box just sitting idly at one corner. That probably what you could expect from someone who would still be holding on to the previous Saturday's newspaper until the following Thursday, trying to finish reading it before the following Saturday comes.

Yeah... we were <em>that </em>busy... bwahaha... Oh well, maybe it was more because I wanted to find that precious time when I would not be too busy to play with the cutter and scissors. But then, such time would usually be when I have the little guy so near that he could just poke his fingers around.

Then, miraculously I found that perfect time to cut one side of the box! And there you go... the box sat idly once again for another couple of days as the little guy insisted on using the box as the parking area for his cars and trucks. And oh, for <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/19/374/" target="_blank">his new train</a>, too...

So, you could imagine the excitement when we finally managed to turn the box into something that we, err, I wanted! Tadaaa...

[caption id="attachment_395" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Long-awaited Castle"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-395" title="53_castle_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Long-awaited Castle" width="300" height="256" /></a>[/caption]

Nope, we didn't bother to paint it. Or rather, we didn't have the chance to paint it. Our little guy decided to quickly snatch the role of the giant happily stomping the castle. Uhm, maybe he simply wants to be the kindhearted giant who lives happily ever after in a castle, leaving no space for Cinderella or any other princesses in any of our fairy tales... hee hee...

[caption id="attachment_396" align="aligncenter" width="248" caption="No more space for you, Cinderella"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-396" title="53_castle_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_01.jpg?w=248" alt="No more space for you, Cinderella" width="248" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And when he's done playing as a giant, he would ensure that the castle serves its "real" purpose according to him: parking area. Hahaha...

[caption id="attachment_397" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A modern day castle"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-397" title="53_castle_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/53_castle_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A modern day castle" width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>The Little Guy and the Frog</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/26/the-little-guy-and-the-frog/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 26 Oct 2010 05:01:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="egg-carton"><![CDATA[Egg Carton]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=401</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's time to bring out the egg cartons again. They've been sitting in the corner, collecting dust.

Since he got pretty excited the last time we went to see some frogs at the supermarket, here's what we made after we brushed the egg cartons clean... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>egg cartons</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>white, red and green papers (for the limbs, eyes and tongue)</li>
	<li>glue</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_402" align="aligncenter" width="289" caption="Getting the magic potion ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/54_frog_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-402" title="54_frog_01.jpg" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/54_frog_01.jpg?w=289" alt="Getting the magic potion ready" width="289" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

After cutting one egg carton out, I gave the little guy the honor to paint it green. The little guy obviously had invented a novel way to paint it <em>and</em> himself green at the same time. He put the egg carton on his lap and started swinging his brush back and forth between the egg carton and his clothes. Brilliant!

[caption id="attachment_403" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Scene 1: The Day He Turned Himself Green"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/54_frog_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-403" title="54_frog_02.jpg" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/54_frog_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Scene 1: The Day He Turned Himself Green" width="300" height="258" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Then, when the little guy went to sleep for the night, his Fairy <span style="text-decoration:line-through;">God</span>mother placed the eyes,  limbs and tongue. And swoosh-swoosh-swish... tadaaaa... the frog is ready to be kissed first thing in the morning!</p>


[caption id="attachment_404" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Scene 2: Ribbit!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/54_frog_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-404 " title="54_frog_03.jpg" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/54_frog_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Scene 2: Ribbit!" width="300" height="199" /></a>[/caption]

Can't help to feel glad that we painted it green... Otherwise, it'll look like a flattened lizard... hee heee...]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_021.jpg</wp:attachment_url>

		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to the Halloween</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/28/the-little-guys-guide-to-the-halloween/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 28 Oct 2010 06:44:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=408</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's Halloween time! And there's no better way to entertain a toddler than a dress-up game! The toddler got to play make believe in the most interesting way, while the mommy got tons of photos to laugh at... *<em>grinz</em>*

It didn't start with a breeze, though. The futile attempt to dress him like a mummy using toilet paper turned him unfriendly at first. Until he saw his own face with the monster hat... he became very cooperative! He even tried to dress up himself. I guess he started to think that whatever his mommy was doing, she was definitely up to do something exciting with him!

[caption id="attachment_409" align="aligncenter" width="219" caption="The Shy Red Devil"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-409" title="55_halloween_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_07.jpg?w=219" alt="The Shy Red Devil" width="219" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Well, we surely did get to do lots of exciting things! Check out what other costumes we had!

<strong>The Back-to-School/Back-to-Work Scarecrow</strong>

They said school and office could be pretty horrifying. So, the little guy wanted to be the hero who would flap his arms to scare the ghosts, including all the evil bullies... :)

[caption id="attachment_410" align="aligncenter" width="234" caption="The Scarecrow Saves the Day!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-410" title="55_halloween_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_01.jpg?w=234" alt="The Scarecrow Saves the Day!" width="234" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Impressed? You know who to call then if you're dealing with one at work or school!

<strong>Supertot</strong>

What? A hero needs a cape? No problem. Everything's under control. We've got the cape and the Supertot is ready to take off. We've got to warn you, though: do not try this at home! Especially not without anything to cushion the superhero-wanna-be... you never know when and where he would jump!

[caption id="attachment_415" align="aligncenter" width="230" caption="Supertot, ready to take off"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-415" title="55_halloween_021" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_021.jpg?w=230" alt="Supertot, ready to take off" width="230" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Mickey Mouse</strong>

Okie, enough with the superheroes. The world doesn't need another superhero.  The world needs to giggle more, so the little guy turn himself into a... cute Mickey Mouse!
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>

<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-412 " title="55_halloween_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Sing with me: M-I-C-K-E-Y  M-O-U-S-E!" width="300" height="252" /></a></dt> <dd class="wp-caption-dd">Sing with me: M-I-C-K-E-Y  M-O-U-S-E!</dd> </dl></div>
<strong>The Uke Player</strong>

Speaking about singing and music, what do you think about dressing smart as an ukulele player? Who knows, he might have what it takes to be the next <a href="http://www.jakeshimabukuro.com/?t=bio" target="_blank">Jake Shimabukuro</a>.

Oh, by the way, this was probably the most terrifying scene during the game. I watched in horror as he plucked the strings with all his might and main! :S

[caption id="attachment_413" align="aligncenter" width="235" caption="The Uke Player in Action"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-413" title="55_halloween_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_04.jpg?w=235" alt="The Uke Player in Action" width="235" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>The Little Green Riding Hood</strong>

Move aside, Little Red Riding Hood! Green is the new red! Oops... no matching shoes? It's okay, we'll make do with mommy's turquoise socks... :) And nope, we don't need that basket to bring food for the grandmother in the fairy tale. Let's just sing for grandmother. She'll recover soon when she hears the little guy sing... ;)

[caption id="attachment_414" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Little Green Riding Hood&#039;s Strum n Drum Session"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-414" title="55_halloween_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_05.jpg?w=225" alt="The Little Green Riding Hood's Strum n Drum Session" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

That's all, folks!

And guess what we got at the end of our game?

[caption id="attachment_416" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Even if I sleep, my loot shalt be safe"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-416" title="55_halloween_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/55_halloween_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Even if I sleep, my loot shalt be safe" width="300" height="208" /></a>[/caption]

A toddler sleeping peacefully with his trick or treat loot!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>At Home with Bob the Builder&#039;s Team</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/31/at-home-with-bob-the-builders-team/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 31 Oct 2010 15:25:34 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=421</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Our days have been pretty exciting lately, especially with the construction going on near our place... :)

[caption id="attachment_422" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Daily Live Performance Next Door"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/56_construction_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-422" title="56_construction_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/10/56_construction_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Daily Live Performance Next Door" width="300" height="152" /></a>[/caption]

Every day, it is like waking up to watch Bob the Builder shows.  Or even better! Yeah, it probably even beats watching Bob the Builder Live Performance!

So, every day, anywhere near our windows becomes the little guy's favorite hangout place. He would climb or simply peek through the window to see all the heavy duty vehicles.

Of course, being a fan of Bob the Builder myself thanks to the many weekends spent on waking up early to watch the show with the little guy, I would happily spend some time with him there. We would count the trucks, point and even name them one by one using the name of the most similar character from Bob the Builder... *<em>grinz</em>*

There is Roley the steamroller, although he is yellow, not green like on TV. We also saw Tumbler the concrete transport truck the other day, yet again not as colorful as on TV. Then there are Grabber the excavator and Muck the front loader, too.  And maybe, Lofty the crane. Okie, not sure for that one... we haven't really mastered our truck vocabulary. Hee hee..

Now, if we look more carefully, sometimes we would spot some "Bob"s with their yellow helmets, too. Not all the construction workers wear yellow helmets, that's why...

Our favorite is of course Roley, since it is the easiest to spot and name. And also because of his favorite phrase "Rock and roll!".

Told you it's exciting! Ha!]]></content:encoded>

		<title>57_rocket_01</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/03/start-your-engine-gentlemen/olympus-digital-camera-16/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Nov 2010 04:05:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_01.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Fun supply]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>425</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-11-03 12:05:43</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-11-03 04:05:43</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>olympus-digital-camera-16</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>424</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_01.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/11/57_rocket_01.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Start Your Engine, Gentlemen!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/03/start-your-engine-gentlemen/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 03 Nov 2010 04:28:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=424</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<img src="/DCIM/101OLYMP/PB025908.JPG" alt="" />

What would cross your mind when you have all these?

[caption id="attachment_425" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fun supply"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-425" title="57_rocket_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Fun supply" width="300" height="247" /></a>[/caption]

Check out what we made out of those... ;)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>kitchen towel rolls</li>
	<li>aluminium foil</li>
	<li>sticky tape or glue</li>
	<li>cardboard</li>
	<li>yarn</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we wrapped both kitchen towel rolls with the aluminium foil.

[caption id="attachment_427" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="All wrapped"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-427" title="57_rocket_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_02.jpg?w=300" alt="All wrapped" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Then, we pasted cardboard underneath, placing the two rolls next to each other. Actually, we could just stick the two rolls together using glue or sticky tape. But, we thought having the cardboard would make it easier to put on the yarn later on.

[caption id="attachment_428" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Putting on the base"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-428" title="57_rocket_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Putting on the base" width="300" height="192" /></a>[/caption]

Speaking about the yarn... While I was away to find the yarn, the little guy decided to get busy, too..

[caption id="attachment_429" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Making Waves"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-429" title="57_rocket_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Making Waves" width="300" height="142" /></a>[/caption]

Geee, I should have known it! I shouldn't have left him with the aluminium foil... &gt;_&lt; Great, now I have tons of aluminium foil for more art&amp;craft sessions... :S

Anyway, check out what we've got... ;)

[caption id="attachment_430" align="aligncenter" width="241" caption="It&#039;s a pair of tanks... it&#039;s.. a rocket!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-430" title="57_rocket_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/57_rocket_05.jpg?w=241" alt="It's a pair of tanks... it's.. a rocket!" width="241" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And so the little guy zoomed left and right with his new rocket. No battery needed. Hahaha...

I thought of cutting some red, orange and yellow papers to paste at the bottom of the rocket. You know, just to make it look more real... :P Too bad, I ran out of battery myself... down with mild fever... :S So I just sat on the couch, watching my little guy playing with his new engine... :) He really was one happy little chap!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Confessions of a Hoarder</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/06/confessions-of-a-hoarder/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 06 Nov 2010 09:11:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=433</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It really IS happening. I can't say I haven't been warned. I'm turning into a hoarder soon... &gt;_&lt;

It usually starts with spending a few minutes at the weekly thrift store and it ends with me, going home with something on my hands (or on my husband's hands)...

Like that weekend when we brought home <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/20/one-day-in-the-office/" target="_blank">an old typewriter</a>.

Or like those many weekends we brought home stacks of children books... :S

Or like a few weeks ago when we brought home something called <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Crayola-Rocket-MindsTM-Fun-ominoesTM-Toy/dp/B000HDKNMA" target="_blank">Fun-ominoes</a>. The colors were so striking that I made up my mind within seconds! I didn't even bother to check whether the set was still complete. Well.. who cares, anyway. I don't think we'll be playing it for real, or at least, not for the time being. Hee hee...

And indeed, it was a good investment. We're really grateful to whoever left that thing at the thrift store... 0:) What is supposed to be a kind of domino games has made bath time even more fun! The little guy loves fitting them all together, just like puzzle pieces... :)

[caption id="attachment_434" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Tiling up the pieces..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-434" title="58_foam_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Tiling up the pieces..." width="300" height="239" /></a>[/caption]

Aww... I don't feel so bad about buying it anymore... *<em>grinz</em>* :P Now, if only I could find more space to store all these... *<em>look right, look left</em>*]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"800";s:6:"height";s:3:"552";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='88' width='128'";s:4:"file";s:86:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/11/58_foam_07.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:1:"5";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:5:"E-510";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1288887545";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:2:"28";s:3:"iso";s:3:"400";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:17:"0.076923076923077";s:5:"title";s:22:"OLYMPUS DIGITAL CAMERA";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_image_alt</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Sleep, baby bear... sleep tight]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>It&#039;s Tea Time!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/06/its-tea-time/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 06 Nov 2010 09:50:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=437</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The table has been spread. And see those colorful bits? Something's cooking! The banquet is ready, people!

[caption id="attachment_438" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The banquet is ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-438" title="58_foam_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The banquet is ready" width="300" height="170" /></a>[/caption]

The guests have flocked around, too. It's party time! :)

[caption id="attachment_439" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The guests are here!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-439" title="58_foam_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_03.jpg?w=300" alt="The guests are here!" width="300" height="231" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, we're inviting all of them for a tea time... :)

Remember when I said that that second-hand fun-ominoes thing was <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/06/confessions-of-a-hoarder/" target="_blank">a good investment</a>? Well, it <em>really </em>has been a good investment... :) In our last make-believe play, we used the colorful bits for the "food". The little guy happily took the role of a good host, serving each of his guest with some yummy tidbits. Although at first he insisted on giving each of them exactly only 2 pieces, he ended up playing favorites. He gave more pieces to his beloved duck... :P It's either he wanted the duck to quickly grow to be as big as the bears or he was simply too lazy to move his butt to serve the others... :P I'd rather think it's the first one. Hahaha....

[caption id="attachment_440" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="You just need to eat more, duckie..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-440" title="58_foam_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_04.jpg?w=207" alt="You just need to eat more, duckie..." width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, what is a tea time without cakes (although, actually, we totally forgot about serving tea... hehehe!). Here's the chef, preparing the cakes... :)

[caption id="attachment_441" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Baking some goodness"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-441" title="58_foam_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Baking some goodness" width="300" height="256" /></a>[/caption]

Being a good host, the little guy always wants to make sure everyone have a great time. So, he added in the "entertainment" part... :P And how did he do it? By simply putting the pan in front of his face and clowning around...bwahaha!

[caption id="attachment_442" align="aligncenter" width="234" caption="The Pan-tastic Man!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-442" title="58_foam_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_06.jpg?w=234" alt="The Pan-tastic Man!" width="234" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We really had a blast! Even when the "party" ended... Just take a look at what the little guy did when I asked him to tidy up. He stacked all the plates nicely and put everything around in one "circle". Although he seemed to forget about keeping his guests and putting them back in the rack, he brought the bear and the duck to the "circle". And here's my favorite: he put the blanket on the bear!!! Hahaha... maybe he thought that the bear had fallen asleep after eating so much! Very thoughtful of him! Hahaha...

[caption id="attachment_443" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Sleep, baby bear... sleep tight "]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-443" title="58_foam_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/58_foam_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Sleep, baby bear... sleep tight" width="300" height="207" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>59_duck_05</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/10/a-tale-of-the-three-ducks/olympus-digital-camera-32/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 09 Nov 2010 16:19:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_05.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>

		<item>
		<title>A Tale of the Three Ducks</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/10/a-tale-of-the-three-ducks/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 09 Nov 2010 16:33:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=448</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's just hard not to think about ducks when it's raining heavily the whole morning. Like this morning... Somehow it brought back the memories of those rainy days when I was much younger. Usually, on my way back from the bus stop to home, there would be ducks (or perhaps geese... I couldn't really tell the difference back then) waddling around the puddles. They weren't as cute as Donald Duck, but still... they made a great entertainment.

Anyway, as the little guy started to show his frustration for not being able to go out due to the weather, out we brought our paints.

Our theme for today was, of course, duck. One of the little guy's favorite songs is <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0LEYwoooVfw" target="_blank">Elmo's Ducks</a>. So, I thought it would be great if we could make something which later on we could play with while singing that song together.

[caption id="attachment_450" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting the ducks ready..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-450" title="59_duck_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting the ducks ready..." width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>colorful papers</li>
	<li>paints</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>cookie cutter (duck shape, of course!)</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We cut out three little paper ducks<strong>. </strong>Next, I put a bit of glue on the paper ducks and placed them on the drawing paper.

Somehow, I thought there were only three ducks in the song. By the time I realised that there are supposed to be four ducks, the little guy had got down to business, painting with all his might and main.

First, he used a paintbrush.

[caption id="attachment_451" align="aligncenter" width="252" caption="Brushing the ducks"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-451" title="59_duck_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_02.jpg?w=252" alt="Brushing the ducks" width="252" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Getting really excited, he put down his paintbrush and used his right hand to continue painting.

[caption id="attachment_452" align="aligncenter" width="285" caption="Slapping sticky paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-452" title="59_duck_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_03.jpg?w=285" alt="Slapping sticky paint" width="285" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

It seemed that he really enjoyed it. It became a kind of whack-the-duck games in which he had to whack each duck as many times as possible... :P

[caption id="attachment_453" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Whack the Duck!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-453" title="59_duck_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Whack the Duck!" width="300" height="191" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Occasionally, he took the paintbrush and used it. Then, he put it down and started his whack-the-duck game again.

At the end of the whacking games, here's what we got:

[caption id="attachment_454" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Three Wacky Ducks"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-454" title="59_duck_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/59_duck_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The Three Wacky Ducks" width="300" height="216" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

I guess I could just forget about turning it into something to play with as we sing the song. My initial plan was <span style="text-decoration:underline;">not</span> to have the ducks attached to the paper. That was why I only put a bit of glue on the paper ducks. Yet, probably because the little guy kept on whacking the ducks earlier, it became really hard to detach them without tearing the paper... :S

So much for thinking that we could sing the song and take one duck out each time each duck in the song goes missing... :P

I guess the three ducks are here to stay then... :) So here's our version of the song... Quack!

<em>Elmo had three ducks (quack quack quack)</em>
<em> three birds of a feather (quack quack quack)</em>
<em> to waddle with (quack quack quack)</em>
<em> and quack together (quack quack quack)</em>
<em> But then one day… <strong>none </strong>swam away</em>
<em> Oh gosh oh gee… Elmo <strong>still </strong>had three!</em>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_id>463</wp:post_id>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Our Firsst 8-piece Jigsaw Puzzle]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Razzle-Dazzle Puzzle</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/11/razzle-dazzle-puzzle/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 10 Nov 2010 23:04:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=458</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I was about to throw these... But then I thought maybe I should give them another chance of being "useful"... :)

[caption id="attachment_459" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="To throw or not to throw..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-459" title="60_puzzle_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_01.jpg?w=300" alt="To throw or not to throw..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

You see, I've been thinking of getting the little guy a jigsaw puzzle. Yet, I know I'm not ready to lose my mind over the lost pieces.

I guess I wouldn't mind losing any piece from this jigsaw puzzle we've made. Or so I think...

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>cardboard</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>a picture (from a magazine, in our case)</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

After cutting out the picture from the magazine, we made a frame using the cardboard. We made sure the picture could fit in nicely.

[caption id="attachment_460" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Frame"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-460" title="60_puzzle_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Frame" width="300" height="228" /></a>[/caption]

Next, we pasted the picture on another cardboard, to make the puzzle pieces slightly thicker... :) At least then I wouldn't need to worry that the pieces would not survive after being bitten, tossed around, etc.

[caption id="attachment_462" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready for the wear and tear"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-462" title="60_puzzle_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready for the wear and tear" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Finally, I cut the picture into smaller pieces.

And here's our first jigsaw puzzle... :)

[caption id="attachment_463" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Our First 8-piece Jigsaw Puzzle"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-463 " title="60_puzzle_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/60_puzzle_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Our First 8-piece Jigsaw Puzzle" width="300" height="213" /></a>[/caption]

Don't ask me to take a picture of the little guy playing it. Right now, he only likes to throw the pieces around. Although he does try to help putting the pieces together, he enjoys the feeling of having the pieces fly around... :P

I asked my husband to give the jigsaw puzzle a try in the evening. Even though later on my husband could put the pieces together in a jiffy, he did look puzzled at first. So, I guess the jigsaw puzzle might still be too complex for the little guy... :P So, well... I'll wait until the little guy can really enjoy playing the puzzle. As for now, I just hope I can handle the "excitement" as he throws around the pieces.... *<em>crossing my fingers so that there would <strong>still </strong>be 8 pieces later on</em>*]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Sink or Float?</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/24/sink-or-float/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 24 Nov 2010 05:00:29 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=467</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Unless you fell asleep during class the majority of the time, you probably have heard about <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buoyancy">buoyancy</a><a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Buoyancy"></a>. If that still doesn't ring a bell, I hope the name Archimedes does... :)

Recently, the little guy includes testing for buoyancy as one of his antics. He simply loves to throw any object he could find into a glass of water and see whether it sinks or floats. If it floats, he would use his fingers to push the object down  and giggle when it floats again.

After dealing with water spill every now and then, I decided that this little scientist of mine simply had to be entertained. We had a variety of fruits and veggies at home and a clear plastic 'pail'. Just add water, and voila... let the fun begin!

We had carrot, blueberry, banana, plum and apple, which the little guy happily put inside the pail of water one by one. And guess which one floats!

[caption id="attachment_468" align="aligncenter" width="243" caption="Sink or Float?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-468" title="61_fruit_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_01.jpg?w=243" alt="Sink or Float?" width="243" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Surprisingly, the small blueberry sank, while the big banana and apple floated. As expected, the little guy kept pushing the banana and apple down. He just loved to see them floating back! He nearly didn't let me take a picture from above. How could I resist the temptation to take a picture when it was this colorful?!

[caption id="attachment_469" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="View from above"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-469" title="61_fruit_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_02.jpg?w=300" alt="View from above" width="300" height="277" /></a>[/caption]

Later on, we also put in the little guy's rubber duckie and a small toothpaste. Both of them floated, adding more entertainment for the little guy.

[caption id="attachment_470" align="aligncenter" width="195" caption="More things to push"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-470" title="61_fruit_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_03.jpg?w=195" alt="More things to push" width="195" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

At the end of this fun activity, I was pretty sure I didn't have a new brilliant scientist, not even an expert in Archimedes' principles, in the house. But, surely, I had one happy, though drenched, toddler. Of course, happy toddler = happy mummy.

While he got excited with the floating and sinking stuff, I also managed to tend our garden, which looked quite pathetic after we left it for nearly a week. So, that means, happy toddler = happy mummy = happy plants.

And here's the icing on the cake: the little guy helped me to water the plants using the clear pail... :) Isn't that great?!

[caption id="attachment_471" align="aligncenter" width="191" caption="Freshen up the plants"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-471" title="61_fruit_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/61_fruit_04.jpg?w=191" alt="Freshen up the plants" width="191" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>467</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-11-24 13:00:29</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-11-24 05:00:29</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>sink-or-float</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<title>62_bake_01</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/25/c-is-for-cookie/62_bake_01/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Nov 2010 05:51:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_01.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Flattening the dough...]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>477</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-11-25 13:51:44</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-11-25 05:51:44</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>62_bake_01</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>476</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_01.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/11/62_bake_01.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>C is for Cookie!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/25/c-is-for-cookie/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 25 Nov 2010 06:09:56 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=476</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Two weeks ago, thanks to my dear hubby's brilliant idea, we celebrated our special 10-11 day in the most exciting way!

We went all the way to Bukit Timah area to check out the new shop, <a href="http://www.tottstore.com/">ToTT (Tools of the Trade)</a>. We had a quick lunch at the bistro inside. And, to our pleasant surprise, they actually have an indoor playground next to the bistro! So, of course, it was kinda like a treat for the little guy, too, even though it was <em>our </em>special day... :)

While the little guy occupied himself at the playground, I enjoyed a stroll along the aisles, admiring all the culinary related products. Luckily, we did have a plan to go somewhere else in the afternoon. Otherwise, I might turn shopaholic at the sight of those cute cookie cutters and baking trays!

Seriously, I also think that housing an indoor playground there is such a wise idea. With so many fragile items around, I couldn't imagine if I let the little guy walk on his own there!

Our favorite section was the Bake &amp; Go counter. Finally, my dream of baking cookies with the little guy came true! It took us less than 30 minutes, not so bad for someone with a fairly short attention span like him. And, guess what, it couldn't get any better than this: no clean up was required!

The staff at the counter was very friendly, too. Ah, what am I saying?! <em>All </em>the staff there were friendly throughout our visit... :) The little guy smiled from cheek to cheek the moment he stepped in! Mind you, he even gave one of them a big hug near the entrance!

Anyway, the staff at the counter helped our little guy in his very first cookie baking session, while I got carried away enjoying it myself... (I know... shame on me! :P )  She stacked 2 stools to prop him up so that he could reach the counter. Then, she guided him to place the dough and flatten it.

[caption id="attachment_477" align="aligncenter" width="272" caption="Flattening the dough..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-477" title="62_bake_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_01.jpg?w=272" alt="Flattening the dough..." width="272" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_478" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Resisting the temptation to pick the choc chips out"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-478" title="62_bake_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Resisting the temptation to pick the choc chips out" width="300" height="211" /></a>[/caption]

The hardest part for the little guy was to wait while we baked the cookies. He kept on staring at the oven, probably wondering why the cookies had to go inside and why everyone screamed at him whenever he wanted to check on the cookies...

[caption id="attachment_479" align="aligncenter" width="208" caption="Patience is a virtue..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-479" title="62_bake_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_04.jpg?w=208" alt="Patience is a virtue..." width="208" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Actually, he only needed to wait for about less than 15 minutes. Yet, I guess, after all the excitement at the indoor playground, he just couldn't take it anymore. He fell asleep before the cookies were ready.

Now, take a look at our freshly baked cookies... and the cute tin (on the left). I still remember how the sweet smell lingered, stirring up our appetites. Hhhhmmmm....

[caption id="attachment_480" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Yummy, yummy..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-480" title="62_bake_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/62_bake_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Yummy, yummy..." width="300" height="186" /></a>[/caption]

I guess it was good that the little guy had fallen asleep then. Otherwise, he would surely have finished everything before we got the chance to put the cookies into the tin! Hee hee...

We let him have his share when we were at home in the afternoon. And his verdict? <em>Yummy, yummy</em>!]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Monkey See, Monkey Do]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>492</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-11-27 19:32:05</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-11-27 11:32:05</wp:post_date_gmt>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>School of Fun Goes to Macau!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/27/school-of-fun-goes-to-macau/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 27 Nov 2010 11:47:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=485</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When you stay in an island country like Singapore, you are simply bound to go abroad at least once in your lifetime. This school holiday season, again, it is like a phenomenon in which many parents bring their school-going kids to take a holiday abroad all together. Our little guy hasn't gone to any preschool yet, but we decided to join these parents.

Without much planning, we packed our suitcase and a travel book, while praying fervently that everything would turn out fine. Surely, you've heard about all the hassles traveling with a toddler, haven't you?

We put our fear aside and braved the 3.5 hour journey. Our destination? Macau... :)

Yet, bringing the little guy proved to be like hauling a 24-hour entertainment-on-the-go. Notice the word "hauling" there? Well, he simply refused anyone else to carry him. I think I've built more muscles throughout our days there from carrying him and my bulky camera. Made me feel like a super woman... Ha! Heee heee... :P

Still, like I said earlier, our trip wouldn't be fun without him. True enough, we went to catch the famous <a href="http://www.cirquedusoleil.com/en/welcome.aspx">Cirque du Soleil</a> there. Yet, it was the little guy's daring stunt that made us hold our breath most of the time. Like when he scampered from one end to another on a seesaw.... &gt;_&lt; *<em>gasp</em>*

[caption id="attachment_491" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Introducing the novel way to play seesaw alone"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-491" title="63_macau_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Introducing the novel way to play seesaw alone" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Our little guy was very helpful, too. He always made sure that we brought our luggage. Whenever and wherever we went. Even later on after we had settled in our hotel room for the night... :P

And when indeed we needed to bring along our luggage, he went the extra mile. He didn't mind pulling our luggage even though it was bigger than him!

[caption id="attachment_493" align="aligncenter" width="159" caption="Monkey See, Monkey Do"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-493" title="63_macau_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_021.jpg?w=159" alt="Monkey See, Monkey Do" width="159" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

His curiosity was amazing. He made us look at all the little things that we would otherwise fail to admire... :)

[caption id="attachment_494" align="aligncenter" width="242" caption="Plane, Plane, where are you?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-494" title="63_macau_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_06.jpg?w=242" alt="Plane, Plane, where are you?" width="242" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_495" align="aligncenter" width="208" caption="Curiosity didn&#039;t kill the cat"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-495" title="63_macau_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_03.jpg?w=208" alt="Curiosity didn't kill the cat" width="208" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

When mealtime came, he would be the first to alert us to quickly find a place to eat. And yup, he never seems to be out of idea when it comes to showing us the best way to enjoy a meal. Like when he enjoyed his oodles of noodles...

[caption id="attachment_496" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Slurp... yummy, yummy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-496" title="63_macau_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_08.jpg?w=225" alt="Slurp... yummy, yummy!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Best of all, just because we were on holiday, it didn't mean that the learning experience had to stop. Just take a look at our budding photographer!
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_497" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Press here..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-497  " title="63_macau_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Press here..." width="300" height="245" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_498" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Say cheese!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-498" title="63_macau_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Say cheese!" width="300" height="231" /></a>[/caption]

And finally, he made sure that we stayed in touch, using the technology, even though we were away... :)

[caption id="attachment_499" align="aligncenter" width="197" caption="Hooray for free internet!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-499" title="63_macau_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/63_macau_07.jpg?w=197" alt="Hooray for free internet!" width="197" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Awww... wondering when our next holiday would be! ;)]]></content:encoded>

		<title>64_snake_06</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/30/when-life-throws-you-toilet-papers/64_snake_06/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Nov 2010 07:24:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_06.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>511</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-11-30 15:24:51</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-11-30 07:24:51</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>64_snake_06</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>504</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>When Life Throws You Toilet Papers...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/30/when-life-throws-you-toilet-papers/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 30 Nov 2010 07:43:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=504</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Make some crafts! Especially if you find yourself having too many toilet paper rolls... :P

After leaving our routine art &amp; craft session for a very long time, we return with a vengeance. We simply had so many toilet paper rolls that we could no longer delay making anything out of them. And we couldn't afford to just stop doing only one...

We drew our first inspiration from <a href="http://www.playpennies.com/snake-guest-post/">this post by Emma Kelly</a>.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>toilet paper roll</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
	<li>white paper (to make eyes, since we don't use wiggly eyes)</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we painted the toilet paper roll. I used a clothes peg to make it easier to hold the roll when the little guy painted.

[caption id="attachment_506" align="aligncenter" width="219" caption="Mixing the colors..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-506" title="64_snake_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_01.jpg?w=219" alt="Mixing the colors..." width="219" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_507" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Brush, brush.."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-507" title="64_snake_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Brush, brush.." width="300" height="295" /></a>[/caption]

Then, we cut out a spiral. We cut the shape of the head and added the eyes *<em>blue eyes! Meet our stylish snake! Ha!</em>* and a smile.

There you go, our friendly snake...

[caption id="attachment_508" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Stylish Smiley Snake"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-508" title="64_snake_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Stylish Smiley Snake" width="300" height="227" /></a>[/caption]

Like I mentioned earlier, we couldn't afford stopping at one. So, we moved on to our next project.

I thought it would be great to make some other puppets to accompany our stylish smiley friend.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>toilet paper rolls</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>cardboard</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>stapler</li>
	<li>sticky tapes</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We, or rather, I, drew a boy and a girl on a not-so-thick, not-so-thin cardboard. This was the part where I wished my hubby was just right next to me so that he could draw a better version...:'( <em>*awww!</em>*

[caption id="attachment_509" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A boy and a girl"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-509" title="64_snake_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_04.jpg?w=300" alt="A boy and a girl" width="300" height="206" /></a>[/caption]

Then, I cut them out. Notice that I added a kind of base for each of them.

[caption id="attachment_510" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Cutting out the puppets"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-510" title="64_snake_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Cutting out the puppets" width="300" height="240" /></a>[/caption]

I thought coloring them would be nice. But, I guess, I should just leave that task to the little guy when he's older and able to color them nicely. I didn't have the heart to let him just anyhow color them... :S

So, the next thing to was to place this puppet around a toilet paper roll. I used a stapler. Yet, after stapling them on the base, I realised that it might not be safe for the little guy. His itchy, tiny fingers might just try to play around with the staples. So, I put some sticky tapes around the staples.

[caption id="attachment_512" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Standing together, at last..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_061.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-512" title="64_snake_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_061.jpg?w=300" alt="Standing together, at last..." width="300" height="231" /></a>[/caption]

Great! Now we have a snake, a boy and a girl.

Since we have those puppets now, shouldn't a story-telling session follow? I scratched my head trying to think of a famous fairy tale or story with a snake, a boy and a girl. Yet, the only thing that crossed my mind was: <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adam_and_Eve">the story of Adam and Eve</a>.... :)

Oh well, the story of Adam and Eve it shall be... We realised something was missing, though: the tree! So, again, we moved on to the next project... Hehehe, told you we were back with a vengeance!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>cardboard</li>
	<li>color papers (for the tree, we use the leftover from <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/08/have-you-seen-a-blue-cat/">this</a>, and for the fruits)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>glue</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

This project was relatively fast to make since we still had some colorful "hands" to use. We just needed to paste two hands on the cardboard (for the trunk).

[caption id="attachment_513" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Hullo, Tree!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-513" title="64_snake_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_07.jpg?w=225" alt="Hullo, Tree!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy then faithfully pasted the "fruits", which we cut out from a brochure. Notice that he was multitasking ... Every time he pasted one fruit, he would turn and play with his <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/14/mini-portable-aquarium/">mini portable aquarium</a> for a while.

[caption id="attachment_514" align="aligncenter" width="206" caption="Adding the fruits..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-514" title="64_snake_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_08.jpg?w=206" alt="Adding the fruits..." width="206" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And finally, our tree of forbidden fruits!

[caption id="attachment_515" align="aligncenter" width="238" caption="Polka dot tree"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_09.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-515" title="64_snake_09" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_09.jpg?w=238" alt="Polka dot tree" width="238" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And here's the scene that we made for the story.

[caption id="attachment_516" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The story of Adam and Eve"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_10.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-516" title="64_snake_10" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/11/64_snake_10.jpg?w=300" alt="The story of Adam and Eve" width="300" height="207" /></a>[/caption]

Okie... now, don't complain about why our version of Adam and Eve are so well dressed. You see, it's good to plan ahead here... :P Who knows, we might use the puppets for other stories... ;) *<em>uhm, provided that these puppets survived the wear and tear...</em>*]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Unwrapping the Gift of Life</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/03/unwrapping-the-gift-of-life/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 03 Dec 2010 08:58:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=522</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Another year has passed and it's time to unwrap another gift... :)

Life is certainly a gift and our little guy has just celebrated his 2nd birthday. Sadly, he was down with fever on his big day. We had to cancel most of the things we had planned out for him.

Yet, to him, the fever was no valid reason to skip all the tradition. Being sick is no reason <em>not </em>to celebrate this gift of life. So, he unwrapped his present, clapped as we sang happy birthday for him, "made his wishes" and blew the candles on his (slice of) cake. Of course, he wrapped everything up by finishing the slice of cake... ;)

[caption id="attachment_523" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Unwrapping his gift..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/65_two_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-523" title="65_two_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/65_two_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Unwrapping his gift..." width="300" height="187" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_524" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Flashing his new car, assembled by daddy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/65_two_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-524" title="65_two_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/65_two_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Flashing his new car, assembled by daddy" width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_525" align="aligncenter" width="227" caption="The Little Guy and His Tiny Cake"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/65_two_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-525" title="65_two_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/65_two_03.jpg?w=227" alt="The Little Guy and His Tiny Cake" width="227" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
