							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Dear Santa</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/07/dear-santa/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 07 Dec 2010 04:12:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paper-plate"><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=529</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Did you know that 6 December is St Nicholas' Day? And did you know that the story of Santa Claus begins with St Nicholas?

When I was a kid, it was usually on this date that we would all be busy writing a letter to Santa Claus, telling him whether we had been good or bad (although chances are he already knows!) and what we really wanted for Christmas.

And now that I'm the grown-up, it's time for me to pass down the tradition... :)

Yet, before that, I think the little guy needs to know how Santa Claus looks like first. It's hard to write a letter to someone you never met before, isn't it?

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>paper plates (2)</li>
	<li>red crepe paper</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>cotton wool</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_535" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready for Santa Claus"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-535" title="66_santa_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready for Santa Claus" width="300" height="203" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we cut one of the paper plates into a Santa's hat. We also used the leftover to make one small circle.

[caption id="attachment_536" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The template is ready!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-536" title="66_santa_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_02.jpg?w=225" alt="The template is ready!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Then, it was time to prepare the crepe paper... :) We cut the crepe paper into small pieces and pasted them onto the surface of the hat.

[caption id="attachment_537" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Gotta love the color!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-537" title="66_santa_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Gotta love the color!" width="300" height="215" /></a>[/caption]

This was the part that the little guy was supposed to do. Yet, he seemed to be not in the mood to do any pasting yesterday. He was more interested to take a grasp of crepe papers and throw them into the air. Replace those crepe papers with flower petals, and he would remind you of those cute little page boys and flower girls at weddings!  :P

Next was to paste some cotton wool. We only started this part a few hours after we first started our art &amp; craft activity, since the little guy had totally lost his interest.

[caption id="attachment_538" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ho-ho-hat!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-538" title="66_santa_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Ho-ho-hat!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Then, we pasted the hat on the "face", which is the other paper plate.

We drew eyes and mouth and finally, added the mustache. We didn't add the beard, however, since the edge of the plate looks like beard... :)

[caption id="attachment_539" align="aligncenter" width="230" caption="Hullo, Santa Claus!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-539" title="66_santa_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/66_santa_05.jpg?w=230" alt="Hullo, Santa Claus!" width="230" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Okie, we'd better get our letter ready now... ;)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Car Wash</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/08/car-wash/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 08 Dec 2010 04:04:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=544</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There's nothing new about this. Every time anyone in the house is down with flu, I make sure the little guy's toys are "professionally cleaned" ... :) No, we don't send the toys anywhere to be cleaned. That's just another way to say that the toys are to be properly sanitized to ensure the flu germs don't spread to anyone... ;)

Usually, I would clean his toys when he has fallen asleep. Yet, this time round, the little guy offered his help. The weather was great, so I let him help out.
<p style="text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="" align="aligncenter" width="194" caption="First, soak the towel.."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/67_carwash_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-546 " title="67_carwash_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/67_carwash_03.jpg?w=194" alt="First, soak the towel.." width="194" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_554" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Then, squeeze..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/67_carwash_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-554" title="67_carwash_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/67_carwash_021.jpg?w=300" alt="Then, squeeze..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_555" align="aligncenter" width="228" caption="And, wipe!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/67_carwash_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-555" title="67_carwash_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/67_carwash_011.jpg?w=228" alt="And, wipe!" width="228" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

He got really excited about this whole car wash thing! I think we should do this more often... :D]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Here Comes the Christmas Tree!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/09/here-comes-the-christmas-tree/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Dec 2010 15:29:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=558</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Listening to Andy Williams' song "It's the Most Wonderful Time of the Year", we just couldn't agree more with him. Christmas really <em>is</em> the most wonderful time... :)

All of a sudden, we have tons of craft ideas. There are so many ideas that we sometimes feel lost if we don't quickly jot them down somewhere! We could easily blame the holiday atmosphere (<em>aka: no pressing deadlines looming...:P</em>) for this sudden idea explosion. Yet, we'd rather say that it is simply because Christmas is coming. It's hard not to feel excited when Christmas is just a few days away... :)

Now that we've introduced <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/07/dear-santa/">Santa Claus</a> to the little guy, Christmas tree is the next one in the list.

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>card boards (we used dark green and light green)</li>
	<li>white paper (for template, optional)</li>
	<li>stickers (lots of them!)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we drew half the Christmas tree on a folded white paper. We then cut along the line and voila, we had our template ready... :) We then used the template to get two identical trees using the dark green and light green card boards.

[caption id="attachment_560" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Let&#039;s rock around the X&#039;mas Trees!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/68_xmastree_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-560" title="68_xmastree_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/68_xmastree_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Let's rock around the X'mas Trees!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The next part was the little guy's favorite: pasting stickers all over the Christmas trees... :)

[caption id="attachment_561" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Decorating the Christmas Tree"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/68_xmastree_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-561" title="68_xmastree_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/68_xmastree_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Decorating the Christmas Tree" width="300" height="205" /></a>[/caption]

And here's the final part: we cut a slit along the bottom half on one Christmas tree and along the top half on the other one. We slipped the two trees together along the slits and... tadaaa.... our very own Christmas tree!

[caption id="attachment_562" align="aligncenter" width="209" caption="O Christmas Tree..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/68_xmastree_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-562" title="68_xmastree_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/68_xmastree_03.jpg?w=209" alt="O Christmas Tree..." width="209" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We could have added a yellow star to put on top of the tree.But, let's just keep that for tomorrow's activity... :)

As for now... Okie, aren't we all ready to sing the Christmas songs around the Christmas tree now?! ;)

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to Making Yakitori</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/13/the-little-guys-guide-to-making-yakitori/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 12 Dec 2010 16:01:39 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Playdoh]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="playdoh"><![CDATA[Playdoh]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=565</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Somehow, last week's dinner menu included satay and yakitori. Both included grilling and most importantly, skewers. On these two different days, the little guy observed me closely as I soaked the skewers in water and threaded the meat pieces onto the skewers. He seemed very interested...

No doubt, given a skewer, he would straight away give me a free demo, showing me that he, too, could do that interesting thing that seemed to keep me occupied, instead of playing with him. Of course, giving him a real skewer is never a good idea. So, I gave him a chopstick and watched him carefully as he played around with it, along with Play Doh.

He was so excited when I gave him "balls" of Play Doh. Chef Little Guy quickly threaded the balls onto the skewer.

[caption id="attachment_566" align="aligncenter" width="214" caption="Threading... one, two, three..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-566" title="69_yakitori_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_01.jpg?w=214" alt="Threading... one, two, three..." width="214" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, the fun didn't stop there. He then took out all the balls from the skewer and flattened some of them using his hands.

[caption id="attachment_567" align="aligncenter" width="179" caption="Smash!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-567" title="69_yakitori_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_02.jpg?w=179" alt="Smash!" width="179" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Next, he took one of his fave fire truck and pressed it against one of the flattened balls. I think he liked to see the mark left behind by the truck since he then took another car and a figurine to press against another flattened play doh.

[caption id="attachment_569" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Vroom..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-569" title="69_yakitori_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Vroom..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

When all had been properly "marked", he took them one by one and yes, threaded them onto the skewer again... :) Apparently, he wanted the yakitori to have a different look from the first yakitori he made! Hee hee... I guess, next time I should give him more than just one skewer and lend him my grill pan!

[caption id="attachment_568" align="aligncenter" width="162" caption="Yakitori, Anyone?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-568" title="69_yakitori_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/69_yakitori_04.jpg?w=162" alt="Yakitori, Anyone?" width="162" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<title>70_party_01</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/13/party-time/70_party_01/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Dec 2010 14:09:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_01.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Crabby plate on the wall]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>573</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-12-13 22:09:19</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-12-13 14:09:19</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>70_party_01</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>572</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>attachment</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_01.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/12/70_party_01.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Party Time!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/13/party-time/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Dec 2010 14:36:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=572</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It was party time for the little guy last Saturday. We invited some of his friends for a finger painting session at home. Yup, you could imagine how noisy and messy it was! Just put together 11 babies/toddlers in one room and you'll get the idea!

I think I was more excited than the little guy when it came to the preparation... :P

[caption id="attachment_573" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Crabby plate on the wall"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-573" title="70_party_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Crabby plate on the wall" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_574" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Smiley sun on the wall"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-574" title="70_party_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Smiley sun on the wall" width="300" height="209" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_575" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Crabby and Octopus Sausages on the Buffet Spread"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-575" title="70_party_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Crabby and Octopus Sausages on the Buffet Spread" width="300" height="229" /></a>[/caption]

Nope, the little guy didn't really paint, either. He was more interested in taking pictures of his friends busy painting. And when the artworks were up to dry, he went one around to check on them. He really acted like an art expert, ready to give his critiques for each piece... :P

[caption id="attachment_576" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Point... point..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-576" title="70_party_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Point... point..." width="300" height="202" /></a>[/caption]

Anyway, I just love to see the lines of artworks! I love how each toddler took many different colors and used many different tools to paint, from brush, balls to cars.

[caption id="attachment_581" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Excavator painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_081.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-581" title="70_party_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_081.jpg?w=300" alt="Excavator painting" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_577" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The first batch of artworks"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-577" title="70_party_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The first batch of artworks" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_582" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The mess..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_09.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-582" title="70_party_09" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_09.jpg?w=300" alt="The mess..." width="300" height="150" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, the little guy felt it wouldn't be fun if he didn't invite his friends to climb the window and wave bye-bye to the trains... :P

[caption id="attachment_583" align="aligncenter" width="193" caption="Bye, Choo-choo!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_10.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-583" title="70_party_10" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_10.jpg?w=193" alt="Bye, Choo-choo!" width="193" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

At the end of the party, each little artist brought home his or her own art work, leaving the wall empty (and white) once again. Each of them also brought home the clothes peg used to hang the artwork. Not just another clothes peg, of course... ;)

[caption id="attachment_578" align="aligncenter" width="215" caption="Honey Stars Butterfly Clothes Peg"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-578" title="70_party_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_06.jpg?w=215" alt="Honey Stars Butterfly Clothes Peg" width="215" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy surely had a great time at the party... :D I hope his friends did, too!

[caption id="attachment_579" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A little thank-you note"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-579" title="70_party_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/70_party_07.jpg?w=300" alt="A little thank-you note" width="300" height="139" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<title>71_water_03</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/16/the-green-water-project/71_water_03/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Dec 2010 15:54:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_03.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Water.. here, there and everywhere]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>589</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2010-12-15 23:54:46</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2010-12-15 15:54:46</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>71_water_03</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>inherit</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>585</wp:post_parent>

		<item>
		<title>The Green Water Project</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/16/the-green-water-project/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 15 Dec 2010 16:02:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=585</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Seriously, most of the time, it doesn't take expensive toys to entertain a toddler. But most of the time, it takes a lot of plan Bs (or Cs, and so on).

Just like the other day when I found out that he wasn't interested at all in making this Christmas tree... I thought making a Christmas tree together would entertain him. Yet, in fact, he was actually more interested in pulling the card boards apart...&gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_586" align="aligncenter" width="181" caption="Uh-oh Christmas Tree!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-586" title="71_water_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_05.jpg?w=181" alt="Uh-oh Christmas Tree!" width="181" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

So, since he has been showing interest in playing with glasses and water lately, I let him play while I tried to finish making the Christmas tree... :)

I brought out the big, wide pail and went to find my measuring cups. To make it more interesting, I also dyed the water green. He watched closely as the dye dissolved in water. Trust me, even at this stage, I knew that I had won his heart!

[caption id="attachment_587" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Turning the water green"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-587" title="71_water_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Turning the water green" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I put all the measuring cups inside the big pail. That way, there would be less mess to deal with after this activity... :)

[caption id="attachment_588" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to measure"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-588" title="71_water_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready to measure" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And of course, he didn't need much instruction to start playing around with those cups...

[caption id="attachment_589" align="aligncenter" width="248" caption="Water.. here, there and everywhere"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-589" title="71_water_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_03.jpg?w=248" alt="Water.. here, there and everywhere" width="248" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

For a good thirty minutes, he sat there, moving the water around from one container to another using different measuring cups. Good enough for me to get other things done! Ha! &gt;:D

Things got even more interesting when I let him use a syringe. He giggled and squirted the green water (into the pail, thankfully) ... :D

[caption id="attachment_590" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Squirt.. squirt..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-590" title="71_water_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/71_water_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Squirt.. squirt..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hmm.. maybe I should let him experiment with other colors, too... :D Mixing colors, etc... I'd say, it would be really fun!!!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Chuck the Bean Truck]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Give a Toddler Some Beans...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/17/give-a-toddler-some-beans/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Dec 2010 06:35:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beans"><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=595</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[...and you'll get at least (almost) half an hour of fun! :)

Of course, not just beans. Throw in a muffin tin or other container to add the elements of fun. Frankly, it's been some time since I last used my muffin tin as... well, a real muffin tin. Yet, I still think that this muffin tin has proven to be a good investment after all!

Remember <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/16/the-green-water-project/ ‎" target="_blank">The Green Water Project</a> that we just had the other day? It turned out that the little guy still likes playing with the measuring cups and spoons. So, we counted them in... ;)

[caption id="attachment_596" align="aligncenter" width="201" caption="Bean Here, Bean There Again!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/72_bean_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-596" title="72_bean_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/72_bean_01.jpg?w=201" alt="Bean Here, Bean There Again!" width="201" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Here how it went: the little guy scooped some beans from the plastic container and dropped them into the muffin tin. He used different spoons each time, but I don't think he was aware that there was a difference in the number of beans he could spoon with a different spoon yet. He just loved scooping and the  "clang, clang" sound every time he dropped the beans into the tin.

[caption id="attachment_597" align="aligncenter" width="268" caption="Scoop-a-doo-yeaa..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/72_bean_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-597" title="72_bean_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/72_bean_02.jpg?w=268" alt="Scoop-a-doo-yeaa..." width="268" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He also added another variation to this activity by including his favorite Chuck the Dump Truck... hee hee... :P

[caption id="attachment_598" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Chuck the Bean Truck"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/72_bean_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-598" title="72_bean_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/72_bean_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Chuck the Bean Truck" width="300" height="209" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad this activity couldn't keep the little guy occupied for a long time, like in <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/16/the-green-water-project/%20%E2%80%8E" target="_blank">The Green Water Project</a>. I sensed that it was probably because I interfered too much. You see, I supervised him closely while he was playing with the beans as I was afraid that any of those beans might end inside his nose, ears or mouth. I don't fancy the idea of rushing the little guy to the emergency room... :P Every time he made a suspicious movement, for example touching his ears, I asked him to show me his hands. I guess that frustrated him after a while... :P

Oh well... better safe than sorry.]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Goin&#039; on a Wild Ride!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/17/goin-on-a-wild-ride/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 17 Dec 2010 06:57:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=601</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is just the perfect thing to make when feeling lazy to do anything too fancy... ;) I especially love the fact that it looks very nice in photos. Hahaha... :D Hey, it almost even looks like a real expensive toy set! Just check it out yourself!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>drawing papers (card boards would be better, actually)</li>
	<li>cloth tape (we used grey cloth tape)</li>
	<li>masking tape (you could use white paper, too!)</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>toy cars</li>
	<li>wooden blocks or lego</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

To say that it's as easy as 1, 2, 3 would be an overstatement. There is only one step! All you need to do is just to tag the drawing paper with the cloth tape and you'll get one straight road. Add some masking tapes and you'll get the road divider... ;)

Make more and you'll get one whole track for the little one to play with his toy cars. Ha! Told you it's easy to make!
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_602" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A busy, yet peaceful street"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/73_road_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-602 " title="73_road_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/73_road_01.jpg?w=300" alt="A busy, yet peaceful street" width="300" height="180" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_603" align="aligncenter" width="222" caption="Uh-oh... there&#039;s a police car!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/73_road_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-603" title="73_road_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/73_road_02.jpg?w=222" alt="Uh-oh... there's a police car!" width="222" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

You could use wooden blocks or lego to make the surrounding buildings. The more colorful, the more interesting... :) If you have some tree figurines or even dinosaur figurines, you could add them in, too! It would be just as fun as creating a Jurassic Park scene! Hee hee... :P

But, who needs dinosaurs to make a Jurassic Park scene if you have one little godzilla like mine going on a wild ride in the house? Hee heee... :P

[caption id="attachment_604" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Accidents do happen with the little godzilla around"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/73_road_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-604" title="73_road_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/73_road_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Accidents do happen with the little godzilla around" width="300" height="207" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<title>74_snow_03</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/23/let-it-snow/74_snow_03/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Dec 2010 08:13:59 +0000</pubDate>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Let It Snow!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/23/let-it-snow/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 23 Dec 2010 08:21:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=608</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I realized it wasn't so great an idea to get a silver tinsel after all. The color just doesn't make it stand out. In fact, it looks rather dull on its own.

It certainly calls for something else to make it look nicer... :) So, there I went trying to recall something that I learned back in primary school: paper snowflakes!

I love to see how this:

[caption id="attachment_609" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Making of Red Snowflake "]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-609" title="74_snow_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Making of Red Snowflake " width="300" height="199" /></a>[/caption]

could turn into one of these:

[caption id="attachment_610" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Colorful snowflakes"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-610" title="74_snow_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Colorful snowflakes" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I also love the fact that each is unique. I always find it hard to make two with the same patterns... :P

The little guy wanted to help out, but he couldn't do much since this whole thing requires a pair of scissors. Instead, it was fun 'snow' games for him... :D

[caption id="attachment_611" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Falling snow!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-611" title="74_snow_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Falling snow!" width="300" height="206" /></a>[/caption]

He also enjoyed throwing paper 'snowball', which was basically just a crumpled piece of paper, around while waiting for me putting the snowflakes up.

[caption id="attachment_612" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Snowy with a chance of snowballs"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-612" title="74_snow_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_05.jpg?w=212" alt="Snowy with a chance of snowballs" width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And here how our tinsel looks like now... :)

[caption id="attachment_613" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Finally, more colors!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-613" title="74_snow_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/74_snow_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Finally, more colors!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>let-it-snow</wp:post_name>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"800";s:6:"height";s:3:"600";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='96' width='128'";s:4:"file";s:87:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/12/75_beads_11.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1293105586";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:3:"160";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:17:"0.033333333333333";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_image_alt</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Making a list and checkin' it twice...]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Rock &#039;n Roll Beads</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/25/rock-n-roll-beads/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 25 Dec 2010 08:55:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=620</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is currently one of his favorite toys.

[caption id="attachment_622" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A truckload of beads"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-622" title="75_beads_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_01.jpg?w=300" alt="A truckload of beads" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Even after he found the beads coming off, he still insists on playing with the beads. With a chopstick... :)

[caption id="attachment_624" align="aligncenter" width="185" caption="Chopstick and Beads"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-624" title="75_beads_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_02.jpg?w=185" alt="Chopstick and Beads" width="185" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, the more beads, the merrier! :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>newspapers (cut into strips)</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors or cutter</li>
	<li>paints<strong> </strong></li>
	<li>paintbrush</li>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
</ol>
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_627" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready for festive fun beads"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-627 " title="75_beads_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready for festive fun beads" width="300" height="192" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, we made the newspaper strips into quills. The little guy helped with the glue.

[caption id="attachment_628" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Glue here..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-628" title="75_beads_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Glue here..." width="300" height="221" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_631" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="(Still) Boring Beads"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-631" title="75_beads_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_05.jpg?w=300" alt="(Still) Boring Beads" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Then, it was up to the little guy, his brush and the paints to turn the beads into festive fun beads... :P Basically, I just let him roll the beads in puddles of colors using a paintbrush. After a while, he also used his fingers.
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-632 " title="75_beads_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Rock n Roll inspiration" width="300" height="218" /></a></dt> <dd class="wp-caption-dd">Rock n Roll inspiration</dd> </dl></div>
He wasn't that patient to wait for the beads to dry. So, I took one piece of drawing paper to let him roll the beads on to dry. Lo and behold! We just created an abstract painting to admire!

[caption id="attachment_633" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Abstract Bead Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-633" title="75_beads_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Abstract Bead Painting" width="300" height="184" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, the more colors we used, the more abstract our beads became...

[caption id="attachment_634" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A pile of paper beads"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-634" title="75_beads_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_08.jpg?w=300" alt="A pile of paper beads" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

There you go, we have a lot of beads to play with now! We could thread the beads using all sorts of things, from chopstick, yarns to even pens!
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_635" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A String of Fun"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_09.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-635 " title="75_beads_09" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_09.jpg?w=300" alt="A String of Fun" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

We also have an abstract painting to show off at the end... :)

[caption id="attachment_637" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Absolutely Abstract"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_101.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-637" title="75_beads_10" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_101.jpg?w=300" alt="Absolutely Abstract" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And guess what we used the painting for... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_638" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Making a list and checkin&#39; it twice..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_11.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-638" title="75_beads_11" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/75_beads_11.jpg?w=300" alt="Making a list and checkin' it twice..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, gift tags! Nice... :) At least it doesn't get wasted... ;)

Merry Christmas everyone!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Traffic Jam!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/26/traffic-jam/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 25 Dec 2010 16:07:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=647</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It's the time of the year again! Some people would rush home to their loved ones, while some others would crowd eating places to celebrate Christmas with their family and friends. Certainly, there would be also some who are on shopping spree... :P

We didn't go anywhere far this Christmas. Yet, we could tell that the traffic out there must be pretty heavy!

[caption id="attachment_648" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Live Traffic News: Traffic Jam!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/77_traffic_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-648" title="77_traffic_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/77_traffic_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Live Traffic News: Traffic Jam!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Hehehe... at least, that was what we saw at home. The little guy was busy directing the traffic the whole afternoon with his new truck collection... :)

Aww, he's a lucky guy, indeed!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_01.jpg</wp:attachment_url>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2010/12/78_fish_01.jpg]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>Something Fishy</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/31/something-fishy/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 31 Dec 2010 07:19:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paper-plate"><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=652</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Obviously, after <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/03/start-your-engine-gentlemen/" target="_blank">this incident</a>, we've got plenty of aluminium foil to use. We also have quite a number of paper plates from various parties we threw during the year. We certainly ought to make something fun... ;)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>aluminium foil</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>paper plate</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

What we were about to make was certainly very easy to make. Yet, it took us about 2 days to complete... :P

First, we prepared the 'fish' from the paper plate.

<p style="text-align:center;">
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-653 " title="78_fish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The (Not quite) fish bone" width="300" height="225" /></a></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">The (not quite) fish bone</dd></dl></div>
Next was the little guy's part: sticking the scales.

[caption id="attachment_654" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Oeey Gloooey glue"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-654" title="78_fish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Oeey Gloooey glue" width="300" height="239" /></a>[/caption]

For the scales, we used small pieces of aluminium foil. At first, I actually bothered to cut them nicely, in the shape of real fish scales. Then, I realised, the little guy was just happy tearing the aluminium foil on his own. Haha... which kid doesn't like to tear anyway?

[caption id="attachment_655" align="aligncenter" width="188" caption="&#039;Dressing&#039; the fish up"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-655" title="78_fish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_03.jpg?w=188" alt="'Dressing' the fish up" width="188" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

When I saw him playing with the glue instead of sticking the scales, I called it a day. We continued sticking the scales a few days later, when, to him, it looked like a novel thing to do once again... :P

And finally, the fish is ready to be served.... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_656" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="There&#039;s Something Fishy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-656" title="78_fish_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/78_fish_04.jpg?w=300" alt="There's Something Fishy! " width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>School of Fun Goes to the Underwater World</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/31/school-of-fun-goes-to-the-underwater-world/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 31 Dec 2010 08:01:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=664</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Who, in her right mind, would choose to visit a popular tourist spot on a holiday season?! I certainly have lost my mind when I decided to bring the whole clan to the <a href="http://www.underwaterworld.com.sg/" target="_blank">Underwater World Sentosa</a> that Monday.

Defending myself wasn't that difficult, though... :P The lure of the "Pay like a Child, Play like a Child" promotion plus the promise we had made to bring the little guy there as his birthday gift were certainly the factors that brought us there... :P

As you could have guessed, it was very crowded. So crowded that we could barely move around to see the fishes. Still, we could tell that the little guy enjoyed himself. His favorite? The tunnel! :) We went inside many times... :P

The little guy also seemed interested to touch the stingrays in the  touch pool. Yet, again, it was too crowded to make room for him to touch  any.

The Fur Seals LIVE and Meet-the-Dolphins sessions were certainly a hit. We got ourselves a nice place to sit and watch about one hour before the sessions. So, this time round, we could enjoy ourselves without being squeezed from left and right... :) And the seals and dolphins? We just wish we could bring them home!

I guess we should go there again next time.. :) *<em>dropping a BIG hint</em>*

[caption id="attachment_666" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Jellyfish!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/80_seaworld_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-666" title="80_seaworld_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2010/12/80_seaworld_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Jellyfish!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>664</wp:post_id>

		<item>
		<title>The First Car Wreck in 2011</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/04/the-first-car-wreck-in-2011/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 Jan 2011 06:53:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=668</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[[caption id="attachment_669" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Literally broken into pieces..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/84_car_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-669" title="84_car_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/84_car_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Literally broken into pieces..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Barely surviving its first week, this car wreck certainly beats <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/09/22/vroom-vroom-painting/" target="_blank">the 2010 record</a>.

I'd given up trying to fix it. The little guy kept dismantling it after I'd got it fixed. Each time, it got even worse! The last time I tried to fix it, I found that the whole thing couldn't be assembled properly anymore. There must be some broken pieces somewhere.

That makes me think: Maybe he didn't mean to break it... perhaps he was just curious how this tiny thing was assembled before it reached him... :P

Anyway... I don't think we could make any vroom-vroom painting with this one... :P Gotta think of something else!]]></content:encoded>

								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attached_file</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>When It Rained...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/04/when-it-rains/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 04 Jan 2011 08:27:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beans"><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=671</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>Rain on the green grass,</em>
<em> and rain on the tree,</em>
<em> rain on the house-top,</em>
<em> but not on me.</em>

Yesterday, it was raining nearly the whole afternoon. Fortunately, we were at home... :) We certainly kept ourselves busy!

<strong>Brush &amp; Strainer Painting</strong>

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>toothbrush</li>
	<li>strainer</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>water (to dilute the paint)</li>
	<li>papers</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_672" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-672" title="82_spray_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready" width="300" height="154" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, I mixed the paint with some water. That way, it was easier to 'spray' on using the strainer and the brush.

I've been faithfully keeping some old toothbrush. So, we've got one baby toothbrush and one adult toothbrush. That way, the little guy could use one, while I, too could play with the other one. Yet, if you think that the little guy would be contented with the baby toothbrush, ha! ha! He took over the adult toothbrush the moment he saw that it made a BIGGER splash on the paper... :P

More often than not, he took both brushes!

Anyway, nothing fancy here... All we had to do was just brush! :)

[caption id="attachment_673" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Brush... brush..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-673" title="82_spray_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Brush... brush..." width="300" height="188" /></a>[/caption]

Here's what the little guy made:
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-674 " title="82_spray_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_03.jpg?w=300" alt="The Litte Guy's Work of Art" width="300" height="225" /></a></dt> <dd class="wp-caption-dd">The Litte Guy's Work of Art</dd> </dl></div>
And here's what I *<em>ahem</em>* managed to make whenever I could take one of the brushes from the little guy:

[caption id="attachment_675" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Mommy&#039;s Work of Art"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-675" title="82_spray_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Mommy's Work of Art" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Still, the best work of art, I think, was actually found here:

[caption id="attachment_676" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Strainer&#039;s Work of Art"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-676" title="82_spray_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/82_spray_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The Strainer's Work of Art" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It was actually the leftover paint on the strainer after we used it! Don't you think it looks like a globe with the continents? Hee hee... :P Or maybe my imagination was just running too wild.. :P

<strong>We've Got Nuts!</strong>

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>nuts, of course! (we used pistachio nuts)</li>
	<li>muffin tin</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

It was started with eating pistachio nuts... yum yum! Hee hee...

We gathered the shells and used them to play... ;)

First, we put them inside the muffin tin. The little guy happily moved them from one hole to another.

[caption id="attachment_677" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Nut-hopping"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-677" title="83_nut_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Nut-hopping" width="300" height="174" /></a>[/caption]

Then, we also lined up the shells. The little guy insisted on taking the picture himself for this one... :P That was why the picture was rather out of focus.

[caption id="attachment_678" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Nut Train"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-678" title="83_nut_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Nut Train" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It went out pretty well at first.

Then, he started to throw them around and drove his mom crazy... :S

[caption id="attachment_679" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Preparing for the nut rain"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-679" title="83_nut_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Preparing for the nut rain" width="300" height="218" /></a>[/caption]

Okie... end of story! No more nuts to play with... :P

<strong>Clothes Guessing</strong>

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>lots of clothes on a drying rack</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

The rain really turned out to be a blessing in disguise, even though it meant that we had to dry our clothes inside... :)

The little guy had a great time pointing whose clothes, which clothes. He got better and better each time... :)

[caption id="attachment_681" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Daddy&#039;s... this is daddy&#039;s... "]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-681" title="83_nut_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/83_nut_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Daddy's... this is daddy's... " width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

Hehe... thankfully, the little guy's grandparents' clothes were there, too. Otherwise, it would just be: mommy's, daddy's... daddy's, mommy's... :P

There you go! See how busy we were when it was raining... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>671</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_name>when-it-rains</wp:post_name>

		<title>Fold... Goes the X&#039;mas Tree!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/05/fold-goes-the-xmas-tree/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jan 2011 08:21:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=691</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy might not be interested in <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/16/the-green-water-project/" target="_blank">putting up the Christmas tree</a>. Yet, he surely was interested in taking it down... :P

[caption id="attachment_692" align="aligncenter" width="148" caption="Pull, Mommy... pull!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/81_xmas_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-692" title="81_xmas_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/81_xmas_01.jpg?w=148" alt="Pull, Mommy... pull!" width="148" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

After the Christmas tree was down, he offered himself to be next year's Christmas tree.... :P

[caption id="attachment_693" align="aligncenter" width="147" caption="Just need to add a star"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/81_xmas_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-693" title="81_xmas_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/81_xmas_02.jpg?w=147" alt="Just need to add a star" width="147" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Haha... he surely had a blast with all the tinsels!

As for me, I'm just happy to see how we could 'fold' our Christmas tree before we packed everything inside the box.

Nice and...

[caption id="attachment_694" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Neat!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/81_xmas_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-694" title="81_xmas_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/81_xmas_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Neat!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>There&#039;s Something about Thomas</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/06/theres-something-about-thomas/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 05 Jan 2011 16:21:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=698</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There really is something about <a href="www.thomasandfriends.com/" target="_blank">Thomas and Friends</a> that makes kids nowadays love everything about it.

Just when I thought the little guy would never stray from his favorite toys (i.e. cars and trucks), he started shouting "Thomas" every now and then. It could be:

a. he wants to watch Thomas and Friends on TV or on YouTube
b. he sees something with Thomas or any other cute train characters (yup, <a href="chuggington.com/ " target="_blank">Chuggington </a>characters included)

And here's the little guy happily flashing his new favorite shorts (well, sort of).

[caption id="attachment_699" align="aligncenter" width="230" caption="Thomas? Where?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/85_thomas_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-699" title="85_thomas_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/85_thomas_01.jpg?w=230" alt="Thomas? Where?" width="230" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Yup, he loves it very much, except for the fact that the picture is at the back, rather than in front. He must be wondering, if it is his favorite, why does mommy have to put the picture at the back for others, and not for him, to enjoy?

And so... he keeps on trying to take a peek, even if it requires him to stretch his neck... :P

Still, to him, nothing beats steaming around the house on a mommy-powered 'train' while taking pictures of the beautiful scenery... And, oh.. Frosty Bear should come along, too! *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_700" align="aligncenter" width="203" caption="All aboard!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/85_thomas_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-700" title="85_thomas_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/85_thomas_02.jpg?w=203" alt="All aboard!" width="203" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>698</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-01-06 00:21:41</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-01-05 16:21:41</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>theres-something-about-thomas</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<item>
		<title>86_eat_01</title>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=705</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The last time we did our 'spring cleaning', we realised that we've collected quite a number of the little guy's paintings. There are simply so many of them that putting them up on the walls would mean cluttering the walls. So, instead, we used them as table mats ... :)

We didn't get them laminated, so they were more for the little guy and his gang to play with. At the same time, I wanted to teach him how to set the table. So, here's how we accomplished all of them... ;)

First, I let him help me trace to mark where to put what.

[caption id="attachment_706" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Tracing is ON!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-706" title="86_eat_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Tracing is ON!" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, in the end, he was much more interested in playing with the marker. When he started to draw on the floor, I quickly took over and completed the tracing for him before the marker claimed more casualties. Hee hee... :P

[caption id="attachment_707" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="What We Traced..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-707" title="86_eat_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_02.jpg?w=300" alt="What We Traced..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

Next, I showed him how to set the table. He then set another one on the other side.

[caption id="attachment_708" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="How to Set the Table"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-708" title="86_eat_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_03.jpg?w=300" alt="How to Set the Table" width="300" height="223" /></a>[/caption]

At first, I thought I would be his lunch buddy. Yet, apparently, he preferred Frosty the Bear. Mommy was out from his list! &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_709" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="VIP Seat: Frosty the Bear"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-709" title="86_eat_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_04.jpg?w=300" alt="VIP Seat: Frosty the Bear" width="300" height="168" /></a>[/caption]

By then, the little guy had been truly enjoying the whole thing. He started asking me for something to eat. Hehehe, what had I been thinking... why setting the table if there was nothing to eat?!

When I placed his lunch on top of the paper plate, he quickly said grace. Hahaha... couldn't help but to laugh when I saw him doing that... :P He really looked so serious!

[caption id="attachment_710" align="aligncenter" width="157" caption="Say Grace before Eating"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-710" title="86_eat_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_05.jpg?w=157" alt="Say Grace before Eating" width="157" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Then, he ate. He ate SO well! Ha! I think I should do this more often!

[caption id="attachment_711" align="aligncenter" width="192" caption="*Gobble*...."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-711" title="86_eat_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_06.jpg?w=192" alt="*Gobble*...." width="192" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

A few times, I caught him trying to feed Frosty, too... :P Usually after he asked Frosty, "Want...?" with a big smile. Hahaha.. I could see myself in the little guy when he tried to feed Frosty. He practically imitated how I usually feed him.

[caption id="attachment_712" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Try Some, Frosty!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-712" title="86_eat_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Try Some, Frosty!" width="300" height="268" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy looked a bit disappointed when Frosty didn't eat... :P So, I had to open my mouth next to Frosty so that he could feed me instead. Hahaha... so glad that the little guy is no longer eating porridge. Can't imagine if Frosty turns yellowish ... or green ... after this whole thing... :P

After a while, the little guy asked me for another chair. I thought, finally, a seat for me!

But, oops.... :P Nope, it wasn't for me! Haha...
<p style="text-align:center;">

[caption id="attachment_713" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Three&#039;s a crowd"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-713 " title="86_eat_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/86_eat_08.jpg?w=300" alt="Three's a crowd" width="300" height="204" /></a>[/caption]

</p>]]></content:encoded>

				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_image_alt</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[The Little Guy in the Shining Shirt]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Mission Accomplished!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/11/mission-accomplished/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 11 Jan 2011 14:28:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=716</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[You can call it a New Year Resolution. I'd rather consider it as one of the things in my bucket list, but I think that would make it sound too dramatic. So, I guess I'll just stick to calling it: a mission. A wish.

Anyway, it's a wish fulfilled, a mission accomplished... :) *<em>grinning from ear to ear</em>* I finally managed to sew some shirts for the little guy. From scratch!

I couldn't really brag much about it actually. I didn't really make the patterns from scratch. I just took one of the little guy's shirt and roughly traced it to make the patterns. Piece of cake!

[caption id="attachment_717" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Yes! Countdown to Excitement!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-717" title="87_shirt_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Yes! Countdown to Excitement!" width="300" height="184" /></a>[/caption]

The more difficult part was, of course, in sewing them all together, especially the collar... &gt;_&lt; Thankfully, I've got my very own powerful wizard, aka my mom. Yup, it was not only Microsoft Excel that has its own powerful wizard, hee hee... ;) I could consult her whenever I wasn't sure or when I was totally clueless. She could also help me distract the little guy whenever he tried to jump onto my lap to find out what kind of fun his mommy was having.

[caption id="attachment_718" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="So Small and Tricky!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-718" title="87_shirt_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_02.jpg?w=300" alt="So Small and Tricky!" width="300" height="224" /></a>[/caption]

My favorite part? Personalizing the shirt... :) !

[caption id="attachment_719" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fun and Easy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-719" title="87_shirt_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Fun and Easy!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And when finally the shirt was done, the feeling was... downright ecstatic! Never mind if the sewing wasn't really neat... the feeling was still wonderful!

Putting it on the little guy, I realized that its color and pattern make the shirt almost similar to the uniform for the kids in one of the play schools nearby. Hee hee... Oh well, it was the only fabric I had at home. So be it... our very own School of Fun's uniform. Bet you couldn't find it anywhere else. Ha! :P

[caption id="attachment_722" align="aligncenter" width="222" caption="The Little Guy in the Shining Shirt"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-722" title="87_shirt_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_04.jpg?w=222" alt="The Little Guy in the Shining Shirt" width="222" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The feeling was kinda addictive. I thought, hey.. this could probably be a once-in-a-blue-moon kind of thing. So, while the momentum was still there, off I went to the Chinatown to find nice fabric to make into another shirt for the little guy... :)

[caption id="attachment_720" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Flashing New Shirts"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-720" title="87_shirt_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/87_shirt_05.jpg?w=225" alt="Flashing New Shirts" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The red shirt at the back was the one I used to make the patterns. The yellow one is my favorite. That fabric was just too cute to miss! It's just hard not to fall in love with the lines of colorful cars! No wonder the little guy kept asking for the fabric when I was busy sewing!

I know I should be grateful that it's been raining almost every day lately... Otherwise, I might have gone for another retail therapy at Chinatown! :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>A Hint Well Dropped</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/13/a-hint-well-dropped/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 13 Jan 2011 10:40:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=726</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy has been hinting at something!

He's been faithfully walking the dog. Not at an appropriate speed, though.... leaving me no chance to get any decent picture.

He's been taking good care of the dog.

[caption id="attachment_727" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Warm and cozy doggy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/88_dog_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-727" title="88_dog_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/88_dog_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Warm and cozy doggy" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

He's been (pretending) to sleep with the dog.

[caption id="attachment_728" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Nitey nitez, doggy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/88_dog_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-728" title="88_dog_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/88_dog_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Nitey nitez, doggy!" width="300" height="190" /></a>[/caption]

And... he's been feeding the dog, too! &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_729" align="aligncenter" width="253" caption="Finish your milk, doggy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/88_dog_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-729" title="88_dog_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/88_dog_03.jpg?w=253" alt="Finish your milk, doggy!" width="253" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Oopsie daisy....]]></content:encoded>
