		<item>
		<title>Don&#039;t Do This at Home!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/14/dont-do-this-at-home/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 14 Jan 2011 05:39:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=731</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The other day, when I was busy preparing some carrots for the dinner, the little guy kept bugging me. Not the usual 'play-with-me-instead' kind of bugging, mind you. He persistently asked me to let him do the honor of cutting the carrots!

At first, it freaked me out to notice that he has started to get interested in this whole cutting thingy. Even after I left him to keep the cutting board and the knife, he still insisted on asking me to let him play with the carrots.

In the end, I decided to take the leap of faith. I let him use a blunt plastic knife - the most blunt that I could find. I knew it should be pretty harmless. Still, I did not dare to take my eyes off him as he explored his new tool and 'grated' my rock-like carrots!

Obviously, while his mommy was at the verge of having a heart attack, the little guy enjoyed every learning moment. Thankfully, he proved to be extremely careful in handling  the knife. Nevertheless, he attempted to hold the knife with his left hand, instead of his right hand, a few times. Ha! A daredevil, indeed!

[caption id="attachment_732" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Daring Stunt"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/89_cut_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-732" title="89_cut_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/89_cut_01.jpg?w=300" alt="A Daring Stunt" width="300" height="187" /></a>[/caption]

Now a master in cutting, he then sallied forth into the world of a tea time chef. Yup, he proudly prepared his own snack. I think his mommy can soon retire... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_733" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Cut (and Mashed) Banana"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/89_cut_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-733" title="89_cut_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/89_cut_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Cut (and Mashed) Banana" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And guess who was invited for tea time?!

[caption id="attachment_734" align="aligncenter" width="216" caption="The Little Guy&#039;s Best Friend"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/89_cut_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-734" title="89_cut_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/89_cut_03.jpg?w=216" alt="The Little Guy's Best Friend" width="216" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>731</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-01-14 05:39:44</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>dont-do-this-at-home</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<item>
		<title>Chalking Up Another Masterpiece</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/17/chalking-up-another-masterpiece/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 16 Jan 2011 16:03:40 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=740</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As the weather turns not yet for the better to go out and about, the chalks in our home once again become a hot favorite... :)

[caption id="attachment_741" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Rain or Shine... Here I Drew"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/90_chalk_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-741" title="90_chalk_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/90_chalk_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Rain or Shine... Here I Drew" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

This time round, I joined the fun, drawing the little guy's favorite (at least for this month) engine... :)

[caption id="attachment_742" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Choo choo...!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/90_chalk_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-742" title="90_chalk_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/90_chalk_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Choo choo...!" width="300" height="178" /></a>[/caption]

I am so not going to wash the chalk drawings this time! :P

I just hope they are not doing the block washing anytime soon... &gt;_&lt;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>A Cat on a Roll</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/17/a-cat-on-a-roll/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 17 Jan 2011 04:33:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=744</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Once again, it was the time of the year when we had accumulated simply too many toilet paper rolls. So, yup, shout it out: craft time!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>toilet paper roll</li>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>paint brush</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We wanted to make a cat, so we first folded the top part of the roll to make the two pointy ears.

[caption id="attachment_745" align="aligncenter" width="236" caption="Rollin&#039; Fun!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-745" title="91_pet_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_01.jpg?w=236" alt="Rollin' Fun!" width="236" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Next was the little guy's turn: painting. I let him dip the brush into the bottle since there was not much paint left anyway. It certainly stroke a novelty!

[caption id="attachment_746" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Brush.. brush.."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-746" title="91_pet_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Brush.. brush.." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

You'd probably need to squint your eyes a bit, but you'd notice that we put clear tapes around the roll. We put there for a reason, of course... :) Since, we were into pets lately, we decided that this cat, too, should have a collar... just like any other pets in our neighborhood! *<em>grinz</em>*

The final part was to draw the eyes, mouth, etc.

A self-proclaimed photographer of the day, the little guy positioned the cat for him to take a picture.

[caption id="attachment_747" align="aligncenter" width="227" caption="Ready, 1, 2....Cheese!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-747" title="91_pet_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_03.jpg?w=227" alt="Ready, 1, 2....Cheese!" width="227" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Haha... okie, obviously, he wasn't taking a photo of the cat in the above picture... :P Check out what was at the back of the roll... ;)

[caption id="attachment_748" align="aligncenter" width="195" caption="Okie, Mr. Cat... It&#039;s your turn now!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-748" title="91_pet_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/91_pet_04.jpg?w=195" alt="Okie, Mr. Cat... It's your turn now!" width="195" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, we drew something else at the back! Thought it would turn out like a hamster or guinea pig, but ... too bad, the drawing wasn't that good... :P We couldn't even tell what it is now. Hee hee...]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Doggy on the Loose!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/19/doggy-on-the-loose/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 19 Jan 2011 05:20:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=755</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Take a look at this.

[caption id="attachment_756" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Latest Loot"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-756" title="92_dog_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Latest Loot" width="300" height="192" /></a>[/caption]

That was the latest loot that the little guy got from a recent birthday party. It was his first time eating such a snack, but he didn't seem to have any problem figuring out how to eat it.

In fact, the blue stick became his favorite and he soon expanded his masterpiece to his bed sheet... &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_757" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="It&#039;s the Stick... Not Me, Mommy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-757" title="92_dog_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_02.jpg?w=225" alt="It's the Stick... Not Me, Mommy!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Anyway, back to that container....When you see this, what do you see?

[caption id="attachment_758" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Clean Container... "]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-758" title="92_dog_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A Clean Container... " width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Us? We saw <a href="http://www.mistermaker.com/make/Sticking/Yogurt_Pot_Pupper/step2" target="_blank">this Yogurt Pot Puppet craft</a> from Mister Maker... :) !

And, so, we got our tools ready and went down to business.

I particularly loved how these looked.... :P Hee hee...

[caption id="attachment_759" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Caterpillar Monster!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-759" title="92_dog_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Caterpillar Monster!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

We didn't mix glue into the paint like in the instruction. Instead, I helped the little guy put some masking tapes around the container. He then painted on the masking tapes. I think the color would look nicer that way.

Here was the first cut. Totally -NOT- cute.

[caption id="attachment_760" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Strangled Cow?!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-760" title="92_dog_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_06.jpg?w=300" alt="A Strangled Cow?!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It looked horrible, I know! I then realised what we missed out... :P Hehehe... the nose and the cute freckles!

[caption id="attachment_761" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Woof!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-761" title="92_dog_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/92_dog_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Woof!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Phew... that's better! Now we've got a new dog in the house! I've been trying to take a picture of the little guy playing with that puppet dog... but till now, it seems rather impossible to get a decent picture with the rates he's ... uhm, flying his Super Dog! Hee hee... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		</wp:postmeta>

		<item>
		<title>Breakfast at the Little Guy&#039;s</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/19/breakfast-at-the-little-guys/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 19 Jan 2011 05:49:07 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=766</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy: Mommy... mommy... where?

[caption id="attachment_767" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Where?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/93_bfast_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-767" title="93_bfast_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/93_bfast_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Where?" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hiding behind the bears, he asked me to find him... :P

[caption id="attachment_768" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="Here!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/93_bfast_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-768" title="93_bfast_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/93_bfast_02.jpg?w=217" alt="Here!" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He just invented another version of the peek-a-boo game... Peek-a-Bear! Hee hee... :P Bringing the bears along for breakfast seems like a great idea after all... well, let's just pray that no jam or chocolate spread would land on their soft fur.

Obviously, he did this peek-a-bear like a thousand times... giving me a chance to take a proper picture for each scene... :P

Trust me, it's just hard not to laugh at his antics!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Little Bunny Foo Foo!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/22/little-bunny-foo-foo/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 21 Jan 2011 17:01:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=772</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/17/a-cat-on-a-roll/" target="_blank">cat</a> is out... so it's time for the bunny to hop in.

[caption id="attachment_773" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Dreamy Bunny"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/94_bunny_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-773" title="94_bunny_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/94_bunny_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Dreamy Bunny" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was pretty much similar to how we made our cat, except that we added some cotton wool for the floppy ears and a small cotton ball for the bushy tail. And finally, the green strips of paper were meant to be like curly grass, but they were obviously not long enough to be curly... :P oh well, we were just trying to make full use of some scrap paper.

The cute, dreamy eyes were courtesy of my husband.

In short, the bunny is as sweet as it can be. The little guy, however, was so inspired by the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Little_Bunny_Foo_Foo" target="_blank">Little Bunny Foo Foo</a> poem... &gt;_&lt;

<dl><dd><em>Little bunny Foo Foo</em></dd><dd><em>Hopping on the table</em></dd></dl>
<p style="text-align:center;">

[caption id="attachment_776" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Scooping up the cars..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/94_bunny_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-776 " title="94_bunny_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/94_bunny_021.jpg?w=300" alt="Scooping up the cars..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

</p>
&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_777" align="aligncenter" width="186" caption="And bopping them on the head..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/94_bunny_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-777" title="94_bunny_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/94_bunny_03.jpg?w=186" alt="And bopping them on the head..." width="186" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Tsk tsk... naughty bunny!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Doc&#039;s on Duty</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/22/docs-on-duty/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 22 Jan 2011 05:23:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=779</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One day, daddy came home with something interesting on his arm...

[caption id="attachment_780" align="aligncenter" width="187" caption="Something There..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-780" title="96_doctor_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_01.jpg?w=187" alt="Something There..." width="187" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

... and it soon became the little guy's prized possession... *<em>grinz</em>*

It was added to his newly supplied medical kit... :D

[caption id="attachment_781" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The DIY Medical Kit"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-781" title="96_doctor_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The DIY Medical Kit" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy certainly has a lot of fancy stuff inside. Some were souvenirs from our visits to the (real) doctor, while some others were handmade. Let's see what he has inside so far:
<ol>
	<li>Alcohol swabs</li>
	<li>Small measuring cup</li>
	<li>Plaster (folded, not rolled)</li>
	<li>Adhesive bandages (sewn by yours truly)

[caption id="attachment_782" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Adhesive bandages, with snap buttons"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-782" title="96_doctor_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Adhesive bandages, with snap buttons" width="300" height="243" /></a>[/caption]</li>
	<li> Heart-shaped squeeze ball (to entertain the patient... hee heee..)</li>
	<li>Syringe</li>
	<li>Elastic plaster (proudly sponsored by Daddy)</li>
	<li>Stethoscope
Look no further... it's here... :P&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_783" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Earphones + Horse&#039;s foot = Stethoscope"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-783" title="96_doctor_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Earphones + Horse's foot = Stethoscope" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]</li>
	<li> Tweezers</li>
	<li>Wooden tongue suppressor (what a fancy name for a popsicle stick!)</li>
	<li>Thermometer</li>
	<li>Nose cleaner</li>
	<li>Disposable medical mask</li>
	<li>Pen and paper</li>
	<li>Name tag</li>
</ol>
Okie... all's set.

[caption id="attachment_784" align="aligncenter" width="174" caption="The doc&#039;s on duty now!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-784" title="96_doctor_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/96_doctor_06.jpg?w=174" alt="The doc's on duty now!" width="174" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<item>
		<title>The Great Fall</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/22/the-great-fall/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 22 Jan 2011 06:07:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=788</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Frosty White Bear sat on the couch...

[caption id="attachment_789" align="aligncenter" width="213" caption="Nice and steady..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-789" title="95_fall_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_01.jpg?w=213" alt="Nice and steady..." width="213" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Frosty Bear had a great fall... ouch!

[caption id="attachment_790" align="aligncenter" width="218" caption="Emergency!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-790 " title="95_fall_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_02.jpg?w=218" alt="Emergency!" width="218" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">All the king's horses and all the king's men</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">Couldn't put Frosty together again...</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">Oh wait a minute, who you gonna call? The ambulance!</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">*<em>Heee heee... what a fun way to teach who to call in case of emergency... :P</em>*</p>


[caption id="attachment_791" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Here comes the ambulance..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-791" title="95_fall_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Here comes the ambulance..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Fret no more... the doc's on duty has put on his coat, ready to work.</p>


[caption id="attachment_792" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A fashionable coat and a cute medical kit"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-792" title="95_fall_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_04.jpg?w=225" alt="A fashionable coat and a cute medical kit" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Wait... let him put on his name tag first.</p>


[caption id="attachment_793" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The doc&#039;s here..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-793" title="95_fall_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_05.jpg?w=225" alt="The doc's here..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">One of the passers-by fainted upon seeing the great fall! Let's see if there's anything serious with him first... *<em>tsk, tsk... duckie really cut in line!</em>*</p>


[caption id="attachment_794" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Check temperature first..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-794" title="95_fall_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Check temperature first..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Okie... Frosty, you're next! The doctor will see you now...</p>


[caption id="attachment_795" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Let&#039;s clean your nose first..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-795" title="95_fall_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Let's clean your nose first..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Oops... don't forget to put on the mask!</p>


[caption id="attachment_797" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Too big?!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_081.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-797" title="95_fall_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_081.jpg?w=225" alt="Too big?!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Plaster is done... what's next?!</p>


[caption id="attachment_798" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="If in doubt, consult the manual..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_09.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-798  " title="95_fall_09" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_09.jpg?w=300" alt="If in doubt, consult the manual..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Tweezers?! Strange... wonder if the manual is still up-to-date!</p>

<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_10.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-799 " title="95_fall_10" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_10.jpg?w=300" alt="Plucking out a splinter?" width="300" height="225" /></a></dt> <dd class="wp-caption-dd">Plucking out a splinter?</dd> </dl></div>
<p style="text-align:left;">Here, take your medicine so you can get well soon, Frosty.</p>


[caption id="attachment_800" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Good boy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_11.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-800" title="95_fall_11" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_11.jpg?w=300" alt="Good boy!" width="300" height="237" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">And don't forget the roll plaster...</p>


[caption id="attachment_801" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Don&#039;t move your arm too much!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_12.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-801" title="95_fall_12" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_12.jpg?w=300" alt="Don't move your arm too much!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Finally... something for your poor nose!</p>


[caption id="attachment_802" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="It looks cute on you, Frosty!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_13.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-802" title="95_fall_13" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_13.jpg?w=300" alt="It looks cute on you, Frosty!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Hahaha... Boy, didn't we all have a great time with Frosty!
<p style="text-align:left;">Sadly, just like what Thomas and Friends said: Accidents happen now and again. Just when you least expect... Guess who was the patient that night? :(</p>


[caption id="attachment_804" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="The doc is on sickie"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_14.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-804" title="95_fall_14" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/95_fall_14.jpg?w=217" alt="The doc is on sickie" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Don't worry, Frosty would be just right here to accompany the little guy. They shall exchange roles for now... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Celebrating Dino&#039;s Day</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/celebrating-dinos-day/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Jan 2011 05:15:00 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Dress Up]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="dress-up"><![CDATA[Dress Up]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=811</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After days of grueling battle thanks to a damaged graphic card, we're finally back! I didn't joke when I said 'grueling', as this broken desktop really resulted in one frustrated toddler for not being able to get his daily dose of 10-min Thomas and Friends or Chuggington. Geee...! Worse, at his age, he really doesn't do math at all. Even half an hour's worth of Chuggington on TV couldn't seem to appease him! :S

Anyway, as my husband brought home quite a number of dinosaur-themed children books from the library last weekend, we dedicated one of those grueling days as Dino's Day... :)

To add to the elements of fun, I thought of sewing something for the little guy to wear. Knowing that he is no fan to wearing anything too tight, I decided to sew a simple dino's tail.

Guess what? He wasn't interested at all. He refused to wear it! Or at least, at first... :P

After much persuasion that included dressing up Frosty the Bear (and myself!) and reading the little guy lots of dinosaurs books while telling him how their tails could sway left and right, he relented!

[caption id="attachment_812" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="If Frosty could wear..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/97_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-812" title="97_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/97_dino_01.jpg?w=300" alt="If Frosty could wear..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_813" align="aligncenter" width="166" caption="... so could the little guy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/97_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-813" title="97_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/97_dino_02.jpg?w=166" alt="... so could the little guy!" width="166" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>celebrating-dinos-day</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Oh, The Places We&#039;ll Go!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/oh-the-places-well-go/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Jan 2011 05:59:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=818</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In case you're wondering, yup... that title was inspired by <a href="http://homepages.ius.edu/HARRISLA/places.htm" target="_blank">one of our favorite Dr Seuss' books</a>... :)

During one of our <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/celebrating-dinos-day/" target="_blank">downtime days</a> (read: no-Thomas and Friends-and-no-Chuggington days), we decided to go places, too.

In no time, we issued a special passport for the little guy.... :P

[caption id="attachment_819" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Brand New Passport"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-819" title="98_overseas_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Brand New Passport" width="300" height="236" /></a>[/caption]

Next, I  let the little guy pack some of his clothes into a small suitcase. Gee... didn't he just love those clothes-throwing! He nearly threw all the clothes from his drawer! He only stopped when I decided that it wasn't a great idea after all and kept all his clothes back in the drawer... :P

[caption id="attachment_820" align="aligncenter" width="199" caption="All my bags are packed... I&#039;m ready to go"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-820" title="98_overseas_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_02.jpg?w=199" alt="All my bags are packed... I'm ready to go" width="199" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

On the door, I put up one big map (one of the loots from the thrift store after realizing that the little guy loves maps... any map will do!). Being a true adventurer, he happily pointed Africa as the first place he wanted to explore... :P

[caption id="attachment_821" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="A-fee-caaa..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-821" title="98_overseas_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_03.jpg?w=212" alt="A-fee-caaa..." width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

At the immigration counter, he took out his passport from his bag to get it stamped.

[caption id="attachment_822" align="aligncenter" width="182" caption="Here&#039;s the passport..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-822" title="98_overseas_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_04.jpg?w=182" alt="Here's the passport..." width="182" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

PeeWee the Bear was on duty at the immigration counter. Obviously, the little guy thought that PeeWee the Bear had the most boring job: sitting and stamping passports. So, he made an attempt to entertain PeeWee the Bear with his fave car.

[caption id="attachment_823" align="aligncenter" width="180" caption="Vroom...See? "]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-823" title="98_overseas_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_05.jpg?w=180" alt="Vroom...See? " width="180" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Yet, after a while, he found out that stamping <em>was </em>indeed fun ... :P He then took over PeeWee's duty... :P

[caption id="attachment_824" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Stamp here!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-824" title="98_overseas_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Stamp here!" width="300" height="260" /></a>[/caption]

He also realised that PeeWee was just too cute to leave behind. So, he packed PeeWee inside his suitcase... :P

[caption id="attachment_825" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Make yourself comfortable, PeeWee"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-825" title="98_overseas_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Make yourself comfortable, PeeWee" width="300" height="266" /></a>[/caption]

And off he went again to find another place to explore... with PeeWee, of course... hee hee...

[caption id="attachment_826" align="aligncenter" width="156" caption="Let&#039;s check the map again"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-826" title="98_overseas_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/98_overseas_08.jpg?w=156" alt="Let's check the map again" width="156" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And yup, so far, we've been to Africa, Asia and South America... *<em>grinz</em>*]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Playing Favorites</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/28/playing-favorites/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 28 Jan 2011 06:21:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=830</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy is still into suitcase nowadays... &gt;_&lt; I have to get it for him from the storeroom every now and then.

Sometimes, he just wanted to "treat" PeeWee, his fave lovey for this week, a ride around the house. He transformed the suitcase into a nice umbrella stroller especially for PeeWee... :)

[caption id="attachment_831" align="aligncenter" width="214" caption="Let&#039;s Go, PeeWee"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/99_peewee_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-831" title="99_peewee_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/99_peewee_01.jpg?w=214" alt="Let's Go, PeeWee" width="214" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Some other times, he sat inside with PeeWee... pretending that the suitcase was either a train or a boat... :P

[caption id="attachment_832" align="aligncenter" width="233" caption="Consulting &quot;GPS&quot; for direction..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/99_peewee_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-832" title="99_peewee_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/01/99_peewee_02.jpg?w=233" alt="Consulting &quot;GPS&quot; for direction..." width="233" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Blow, Blow the Paint</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/01/blow-blow-the-paint/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 01 Feb 2011 06:41:18 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=836</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It started off with an urge to do bubble painting with the little guy. You know, the one that requires placing a straw into the paint mixture and blowing until the bubbles fill up the container...

Knowing that in the little guy's dictionary, straw = sucking, I decided to use a mix of food coloring and water instead.

Yet, in the end... I chickened out and took a safer, although not easier, route: blowing painting. Hee hee... :P

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>food coloring (or paint)</li>
	<li>water</li>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>syringe  or pipette (to drop the paint onto the paper; you could also use your fingers)</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

After mixing food coloring and water, I let the little guy watch as I put a drop of the paint mixture onto the drawing paper. I showed him how the paint mixture would move as I blow (hard!).

No doubt he took over even before I completed my first sample... :P

[caption id="attachment_838" align="aligncenter" width="171" caption="Ready to huff..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-838" title="100_chpaint_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_01.jpg?w=171" alt="Ready to huff..." width="171" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_839" align="aligncenter" width="192" caption="...and puff! It goes..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-839" title="100_chpaint_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_02.jpg?w=192" alt="...and puff! It goes..." width="192" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hahaha.. I know this huffing and puffing would straight away be a hit! Sometimes I helped him tilt the paper so that the paint could go faster.

After a while, the temptation to just use paint rather than food coloring was there... :P It was simply hard to resist, especially when I saw my husband's art box lying around. I took the least used color (or so I thought, since it still looked full): dark grey.

[caption id="attachment_840" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Blow, blow till they mix..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-840" title="100_chpaint_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Blow, blow till they mix..." width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

You should have seen the little guy's reaction when he saw how the colors mix! Priceless! He practically went, "Wooow..." every now and then! Or maybe it was just his way to steal a deep breath before huffing and puffing again... :P This was quite a tiring exercise, mind you.. :P

He also got more adventurous as I let him use the syringe.

[caption id="attachment_841" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Adding syringe to his painting repertoire"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-841" title="100_chpaint_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Adding syringe to his painting repertoire" width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption]

Nope, he didn't splatter the paint all over. Instead, he used the syringe as if it was a brush... :P That explains the Chinese painting style that we've got in the end... :)

[caption id="attachment_842" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="His First Attempt at Chinese Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-842" title="100_chpaint_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/100_chpaint_05.jpg?w=300" alt="His First Attempt at Chinese Painting" width="300" height="214" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>From a Short-lived Toy to a Long-Lasting Habit</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/02/from-a-short-lived-toy-to-a-long-lasting-habit/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 Feb 2011 06:23:03 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=851</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Been keeping some empty containers for the longest time ever to make a bigger version of this.

[caption id="attachment_852" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One of Thomas&#039; Friends"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-852" title="103_train_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_01.jpg?w=300" alt="One of Thomas' Friends" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And since the deadline for the spring cleaning is approaching, I thought I should quickly get it done... &gt;_&lt;

The little guy was rather helpful at first. He even helped me put some glue on the wheels.

[caption id="attachment_853" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Ever-Helpful Little Guy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-853" title="103_train_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Ever-Helpful Little Guy" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And we managed to complete our prototype within a few minutes.

[caption id="attachment_854" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Train-tastic!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-854" title="103_train_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Train-tastic!" width="300" height="240" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad... before I got the chance to little-guy-proof it, the little guy decided to do a kind of reverse engineering.

First, he opened the lid. Oh well, I thought, not so bad...

[caption id="attachment_855" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="First Step of Reverse Engineering"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-855" title="103_train_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_04.jpg?w=300" alt="First Step of Reverse Engineering" width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption]

Then, to my horror, he started ripping the container off.

[caption id="attachment_856" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Uh oh..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-856" title="103_train_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Uh oh..." width="300" height="224" /></a>[/caption]

Even after I attempted to put the container back, he still played with it. He asked me for coins and stored them inside... :P

[caption id="attachment_857" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Really Useful Engine"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-857" title="103_train_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_06.jpg?w=300" alt="A Really Useful Engine" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Oh well... after a while, I gave up. The train was certainly short-lived. I decided to make a hole on the lid and let the guy have the container as his piggy bank... :P

[caption id="attachment_860" align="aligncenter" width="231" caption="Saving Up"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_072.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-860" title="103_train_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/103_train_072.jpg?w=231" alt="Saving Up" width="231" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I think he likes it better... :P And I hope it instills saving habits in him... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[His Very Own Chinese New Year Card]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Stamped, Sealed, Delivered</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/03/stamped-sealed-delivered/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 03 Feb 2011 14:56:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Finger Prints]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="finger-prints"><![CDATA[Finger Prints]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=862</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Somehow, each year, our collection of red envelopes grows even though I don't recall ever buying any set. There is always seem to be a vendor, shop  or bank that gives them out for free.

We don't really celebrate Chinese New Year. Hence, we don't really have that many opportunities to bask in the tradition of giving out <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Red_envelope" target="_blank">red envelopes</a>. So, there you go, another explanation of the excess supply.

This year, however, one of them proves to be useful.

[caption id="attachment_864" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Inspiration"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-864" title="104_cny_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Inspiration" width="300" height="184" /></a>[/caption]

I first drew the stems and twigs, following the picture above... and yup, finally, we get the chance to use the stamp pad that I've been keeping for a few months, waiting for the little guy to be ready... :)

[caption id="attachment_866" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Bright Red Stamp"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-866" title="104_cny_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Bright Red Stamp" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy was surprisingly quite cooperative. He diligently stamped on the places I pointed. He only branched out when we ran out of buds to stamp next to... :P

[caption id="attachment_867" align="aligncenter" width="228" caption="Here, Mommy?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-867" title="104_cny_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_03.jpg?w=228" alt="Here, Mommy?" width="228" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Still, those prints turn out nice. When we've completed our picture, I pasted it on a red construction paper. There you go... just put it inside an envelope, and we've got a Chinese New Year card to send... :)
<p style="text-align:center;">

[caption id="attachment_868" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Limited Edition Chinese New Year Card"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-868 " title="104_cny_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/104_cny_04.jpg?w=300" alt="A Limited Edition Chinese New Year Card" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

</p>
Sorry, people... but this card is <span style="text-decoration:underline;">not</span> available at any major book store... :P

Happy Chinese New Year!

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[Bubble... bubble...]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>872</wp:post_id>

		<item>
		<title>A Beautiful Mess</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/07/a-beautiful-mess/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 07 Feb 2011 07:47:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=870</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Don't we just love long weekends! Especially a super long one!

To the little guy, long weekend means longer hours with his daddy at home. Of course, to me, that also translates to well shared workloads... :) That is why I quickly took the opportunity to do the messy activities that I had been wanted to do with the little guy, but too afraid to deal with the mess on my own.. :P Like <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=FG48CbWNhCM" target="_blank">this one</a>!

One of the items found during spring cleaning was a brand new box of baking soda. As I have another box which is obviously used more often, that brand new box has been sitting in the kitchen for ages, but was only opened a few days ago... :P

Unfortunately (or should I say, thankfully), it was just a small box. So, I think we can forget about making a big volcano. We didn't even bother to make it to look like a real volcano... ^_^" We just put some baking soda in small bowls and colored vinegar in some other small containers.

[caption id="attachment_871" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="It&#039;s gonna get messy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-871" title="106_mess_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_01.jpg?w=300" alt="It's gonna get messy!" width="300" height="205" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy helped me to pour the vinegar into the bowls of baking soda. He seemed pretty impressed as he saw (and heard, too, I hope) it sizzled. He even asked for more vinegar... &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_872" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Bubble... bubble..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-872" title="106_mess_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Bubble... bubble..." width="300" height="206" /></a>[/caption]

In case you were wondering why I chose such a dark color, well... it was because we didn't want the output from our little science project get wasted. We wanted to give them a second lease on being useful as <a href="http://www.wholeliving.com/article/homemade-watercolor-paint" target="_blank">watercolor paint</a>... :)

We skipped the syrup, but we happily mixed in some cornstarch using skewers. As expected, the colors turned lighter. Still, they looked pretty nice. Then, my husband took one of the skewers and started drawing.

[caption id="attachment_873" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Cute, eh?!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-873" title="106_mess_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Cute, eh?!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy followed suit. He gave up after making a few lines, though. However, he took one of the containers and started stamping around.

[caption id="attachment_874" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Bigger and bolder"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-874" title="106_mess_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Bigger and bolder" width="300" height="198" /></a>[/caption]

With all the mess we had up to that point, it just felt right to do another messy activity... *<em>grinz</em>* I took another drawing paper, put on some glue and sprinkled some salt.

[caption id="attachment_875" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Salty template"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-875" title="106_mess_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Salty template" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I added a few drops of the watercolor paint to one end and a few more drops on another end. I was hoping that the salt would absorb the watercolor paint and that we could watch as the color travel along the path. Yet, it didn't really work out as we expected. Not sure if it was because I didn't put enough salt or I should have made the watercolor paint thinner. Anyway, our work of art looked more like a crime scene... :P

[caption id="attachment_876" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Crime Scene #1: Do Not Cross"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-876" title="106_mess_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Crime Scene #1: Do Not Cross" width="300" height="251" /></a>[/caption]

The earlier work of art, however, turned out nice. A beautiful mess, I'd say... :)

[caption id="attachment_877" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Beautiful Mess"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-877" title="106_mess_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/106_mess_07.jpg?w=225" alt="A Beautiful Mess" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I love how adding the cornstarch makes it look like a chalk painting. And above all, I love how my husband turned the little guy's container painting into cute rabbits, pig and chicken... :)

That certainly could only happen on a long weekend!

I wonder when we could have another long weekend this year... ^_^"]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>870</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-02-07 15:47:09</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-02-07 07:47:09</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>a-beautiful-mess</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<item>
		<title>99% Mommy, 1% Little Guy</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/09/99-mommy-1-little-guy/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Feb 2011 03:48:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Finger Prints]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="finger-prints"><![CDATA[Finger Prints]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=884</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is what happens when the little guy was simply not interested in something.

It is obviously not 1% inspiration, 99% perspiration.
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/105_thumb_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-885 " title="105_thumb_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/105_thumb_01.jpg?w=225" alt="99% mommy, 1% little guy" width="225" height="300" /></a></dt> <dd class="wp-caption-dd">99% mommy, 1% little guy</dd> </dl></div>
At least, not from the little guy's point of view.

Just count the number of small finger prints and you'll get the idea how much he did on his own... :P I'll give you a hint: the train was from his finger prints. Anything else that is about that size was from his finger prints.]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Hopping into the Festive Mood</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/09/hopping-into-the-festive-mood/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 09 Feb 2011 04:06:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=889</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The festive Chinese New Year atmosphere is certainly still here.

Last weekend, we heard the thunderous beating of drums and cymbals every now and then. No doubt the sound must have come from the lion dance performances around the neighborhood.

Once, when we heard the music from the beating drums, my husband decided to put up a private show for the little guy... :)

[caption id="attachment_890" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Dancing to the rhythm"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/107_lion_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-890" title="107_lion_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/107_lion_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Dancing to the rhythm" width="300" height="254" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy certainly enjoyed the show... :D For a while, I thought it would be a great idea to bring him to watch the real lion dance performance.

Then something changed my mind.

Or maybe, when we really bring him out to catch the real show, we should watch him closely... :P

One could just never guess what the little guy could do to the poor dancer.
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_891" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="I know it&#039;s you, Dad... Stop hiding!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/107_lion_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-891 " title="107_lion_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/107_lion_02.jpg?w=300" alt="I know it's you, Dad... Stop hiding!" width="300" height="197" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>

		<wp:post_name>hopping-into-the-festive-mood</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Playground Gravity</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/11/playground-gravity/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Feb 2011 04:36:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=897</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After a series of futile attempts involving sleeping (really) late at night and waking up (really) early in the morning to get more "me" time and to get things done, I realise I wasn't the only one losing sleep... :S The little guy, too, seems to adjust his sleeping time, i.e. he sleeps later and wakes up earlier than usual. So, yeah... my long-awaited "me" time usually had to go down the drain the moment he was wide awake... :P

No surprise then if I was rather listless as we went for our usual morning round at the playground... :P Yet, somehow, this little guy didn't seem to share the same lethargy! Gee... I wonder where he gets all the energy! That, of course, kinda frustrates him. Suddenly, unless there are other toddlers around, he loses his one and only partner for playing tag or hide and seek!

So, this morning, I devised a new mechanism.

It is called gravity.

No battery required. Hee hee... :P

All we need is just an empty bottle. And oh, yeah... a very energetic boy like the little guy never fails to make even the simplest game fun!

I just had to show him once that a bottle on a slide makes a great entertainment. He got the gist... straight away.

[caption id="attachment_899" align="aligncenter" width="241" caption="What mommy taught..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-899" title="108_gravity_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_01.jpg?w=241" alt="What mommy taught..." width="241" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He could even improvise...

[caption id="attachment_900" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Improvisation #1: Slide from the Top"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-900 " title="108_gravity_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Improvisation #1: Slide from the Top" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_901" align="aligncenter" width="216" caption="Improvisation #2: Slide and Catch"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-901" title="108_gravity_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_03.jpg?w=216" alt="Improvisation #2: Slide and Catch" width="216" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_902" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Improvisation #3: Race against the Bottle"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-902" title="108_gravity_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/108_gravity_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Improvisation #3: Race against the Bottle" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

All these while mommy was happily sitting down and taking pictures... *<em>grinz</em>*]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Come Fly with Us!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/11/come-fly-with-us/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Feb 2011 05:12:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=906</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This was what was left from <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/24/no-cinderella-story/ ‎" target="_blank">our castle</a>, after being trampled and sat on by the little guy one too many times...

[caption id="attachment_907" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Last  Survivor of the Wreck-the-Castle Game"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-907" title="109_plane_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_01.jpg?w=225" alt="The Last Survivor of the Wreck-the-Castle Game" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I know... very sad looking...

Yet, since the little guy was into airplane recently, I decided to reuse the cardboard to make an airplane.

We were kinda excited at first. We made the body in no time.

[caption id="attachment_908" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="An Easy First Step"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-908" title="109_plane_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_02.jpg?w=300" alt="An Easy First Step" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy also got himself busy painting.
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"> <dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-910 " title="109_plane_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_031.jpg?w=300" alt="Brush... brush... till it turns into an airplane!" width="300" height="245" /></a></dt> <dd class="wp-caption-dd">Brush... brush... till it turns into an airplane!</dd> </dl></div>
Then, we left it to dry... and nearly a month passed!

We neglected it for almost a month!

[caption id="attachment_911" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Forgotten Plane"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-911" title="109_plane_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_04.jpg?w=300" alt="The Forgotten Plane" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Then, one day, the little guy's godfather prompted us to watch <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=4_06qrFnvnw" target="_blank">these airport miniatures</a>.

The little guy went "Wowww...!" the moment he watched the clip and from then on, he flew his trucks, cars and trains and called them "Airplane!"

Hee hee... so, before his vocabulary goes down into just one word, i.e. "airplane", I decided to finish what we started... :)

[caption id="attachment_912" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Finally!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-912" title="109_plane_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Finally!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I used a small plastic container for the front part, simply because I couldn't find anything else that is transparent and could fit nicely.

Does the little guy love it?

Definitely!
<p style="text-align:center;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_913" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Attention... This is your captain speaking..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-913  " title="109_plane_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Attention... This is your captain speaking..." width="300" height="204" /></a>[/caption]

He loves it so much that he even attempted to feed it with spaghetti bolognaise! &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_914" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="It needs fuel to fly, Mommy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-914" title="109_plane_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/109_plane_07.jpg?w=198" alt="It needs fuel to fly, Mommy!" width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I should have known that it wasn't a great idea to let him play with it at lunch time... :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Fun to Make, Fun to Eat</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/14/fun-to-make-fun-to-eat/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Feb 2011 05:45:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=917</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Looking back, I must say that baking and decorating cakes with my mom are always among the sweetest memories. So, when I managed to bake a cake in one hot afternoon, I decided to leave the decorating part to the guys in the family... :)

[caption id="attachment_918" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="All&#039;s yours, guys!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-918" title="112_cake_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_01.jpg?w=300" alt="All's yours, guys!" width="300" height="230" /></a>[/caption]

It really seemed like the best laid plan! Both my husband and the little guy soon got engrossed in putting up the chocolate flakes. One by one! Something that I'd usually just sprinkle within a minute or so gave them a few minutes worth of fun... :)

[caption id="attachment_919" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One Here, One There"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-919" title="112_cake_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_02.jpg?w=300" alt="One Here, One There" width="300" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, not all the chocolate flakes ended on the cake. Just see who was caught  in the camera!

[caption id="attachment_921" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="It somehow landed in my mouth, Mommy..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-921 " title="112_cake_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_031.jpg?w=225" alt="It somehow landed in my mouth, Mommy..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Lo and behold! The cake had now been decorated! Since we hadn't quite celebrated PeeWee's birthday two weeks ago, we partly dedicated the cake to him.

[caption id="attachment_922" align="aligncenter" width="234" caption="Happy Super-belated Birthday, PeeWee!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-922" title="112_cake_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_04.jpg?w=234" alt="Happy Super-belated Birthday, PeeWee!" width="234" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy, however, must have thought that PeeWee was so touched that he could only sit there, stunned. He then made a wish on PeeWee's behalf...

[caption id="attachment_923" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Make a Wish!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-923" title="112_cake_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_05.jpg?w=225" alt="Make a Wish!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

...and blew the candles for PeeWee!

[caption id="attachment_924" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Puff!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-924" title="112_cake_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_06.jpg?w=225" alt="Puff!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Daddy was actually the one given the honor to do the cake-cutting. Yet again, the little guy thought he could do it better.

[caption id="attachment_925" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Bunch of Heart Cake Cutters..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-925" title="112_cake_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_07.jpg?w=225" alt="A Bunch of Heart Cake Cutters..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

As I went to the kitchen to get some forks, I couldn't help but to admire the little guy's confidence. He said, "yummy" even before he sank his teeth into the cake... :P

And when it was finally time to give the actual verdict about the cake, he couldn't say anything. He took one big piece of cake and his mouth was simply ... too full to say anything!

[caption id="attachment_926" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="A Cake Bigger than His Mouth"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-926" title="112_cake_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/112_cake_08.jpg?w=217" alt="A Cake Bigger than His Mouth" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I wonder if his wish was actually to have the cake all for himself... :S]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>One Leaf at a Time</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/14/one-leaf-at-a-time/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Feb 2011 05:57:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=929</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One day, during our usual morning walk around the neighborhood, we brought home some leaves.

[caption id="attachment_930" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The falling leaves of red and green"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-930" title="110_leaf_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The falling leaves of red and green" width="300" height="175" /></a>[/caption]

We got them washed and left them to dry.

That afternoon, we got ourselves busy painting the back of the leaves... :)

[caption id="attachment_931" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Green is for leaves"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-931" title="110_leaf_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Green is for leaves" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We had some serious stampings to do!

[caption id="attachment_932" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Stamping on..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-932" title="110_leaf_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Stamping on..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And finally.... tadaa... ^o^

[caption id="attachment_933" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A painting to add to the collection"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-933" title="110_leaf_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_04.jpg?w=300" alt="A painting to add to the collection" width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption]

I'm also keeping the paper which we used to line the leaves as we painted them. At least, for now...

I find them too fancy to throw... :)

[caption id="attachment_934" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="To Throw or Not To Throw..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-934" title="110_leaf_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/110_leaf_05.jpg?w=300" alt="To Throw or Not To Throw..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
