		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Living His Passion</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/17/living-his-passion/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Feb 2011 05:52:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=947</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I used to think that the little guy had a very short attention span. Much shorter than his peers, and too short for me to keep him occupied in one activity for more than 10 minutes.

Until the day he found his passion.

[caption id="attachment_948" align="aligncenter" width="204" caption="Cutting strawberries"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/118_berry_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-948" title="118_berry_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/118_berry_01.jpg?w=204" alt="Cutting strawberries" width="204" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He spent more than 15 minutes cutting strawberries. With full concentration. Into small pieces!

This wasn't his first time using a knife. He had cut bananas many times since <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/14/dont-do-this-at-home/" target="_blank">his first time</a>. Yet, this one seemed to keep him occupied for the longest time. Ever.

It could probably be more than 30 minutes, if only we had more strawberries to cut.

[caption id="attachment_949" align="aligncenter" width="236" caption="More?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/118_berry_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-949" title="118_berry_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/118_berry_02.jpg?w=236" alt="More?" width="236" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I still find it hard, though...

No, I don't mind it's hard to see that his attention span has grown.

It's just hard to know that I would have to eat all that he has cut... :S You see, he doesn't like to eat things that he has cut as much as he loves cutting them.

Uh oh...

Not another smashed strawberry! &gt;_&lt;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>living-his-passion</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<title>We&#039;ll Huff and We&#039;ll Puff!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/17/well-huff-and-well-puff/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Feb 2011 06:06:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=954</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Like I said <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/28/the-simple-things/" target="_blank">before</a>, I love how the little guy enjoys playing with the simple things around the house.

Like this bubble wrap...

[caption id="attachment_955" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Pop!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/115_blow_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-955" title="115_blow_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/115_blow_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Pop!" width="300" height="241" /></a>[/caption]

Or, see these little fella here?

[caption id="attachment_956" align="aligncenter" width="250" caption="Giggly and Smiley"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/115_blow_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-956" title="115_blow_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/115_blow_01.jpg?w=250" alt="Giggly and Smiley" width="250" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

They may be just pieces cut out from a plastic bag, but they surely make a great thing to play with!

[caption id="attachment_957" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Blow!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/115_blow_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-957" title="115_blow_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/115_blow_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Blow!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, we've been busy having a blowing race to see ... *<em>wait, let me catch my breath first</em>* ... which one of them could reach the finish line first....*<em>panting</em>*]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Shoe Wash!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/17/shoe-wash/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Feb 2011 06:45:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=959</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A couple of days ago, the weather seemed to turn warm. Uhm, okie... stop giving me that look... "hot" might be the more appropriate term.

I asked the little guy if he was interested to wash the shoes.

He didn't reply. But, the sight of a pail full of water made his eyes grow round with excitement... :P

And so, we began our very important lesson in washing shoes.

First, we removed the shoelaces.

[caption id="attachment_960" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Pull here"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-960" title="114_shoes_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_01.jpg?w=212" alt="Pull here" width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It wasn't that easy for his tiny fingers. He really had to struggle even to pull out from just one hole!

Next was the easiest and his most favorite part: brushing the shoes.

[caption id="attachment_961" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Brush! Brush!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-961" title="114_shoes_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Brush! Brush!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

After completing this part, I went in to get another pair of shoes to wash. Yet, when I saw what he did to that first pair of shoes, I changed my mind. I decided to just stop at one pair and left it to dry (after pouring the water out, of course!)

[caption id="attachment_962" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Full to the brim"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-962" title="114_shoes_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Full to the brim" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Guess what, it rained that afternoon and the following day! We had to wait a few days before the shoes were dry. I know, that tickled me to quote from <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Murphy%27s_law" target="_blank">the Murphy's Law</a>, too... :P

When the shoes were completely clean and dry, it was time for another lesson: putting on the shoelaces.

[caption id="attachment_963" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Difficult Task"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-963" title="114_shoes_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_04.jpg?w=225" alt="A Difficult Task" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

That proved to be very difficult for a 2-year-old. He persevered for just the first 5 minutes.

Then, he ran away with the clean, shiny shoes...:)

[caption id="attachment_965" align="aligncenter" width="221" caption="The Shoes Snatcher"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_051.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-965" title="114_shoes_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/114_shoes_051.jpg?w=221" alt="The Shoes Snatcher" width="221" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>959</wp:post_id>

		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-02-17 06:45:23</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>shoe-wash</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<item>
		<title>What Blue and Yellow Make</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/19/what-blue-and-yellow-make/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 19 Feb 2011 07:43:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=968</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I used to just stock up on two types of food coloring: red and green. Yet, but as I idly browsed through the baking product aisle in the supermarket *<em>till now, I still haven't figured out why I was there in the first place</em>*, I couldn't help but to bring home blue and yellow. They were on sale!

I, however, still can't see myself baking anything and coloring it with blue. Although blue is one of my favorite colors, I still find anything not naturally blue too bizarre to eat. Even when there are many kinds of food and beverages in different shades of blue nowadays.

Now that I have blue (plus, yellow!) food coloring at home... hm, maybe I should learn to like it. Or, at least, I should try with light blue first... :)

It'll take some time... as for now, I shall just leave the food coloring to the little guy to play with.

Like what we did on this piece of kitchen towel...

[caption id="attachment_969" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Little Blue Boy in Action"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/116_tissue_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-969" title="116_tissue_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/116_tissue_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Little Blue Boy in Action" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It did turn out pretty nice and I did want to keep it.

[caption id="attachment_970" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Short-lived Art Piece"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/116_tissue_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-970 " title="116_tissue_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/116_tissue_02.jpg?w=300" alt="A Short-lived Art Piece" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad, the little guy got a little too excited and pour all what we had left in the palette into the tray *<em>I know.. luckily, we used a tray!</em>*.

The kitchen towel was soaking wet. Not in rainbow colors. It looked more like eerily black ink!

I was very worried that he would then try to empty the tray, spilling everything and staining things in our living room. So, I quickly got myself busy cleaning up... that's why I didn't bother to take any more pictures... :P

Luckily, except some fingers, nothing else was stained. We could keep the bleach back ... :)

Oh well, I guess that was one downside to using food coloring for painting: It's not really washable!

There... I did warn you... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>968</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-02-19 15:43:05</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-02-19 07:43:05</wp:post_date_gmt>

		<item>
		<title>Hocus Pocus Dino</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/21/hocus-pocus-dino/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Feb 2011 09:03:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Oil Pastel]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="oil-pastel"><![CDATA[Oil Pastel]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=974</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I'm afraid we haven't really got over our latest craze in dinosaurs.

So, again, another dino craft to paint :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>food coloring (or paint)</li>
	<li>water</li>
	<li>white oil pastel</li>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>paintbrush and palette</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, I drew (or rather, I used a stencil to draw) dinosaurs on a piece of paper. I drew two dinosaurs, actually, just in case one of them get too wet to keep, like what happened in <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/19/what-blue-and-yellow-make/" target="_blank">our previous activity</a>.

[caption id="attachment_976" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Now you don&#039;t quite see them..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/117_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-976" title="117_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/117_dino_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Now you don't quite see them..." width="300" height="203" /></a>[/caption]

We wanted to have a forest magical scene, so we used blue and green food coloring, mixed with some water.

The beauty in this activity was that it almost seemed as if there was nothing on that piece of paper at first. So, when the little guy started adding some colors using the paintbrush, he got more and more excited revealing more of the dinosaur with each brush stroke.

[caption id="attachment_978" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Now you see them, too!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/117_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-978" title="117_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/117_dino_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Now you see them, too!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

That paintbrush was surely a magic wand! Ha... :P

This whole thing proved to be pretty entertaining for this dino lover, since it could actually keep him brushing until all was completed... :P

And here's how they look when we were done with the magic wand.

[caption id="attachment_979" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Tale of Two Dinosaurs"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/117_dino_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-979" title="117_dino_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/117_dino_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A Tale of Two Dinosaurs" width="300" height="195" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Paper on the Wall</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/22/paper-on-the-wall/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Feb 2011 16:06:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=982</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One sunny afternoon and the little guy was somehow inspired to draw on one of the walls.

He took a pencil and climbed up on a chair, just to prop himself higher.

Mommy: No, no, we don't draw on the walls. We draw on paper. Okie?

The little guy: *<em>left his seat, sheepishly walking away to get a piece of paper</em>* Okie.

Mommy: *<em>smiling</em>... <em>felt relieved for a moment</em>*

The little guy: *<em>returned with a piece of paper and started drawing on that piece of paper, after placing it on the same wall</em>*

[caption id="attachment_983" align="aligncenter" width="249" caption="Paper on the Wall"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/120_wall_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-983" title="120_wall_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/120_wall_01.jpg?w=249" alt="Paper on the Wall" width="249" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Mommy: ... *<em>speechless</em>*

There <strong>must be</strong> something about that wall that made him feel like he had to draw there. No matter what... &gt;_&lt;]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>982</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-02-22 00:06:53</wp:post_date>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>paper-on-the-wall</wp:post_name>

		<item>
		<title>Giggly Googly Octopus </title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/23/giggly-googly-octopus/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 23 Feb 2011 09:01:44 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=993</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There seems to be one animal character that the little guy consistently likes in most of the shows that he has watched so far: octopus.

Henry the Octopus in The Wiggles.

The octopus in Sesame Street. Like the one <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5IOYU4JUyr4" target="_blank">here</a>.

Jup Jup in Hi-5. *<em>uhm, not sure if that one really is an octopus... but it does look like one</em>*

I say, we should have our own octopus ... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paintbrush</li>
	<li>toilet paper roll</li>
	<li>wiggly eyes</li>
	<li>black marker</li>
	<li>glue</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

We started off with the most exciting part: painting. The little guy seemed to be back in the mood for painting, so it was a breeze.

[caption id="attachment_997" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Something Purple"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-997" title="121_octopus_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Something Purple" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Then, we put on the wiggly eyes and drew the mouth. Yes, I finally had the confidence to use wiggly eyes. Let's just say, I no longer have to worry that he would pop one of them into his mouth... :)

And finally, the final touch: cutting off the lower part of the toilet paper roll to make the tentacles.

Tadaa...

[caption id="attachment_998" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Our Very Own Giggly Googly Octopus"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-998" title="121_octopus_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Our Very Own Giggly Googly Octopus" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I could tell that the little guy kinda liked his new toy. I guess, it was partly due to the wiggly eyes. He loved shaking the octopus to see them go up and down and to hear the sound they made.

For an unknown reason, he also loved to "measure" it... :S

[caption id="attachment_1000" align="aligncenter" width="204" caption="Busy Measuring"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1000" title="121_octopus_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_031.jpg?w=204" alt="Busy Measuring" width="204" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

After his afternoon nap, he got busy playing with it again.

And guess what he brought to me after a few minutes?!

[caption id="attachment_1001" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Uh oh..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1001" title="121_octopus_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Uh oh... " width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

No, he didn't swallow the wiggly eyes. On his other hand, he kept the wiggly eyes. He gave them back to me and asked, "What 'appen?". Yeah.. as if he knew nothing about it! Geee....

That was it. No more googly-eyed octopus... &gt;_&lt;

At least the octopus had managed to entertain him for quite some time.

As for the wiggly eyes, they shalt not be wasted! We took one of the books we borrowed from the library and had a great time giggling... :)

[caption id="attachment_1002" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Silly-looking dog"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1002" title="121_octopus_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Silly-looking dog" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1003" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Creepy Cat"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1003" title="121_octopus_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Creepy Cat" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1004" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Big-eyed Panda"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1004" title="121_octopus_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/121_octopus_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Big-eyed Panda" width="300" height="191" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>A Fish Tale</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/25/a-fish-tale/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Feb 2011 06:36:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1007</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After days of battling against the little guy's flu bugs while nursing my own blocked nose, I could finally declare independence day. At least the little guy no longer had fever. Phewww... that means I could, hopefully, wave bye-bye to those tiring days when the little guy got frustrated for not being able to go out.

To celebrate, we decided to get hooked on fishing.... :)

That, of course, involved being outdoor and ... water. I know, it might seem a tad too soon to get the little guy wet and all when he had just recovered from his flu. But, the weather was very hot this morning and the little guy just couldn't wait any longer for something fun under the sun.

So, out we brought his bath tub and a pail of water.  I left it to the little guy to fill up our "fish tank"... :)

[caption id="attachment_1008" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Filling up the fish tank"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1008" title="122_fish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Filling up the fish tank" width="300" height="266" /></a>[/caption]

See that small strainer? You might want to remember that strainer... it was kinda important here... :P

Next, the school of fish! Yayyy... ^o^

[caption id="attachment_1009" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Colorful fish"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1009" title="122_fish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Colorful fish" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I bought this cute ice cube tray from IKEA a while ago. I thought it would look nicer if I put some food coloring when I prepared the ice cubes. They did look nice, but I didn't expect that the food coloring would dissolve in the water that fast... Or maybe it was just the hot weather...

Nevertheless, it seemed the heat couldn't beat my little tornado... He managed to catch most of them using a strainer before the fish-shaped ice cubes melted and disappeared... :P

[caption id="attachment_1010" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Gotcha!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1010" title="122_fish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Gotcha!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Boy... didn't he have fun!

When there was no more fish to catch, he entertained himself making waves using the strainer. See, I told ya, the strainer was <em>really </em>important here...

&nbsp;

[caption id="attachment_1011" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Busy making waves..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1011" title="122_fish_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Busy making waves..." width="300" height="195" /></a>[/caption]

He then decided to water my plants... &gt;_&lt; Yikes! Let's just hope that my next harvest batch would not include purple ginger... ^_^"

[caption id="attachment_1012" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Purple.. purple... "]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1012" title="122_fish_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Purple.. purple... " width="300" height="192" /></a>[/caption]

We ended our activity by brushing the tub clean. Even if it does sound like fun, we just don't want the little guy to turn purple, do we?! :P
<p style="text-align:center;">

[caption id="attachment_1013" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Squeaky clean!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1013 " title="122_fish_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/122_fish_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Squeaky clean!" width="300" height="189" /></a>[/caption]

</p>
&nbsp;

&nbsp;

&nbsp;]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Another One Down...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/28/another-one-down/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Feb 2011 06:48:33 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1022</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It seems that we've been passing the flu bugs to each other. Last night, it was my husband's turn to be down with fever.

Sad. I know...

But, one seemed to be particularly excited about it... :P

[caption id="attachment_1023" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Here comes the doctor!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1023" title="125_fever_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Here comes the doctor!" width="300" height="221" /></a>[/caption]

Not sure why... but he looked so happy after he took his daddy's temperature. Probably his thought was something around "Yayyy... he's gonna qualify for a sickie and I can bug him for the WHOLE day!"

[caption id="attachment_1025" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Whopee! More than 38!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1025 " title="125_fever_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Whopee! More than 38!" width="300" height="280" /></a>[/caption]

I was easy to tell that the little guy got really excited about poking his daddy and getting him to drink the medicine, too.

[caption id="attachment_1024" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Dun worry... it&#039;s not gonna hurt..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1024" title="125_fever_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Dun worry... it's not gonna hurt..." width="300" height="256" /></a>[/caption]

He then got himself busy trying to write a prescription for his daddy. He almost even burned the midnight oil for it! Thankfully, he fell asleep before the clock struck twelve...

[caption id="attachment_1026" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="I ... must... stay... awake...zzzz"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1026" title="125_fever_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_04.jpg?w=300" alt="I ... must... stay... awake...zzzz" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Me? I got to play the nurse. And considering what the nurse gets, I really don't mind taking that role... :)

[caption id="attachment_1027" align="aligncenter" width="245" caption="A Very Sweet Thank You Note"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1027" title="125_fever_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/125_fever_05.jpg?w=245" alt="A Very Sweet Thank You Note" width="245" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Hooray for Rainstick!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/28/hooray-for-rainstick/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Feb 2011 07:26:22 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1031</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The other day, after we made our <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/23/giggly-googly-octopus/" target="_blank">giggly googly octopus</a>, we had some leftover paint. And surely, the easiest way not to waste is to paint another thing... :P Using just one color was rather boring, so I ended up adding more paint to the leftover ... :P

The little guy had no problem taking over from there...

[caption id="attachment_1032" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="Easy Peasy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/123_rainstick_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1032" title="123_rainstick_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/123_rainstick_01.jpg?w=217" alt="Easy Peasy!" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I didn't really have an idea of what to make then. It was only a few days later that I suddenly thought of a rainstick. At first, I wasn't sure how to make it. Yet, thanks to Google, I got to learn <a href="http://www.exploratorium.edu/frogs/rain_stick/index.html" target="_blank">how to make it</a>... :)

I used toothpicks instead of nails and filled our tube with some soy beans and mung beans. For safety reason, I only made this when the little guy was fast asleep.

[caption id="attachment_1033" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Not Yet Toddler-Proofed"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/123_rainstick_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1033" title="123_rainstick_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/123_rainstick_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Not Yet Toddler-Proofed" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad the little guy woke up earlier than expected... He woke up when I was still testing how many beans I should put inside. I had to quickly seal the tube since he couldn't wait to play with it. I should have put more beans ... &gt;_&lt;

Nevertheless, the sound was great! All we have to do is just tilt a little, not too much, to make the sound last longer... :)
<p style="text-align:center;">

[caption id="attachment_1034" align="aligncenter" width="203" caption="Raining..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/123_rainstick_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1034 " title="123_rainstick_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/02/123_rainstick_03.jpg?w=203" alt="Raining..." width="203" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

</p>
You should try it, too... :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Magnet Dino</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/02/the-magnet-dino/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 02 Mar 2011 04:37:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Magnet]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="magnet"><![CDATA[Magnet]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1037</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[You may be able to recognize this paper that we decided to keep <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/14/one-leaf-at-a-time" target="_blank">earlier</a>... :)

[caption id="attachment_1039" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Just Add Dinosaurs..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1039" title="126_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Just Add Dinosaurs..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I find the colors just perfect to make some dinosaurs... :) All I had to do was draw some dinosaurs.

After cutting, however, I realized that they still looked rather ... empty. The little guy came to the rescue when he took his colored pencils and shouted "Color!"

[caption id="attachment_1040" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Coloring in progress"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1040" title="126_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Coloring in progress" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

He might be the one suggesting to color... but he was the first to leave me all by myself, with that colored pencil in less than 5 minutes! Geee... :S

I know, it wasn't easy to color such small dinosaurs. It would have been easier had we colored them first (before cutting).

Anyway, after leaving those dinosaurs on the table for a couple of days and persuading the little guy to color every now and then using either colored pencil or oil pastel, we (finally) managed to get them done. Guess who colored the most? Ha! :P

You could now find them on our fridge's door, thanks to the magnet that I put at the back of each dino. Well, at least you could find them there... most of the time.

[caption id="attachment_1041" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Rampaging the fridge"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1041" title="126_dino_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Rampaging the fridge" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Sometimes, if you don't find them there... you just need to look around a bit. They might just be busy trying to climb out from the rice box.

[caption id="attachment_1042" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Buried in Rice"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1042" title="126_dino_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/126_dino_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Buried in Rice" width="300" height="261" /></a>[/caption]

Hee hee... perhaps if dinosaurs were to live to this age, this kind of thing done by the little guy would make them extinct sooner or later... :P

Truly an example of survival of the fittest... :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>

		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1053</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[What do you do when you have some extra not-so-fresh milk? Search the internet and find <a href="http://www.stevespanglerscience.com/experiment/00000066" target="_blank">something fun to do with it</a>, of course!

First, we prepared the milk. The little guy currently loves squeezing  and squirting. It was kinda hard to tell him not to finish the milk in  one go. Yet, somehow, we managed to do this experiment in three batches.
<div><dl><dt>

[caption id="attachment_1054" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Squirt... squirt..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1054" title="127_milk_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_011.jpg?w=300" alt="Squirt... squirt..." width="300" height="209" /></a>[/caption]

</dt></dl></div>
I was in charge of the color, simply because I did not want him to pour the whole bottles of food coloring... :P

We had a great time guessing what the drops of color looked like. Or  rather, I guessed. He giggled. I missed to take a picture of the  first batch. But you could see the other two and make your own  guesses... :)
<div><dl><dt></dt></dl></div>

[caption id="attachment_1055" align="aligncenter" width="292" caption="Quack!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1055" title="127_milk_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_021.jpg?w=292" alt="Quack!" width="292" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1056" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ladybug!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1056" title="127_milk_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_031.jpg?w=300" alt="Ladybug!" width="300" height="208" /></a>[/caption]

The  moment I handed the little guy the soapy cotton bud, I got a bit wary.  Give him anything liquid and a stick and he would be happy to make  waves for you... :P So, at first, I held his hand and guided him to slowly place the cotton bud in the milk. And...

[caption id="attachment_1057" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Whee... fireworks!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1057" title="127_milk_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Whee... fireworks!" width="300" height="208" /></a>[/caption]

The burst of color really reminded me of fireworks! It may not be that clear in the picture above. The picture was taken in a hurry. I was a bit worried that the little guy might flick some water on the lens.

I guess you just have to try and see it for yourself! ;)

Anyway, after 3 batches, the little guy kinda got the hang of it. He seemed to suspect that it was all thanks to the soap. So, he began his own experiment. With no patience, obviously... for he squirted the whole bottle of soap!

[caption id="attachment_1058" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Maybe there&#039;ll be a bigger firework..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1058" title="127_milk_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Maybe there'll be a bigger firework..." width="300" height="211" /></a>[/caption]

And so... we had a plate full of milk and soap. Before he finished my whole bottle of soap, I quickly went to get a straw, placed it into the mixture and blew bubbles... :) For a while, the little guy found it more fun to pop the bubbles... :P He totally forgot about the bottle of soap.

[caption id="attachment_1059" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Pop! Pop!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1059" title="127_milk_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Pop! Pop!" width="300" height="237" /></a>[/caption]

Did the little guy then ask to try blowing bubbles with the straw, too? You bet! The next mission impossible involved trying to tell him that he just wasn't ready for it yet. He insisted, though. A few times, he would probably have sucked in some if only I didn't pinch the straw in time!

So, to distract him, I went to take some pieces of paper (after hiding the straw, of course!).

And look at what we made... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1060" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Bubble Painting!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1060" title="127_milk_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Bubble Painting!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Nice effect, don't you think? It really reminds me of my biology class... :)

We made four cards in total... :) We nearly made five... but the little guy successfully drown the fifth one when I went to get a piece of tissue... &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_1061" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Final Four"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1061" title="127_milk_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/127_milk_08.jpg?w=300" alt="The Final Four" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

That's alright... At least he forgot about the straw... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Painting Spree!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/08/painting-spree/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Mar 2011 15:42:59 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1065</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Somebody's been on a painting spree recently!

Once, he even asked to paint before bedtime... :S

... and before nap time... :S

When it first started, I was too tired to think of anything specific to paint. So, I just gave him a kitchen towel roll and let him paint with whichever color he chose.

The little guy, of course, chose <span style="text-decoration:underline;">all</span> the colors! Even if that meant he had to wash the brush each time he was done with one ... Or maybe, that was the part that made it all exciting... :P

[caption id="attachment_1067" align="aligncenter" width="281" caption="Just keep painting... painting..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/128_paint_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1067" title="128_paint_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/128_paint_01.jpg?w=281" alt="Just keep painting... painting..." width="281" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He still kept asking to paint that particular kitchen towel roll every now and then. But, until this mommy of his could think of what to make out of that roll, it would remain as an abstract roll for his painting spree... :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Blue, Blue, Baby Blue</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/08/blue-blue-baby-blue/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 08 Mar 2011 15:57:46 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[No, this wasn't an attempt to remake <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Avatar_%282009_film%29" target="_blank">Avatar</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1071" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Blue Hand"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/129_avatar_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1071" title="129_avatar_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/129_avatar_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Blue Hand" width="300" height="220" /></a>[/caption]

Nor was this one...

[caption id="attachment_1072" align="aligncenter" width="238" caption="Blue Foot"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/129_avatar_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1072" title="129_avatar_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/129_avatar_02.jpg?w=238" alt="Blue Foot" width="238" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We were just trying to make a long-lasting memento of how small the little guy's hands and feet once were... :)

Yet, obviously, someone got really excited and made lots of prints... :P

[caption id="attachment_1073" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The More, The Merrier..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/129_avatar_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1073" title="129_avatar_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/129_avatar_03.jpg?w=300" alt="The More, The Merrier..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Luckily, not on the wall... ;)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Paint a Forest</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/10/paint-a-forest/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Mar 2011 06:10:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1079</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I just found a small, long piece of cardboard recently. It was probably a leftover piece from the cardboard that we used to make <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/24/no-cinderella-story/" target="_blank">our castle</a>.

While it was too small to build into anything, it was just the right size to use as a kind of brush... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>2 small pieces of cardboard (I cut mine into two shorter pieces)</li>
	<li>paint (brown and green)</li>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>paint brush (optional)</li>
</ol>
[caption id="attachment_1080" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting ready..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1080" title="130_forest_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting ready..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, I showed him how to dip the cardboard stick into the brown paint and sweep the paint down on a drawing paper.

[caption id="attachment_1081" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Sweep...Tree... Sweep... Tree..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1081" title="130_forest_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Sweep...Tree... Sweep... Tree..." width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption]

There you go, we've got some tree trunks... :)

We then took the other cardboard piece and roll it. We dipped it into the green paint and stamped it on the drawing paper. Just right above our tree trunks.

I actually forgot to take a picture of the rolled cardboard piece before throwing it, but I guess you could roughly tell how it looked from the green stamps that we made... :)

[caption id="attachment_1082" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Growing trees..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1082" title="130_forest_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Growing trees..." width="300" height="234" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy found the paintbrush not long after. He then decided to use the paintbrush instead, flickering it here and there...

[caption id="attachment_1083" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Stamping brush"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1083" title="130_forest_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Stamping brush" width="300" height="177" /></a>[/caption]

He also asked for his beloved <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/08/painting-spree/" target="_blank">kitchen towel roll</a>, which he had been painting for the past few days... :P

[caption id="attachment_1084" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="(Still) On a Painting Spree..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1084" title="130_forest_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_05.jpg?w=212" alt="(Still) On a Painting Spree..." width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It wasn't for long, though... Soon enough, he went back to his trees and completed a forest... :)

[caption id="attachment_1085" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="His First Forest Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1085" title="130_forest_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/130_forest_06.jpg?w=300" alt="His First Forest Painting" width="300" height="220" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Cleaning is Fun!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/10/cleaning-is-fun/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 10 Mar 2011 14:44:09 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1088</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy accidentally spilled some of the bubble solution that I made for him (basically just a mixture of dish-washing liquid and water).

I could tell that he felt really bad about it. He went around to look for the mop to clean the mess he made. The mop, however, was not in the usual place.

I showed him a brush, asking him if he wanted to use that instead... :P

To my surprise, he agreed!

[caption id="attachment_1089" align="aligncenter" width="279" caption="Brush till Sparkling Clean"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/131_clean_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1089" title="131_clean_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/131_clean_01.jpg?w=279" alt="Brush till Sparkling Clean" width="279" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Obviously, he enjoyed this new tool... :P You see, I don't usually let him play with the brush. He must be overjoyed when I actually offered him that brush... hee hee..  Oh well, it has been a while since I last gave the floor a good scrub anyway...*<em>grinz</em>* So, I let him enjoy brushing for a good 5 minutes or so.

I also introduced him to the squeegee... It became his favorite in no time.

[caption id="attachment_1090" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Squeegee Attack!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/131_clean_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1090" title="131_clean_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/131_clean_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Squeegee Attack!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was, of course, a bad decision from my side.

A. Very. Bad. Decision.

Now, whenever he sees that squeegee, he would keep asking me if he could play with it... &gt;_&lt;

Uh oh...!]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to Project Runway</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/11/the-little-guys-guide-to-project-runway/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 11 Mar 2011 15:59:06 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Hand Prints]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="hand-prints"><![CDATA[Hand Prints]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1095</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy still loves it when I paint his hands and feet. So, one afternoon, when he was fast asleep, I got the 'runway' ready... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1097" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Ready to Paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1097" title="132_runway_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Ready to Paint" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

You could see that I had foreseen the mess. I prepared a bowl of water on one side and a pack of wet tissue on the other side. Somehow, the picture of an active toddler with hands and feet full of paint got me a bit worried... :P

After the little guy woke up from his beauty nap, we got ourselves busy painting and jumping around at the same time. Yes, I really mean "we"! I decided to paint my toes and joined the fun... :)

[caption id="attachment_1103" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Dancing in Colors!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_025.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1103" title="132_runway_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_025.jpg?w=225" alt="Dancing in Colors!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I only left him on his own when he started crawling around. While he was busy on his own, I went to prepare his "pot of gold": a bowl of green bean soup... :)

The moment I put the bowl down was exactly the moment the little guy left the runway to snatch his pot of gold. It was quite a struggle to persuade him to wash his hands and feet first!

[caption id="attachment_1107" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Pot of Gold at the End of the Rainbow"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1107" title="132_runway_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A Pot of Gold at the End of the Rainbow" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

He continued with his project runway after he finished his snack.

We then left our project runway to dry overnight and took a picture of it the following morning.

[caption id="attachment_1105" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Project Runway: Completed!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_041.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1105" title="132_runway_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/132_runway_041.jpg?w=225" alt="Project Runway: Completed!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

No walls were harmed in the making... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1095</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-03-11 23:59:06</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-03-11 15:59:06</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>the-little-guys-guide-to-project-runway</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<item>
		<title>A Bittersweet Milestone</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/12/a-bittersweet-milestone/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 12 Mar 2011 14:16:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1110</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you happen to have a kid of your own, do you often feel that sometimes you simply forget how much your kid has grown up?

I do.

The little guy is growing, at full speed... and I often think that he is <em>still</em> a small baby! As light as a small rice sack. And much shorter than our dining table.

And oh yeah, that latter assumption often gives me mess to clean up... :p

So, here's a note to myself: Never ever leave a bottle of milk and a glass on the table for more than 5 minutes. The little guy can easily reach whatever that is on the table now (even if you think it is far from the edge!) and you never know what could happen!

Like the other day when the little guy rushed to find me in my room, saying, "wet... wet..."

The first thing that crossed my mind was ... uhm, a wee wee accident. So, when I found him clean and dry with no sign of a wee wee accident, I felt relieved. But when he kept pulling me and saying, "wet...wet...", I had no choice but to follow him to show me what actually happened.

And here is what he showed me.

[caption id="attachment_1113" align="aligncenter" width="204" caption="My glass is overflowing..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/134_milk_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1113 " title="134_milk_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/134_milk_011.jpg?w=204" alt="My glass is overflowing..." width="204" height="300" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">Obviously, the little guy had poured the whole bottle of milk into his glass. Thankfully, there was just that much of milk left in the bottle to fill up the glass... ^_^" He didn't bother to ask and wait for me to fill up his glass anymore! A good sign of independence... yet, it could also mean a major disaster if the bottle was full... :P</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">Anyway, the little guy then asked me to let him sit on the chair so that he could practice his drinking-without-holding-the-glass skill... :P</p>


[caption id="attachment_1116" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Experimenting on Different Ways to Drink"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/134_milk_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1116" title="134_milk_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/134_milk_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Experimenting on Different Ways to Drink" width="300" height="287" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, nobody got to cry over the spilled milk... ;) But somebody did have to clean up the mess... :P

[caption id="attachment_1115" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="Cleaning up the mess..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/134_milk_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1115" title="134_milk_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/134_milk_031.jpg?w=198" alt="Cleaning up the mess..." width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Good thing he helped me with the first stage of cleaning up... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1110</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-03-12 22:16:50</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-03-12 14:16:50</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>a-bittersweet-milestone</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[1299939412:15431286]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>

		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>135_playdate_01</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/14/painting-with-friends/135_playdate_01/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Mar 2011 13:31:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/135_playdate_01.jpg</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Just another <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/21/hocus-pocus-dino/" target="_blank">crayon resist painting</a>...

[caption id="attachment_1121" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Honk...honk!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/135_playdate_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1121" title="135_playdate_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/135_playdate_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Honk...honk!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1122" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Show and Cheese... ^o^"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/135_playdate_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1122" title="135_playdate_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/135_playdate_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Show and Cheese... ^o^" width="300" height="84" /></a>[/caption]

		<item>
		<title>Ring-a-Ring O&#039; Roses</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/14/ring-a-ring-o-roses/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 14 Mar 2011 14:05:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1124</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This proud little fellow...

[caption id="attachment_1125" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Something Green..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1125" title="133_veg_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Something Green..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

...was part of lunch.

These, however...

[caption id="attachment_1126" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Something Green...Something Orange..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1126" title="133_veg_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Something Green...Something Orange..." width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

... were things we prepared for our artwork... :)

The inspiration came from one of the <a href="http://www.witz.sg/index.html" target="_blank">WITZ</a> episodes. We added the carrot in since we also happened to have one at home.

And so, the stamping began... ^o^

[caption id="attachment_1127" align="aligncenter" width="240" caption="Roses are red..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1127" title="133_veg_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_03.jpg?w=240" alt="Roses are red..." width="240" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Don't you think this looks like a bouquet of roses? ;)

[caption id="attachment_1129" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One Big Bouquet"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1129" title="133_veg_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/133_veg_04.jpg?w=300" alt="One Big Bouquet" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Beads to the Rescue</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/15/beads-to-the-rescue/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 15 Mar 2011 06:24:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beads"><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1131</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Today was just one of those tough days. We all have been in this kind of days, haven't we? &gt;_&lt;

It was just one of those days when the little guy only seems to have the word "No!" in his dictionary. Since very early in the morning... &gt;_&lt;

It was one of those days when he constantly throws a fit. For even the simplest reason. Like when he couldn't find his favorite milk, with the right flavor and the right size, i.e. the big bottle of chocolate milk. Obviously, the small bottle of strawberry milk in the fridge couldn't appease him at all.

It was one of those days when I then had to bring him to the supermarket to get that certain bottle of milk... only to find that he had something against sitting down on the pram. And nope, he didn't want to walk either. Trust me, it certainly feels silly to push an empty pram with a wiggling toddler in my arms.

It was also one of those days when people at the supermarket stared at this helpless mother as she tried to persuade this one little tornado to join the queue at the cashier. Yup, obviously, holding a box of his favorite cereal gave him the energy to run (forget about walking!) around.

It was also one of those days he could bring a whole big mess to my kitchen within less than a minute. First, it was a whole rice mess. The rice kept falling onto the floor as he played with the box of rice. And later on, after I managed to clean it, he flooded the kitchen with the water that I prepared for mopping the floor.

Just perfect.

And all those happened even before I had the chance to have breakfast. Yeah... a hungry mommy is usually an impatient mommy. So, the time out corner seemed to be on high demand today.

And all those happened while the news on TV was blaring about the blast at the nuclear plant in Japan, spelling the big letter W-O-R-R-Y in my head. I know, I know... I shouldn't have turned on the TV...:S

So, I thought maybe we both just needed to chill a little bit.

Threading beads seems to be pretty relaxing... :) So, I put up one long wire, from the doorknob to the door stopper. We threaded together some beads onto the wire... and, we've got ourselves a relaxing entertainment that could be brought up...

[caption id="attachment_1132" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Up, up and above..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/138_beads_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1132" title="138_beads_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/138_beads_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Up, up and above..." width="300" height="210" /></a>[/caption]

... and down! Wheee... ^o^

[caption id="attachment_1133" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Fun with Gravity"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/138_beads_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1133" title="138_beads_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/138_beads_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Fun with Gravity" width="300" height="224" /></a>[/caption]

We certainly had fun then!

But, if you ask me whether this story then ended with a happily ever after, well... in what seemed to be the finale (or so I hope), he spilled his chocolate milk on the bed sheet (just right after I managed to get one load of laundry done!) in his attempt to show me that he could drink from a glass while he was lying down! &gt;_&lt;

Still half a day to go... but I am crossing my fingers that he would somehow be back to his good old self again after his nap. ^_^]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Rainbow Dye</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/16/rainbow-dye/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 16 Mar 2011 06:17:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1137</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[With <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/19/what-blue-and-yellow-make/" target="_blank">five bottles of food coloring sitting at home</a>, I have become very generous when it comes to using them.

Often, I just let the little guy play color mixing.

Indeed, it is one fun activity for him. Yet, often, it could be pretty tiring to monitor him closely. You see, the little guy is never a fan of aprons. Not even bibs. Certainly not a good thing when you know that food coloring is <em>not </em>that washable.

[caption id="attachment_1138" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Color mixing in progress.."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1138" title="137_color_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Color mixing in progress.." width="300" height="211" /></a>[/caption]

Lately, however, I realize that he's becoming more and more careful not to spill any on his clothes. That certainly puts my mind at ease... :)

So, one day, after letting the little guy play some color mixing, I took a few pieces of kitchen towel. I folded them a few times and taught the little guy to dip each corner into a color, one at a time.

[caption id="attachment_1139" align="aligncenter" width="211" caption="After dipping..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1139" title="137_color_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_04.jpg?w=211" alt="After dipping..." width="211" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The folded piece looked something like this...

[caption id="attachment_1140" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Wet and Colorful"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1140" title="137_color_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Wet and Colorful" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Not that special, eh?

But when you open it up, it would turn into something nice... :)
<p style="text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_1141" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Something To Dye For!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1141 " title="137_color_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Something To Dye For!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">The inspiration came from <a href="http://www.amazon.ca/Fun-Crafts-Kids-Jennie-Mackenzie/dp/156197014X" target="_blank">a great book</a> that we recently found  in the library. You should try to find that book, too. It has tons of ideas to keep the little ones busy, especially during school holidays...;)</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">We managed to paint four pieces of kitchen towel before we ran out of food coloring. One of them, however, was torn when we tried to open it up...:(</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">So, we only had 2 other designs to show off ... :)</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_1144" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Rainbow Patch"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_051.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1144" title="137_color_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_051.jpg?w=300" alt="The Rainbow Patch" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1145" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The White Space"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1145 " title="137_color_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_06.jpg?w=300" alt="The White Space" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]
<p style="text-align:left;">And, hey, check out the rainbows on our fingers, too! ;)</p>
<p style="text-align:left;">&nbsp;</p>


[caption id="attachment_1146" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Rainbows on our fingers"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1146" title="137_color_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/137_color_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Rainbows on our fingers" width="300" height="214" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1137</wp:post_id>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>rainbow-dye</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>

		<item>
		<title>For Whom the Bells Toll</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/17/for-whom-the-bells-toll/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Mar 2011 08:42:14 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beads"><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1150</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One day after <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/15/beads-to-the-rescue/" target="_blank">the beads came to the rescue</a>, I added two bells.

[caption id="attachment_1151" align="aligncenter" width="188" caption="The Two Red Bells"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/139_beads_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1151" title="139_beads_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/139_beads_01.jpg?w=188" alt="The Two Red Bells" width="188" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Though small, the bells really prove to be a great way to distract a super grouchy toddler... :)]]></content:encoded>
