							</item>
		<item>
		<title>The Art of the Drummer</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/17/the-art-of-the-drummer/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 17 Mar 2011 09:21:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1154</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There's probably nothing great about this artwork.

[caption id="attachment_1155" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Too abstract, too dull"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1155" title="136_easel_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Too abstract, too dull" width="300" height="226" /></a>[/caption]

But if I tell you how this was made, you might be able to better appreciate it . Let me give it a try... ;)

It was just another cloudy afternoon. The little guy was still one grouchy toddler. In this week's chart, the meltdowns' frequency and intensity were still somewhere up there.

During this kind of episodes, art-making seems to be the only hope whenever I'm at my wits' end. It never fails to keep him occupied. And best of all, it keeps both of us happy (and keep my sanity intact after handling all the meltdowns!). Even if it is only in mere minutes.

So, yup... if you notice that we've been making lots of artworks lately, it really has nothing to do with the school holiday. The little guy hasn't gone to any real school, in fact... :P

Anyway, I realized that we often paint on the floor or on the table. The little guy had never experienced painting with an art easel.

Uhm, neither had I, actually... :P

Unfortunately, we don't have an art easel at home. We don't intend to buy one either. So, we made full use of our front gate and designed our own art easel.

And look who was enjoying the custom-built easel... :P

[caption id="attachment_1156" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Vertically Fun!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1156" title="136_easel_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Vertically Fun!" width="300" height="262" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy then experimented another way of painting by using his toes to hold the brush. Too bad I didn't get the chance to take a picture of his stunt... :P

He also took my brush and tried painting with two brushes...

[caption id="attachment_1157" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Two Hands, Two Brushes"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1157" title="136_easel_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Two Hands, Two Brushes" width="300" height="218" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1158" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="(Almost) One Hand, Two Brushes"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1158" title="136_easel_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_03.jpg?w=300" alt="(Almost) One Hand, Two Brushes" width="300" height="227" /></a>[/caption]

... before he finally figured it out by himself that music + art = fun! He took the brushes as drum sticks and started singing and "beating" his painting, taking breaks to dip the brushes into the paint every now and then.

[caption id="attachment_1159" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Little Drummer-Painter Boy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1159" title="136_easel_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/136_easel_04.jpg?w=300" alt="The Little Drummer-Painter Boy" width="300" height="285" /></a>[/caption]

It was just hilarious! So glad that I videotaped the whole singing session! Ha! ;)

And yup... that's the interesting story behind that dull painting... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>

		<item>
		<title>Pizza Night!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/21/pizza-night/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 21 Mar 2011 05:20:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1168</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[In an attempt to entertain one grouchy toddler last week, we ransacked our freezer and got ourselves busy in the kitchen.

Uhm, okie, not really... The dining room, to be precise.

The loot from the freezer included frozen peas, mushrooms, ham chips, and shredded mozzarella. Just the perfect ingredients to make some pizza... :)

We didn't have pizza dough. However, since we had plenty of bread at home, we could just skip that. We threw in some broccoli florets and pineapple... and we were all set to make our own pizza... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1169" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The ingredients for a (hopefully) grouchy-free afternoon"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1169" title="141_pizza_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The ingredients for a (hopefully) grouchy-free afternoon" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

First, I taught the little guy how to flatten the bread. He didn't have much problem with this, since we had used a rolling pin when we played playdoh before. In fact, he enjoyed it so much that he wanted to flatten some peas, too! :S

[caption id="attachment_1170" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Rolling Monster"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1170" title="141_pizza_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Rolling Monster" width="300" height="179" /></a>[/caption]

Next, he helped me spread some tomato paste on the bread before finally placing the toppings.

[caption id="attachment_1171" align="aligncenter" width="180" caption="Putting some toppings..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1171" title="141_pizza_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_03.jpg?w=180" alt="Putting some toppings..." width="180" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, not all toppings went to the pizza... :P

[caption id="attachment_1172" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="...and popping some into his mouth"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1172" title="141_pizza_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_04.jpg?w=300" alt="...and popping some into his mouth" width="300" height="213" /></a>[/caption]

The fun continued as we waited and watched the mozzarella melt.

[caption id="attachment_1173" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Melting Fun"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1173" title="141_pizza_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/141_pizza_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Melting Fun" width="300" height="211" /></a>[/caption]

Pizza for dinner, you ask?

Nope, the little guy didn't have pizza for dinner that night. Being a truly Asian little guy, he still prefers rice... &gt;_&lt;

There was still something to be grateful for, though. This was the first time the little guy prepared dinner for me... :) *<em>grinz</em>*]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>A Beautiful Oops!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/22/a-beautiful-oops/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 22 Mar 2011 06:26:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1181</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ever since I let the little guy play with a spray bottle, it's been one of his favorite bath toys. As I am currently letting the little guy experiment with different ways of painting, it just feels right to include that spray bottle ... :)

And so I loaded the spray bottle. Not fully, though... just in case he decided to pour the whole thing out, instead of spraying. I used purple paint, thinned with water.

[caption id="attachment_1182" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Half-loaded..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1182" title="142_spray_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Half-loaded..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

For an obvious reason, I chose to do this fun painting outside...&gt;:P I placed the paper on the staircase railings.

I pasted some leaves on the paper, hoping for some silhouettes to admire after we finished spraying... :)

[caption id="attachment_1183" align="aligncenter" width="215" caption="Ready to spray"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1183" title="142_spray_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_01.jpg?w=215" alt="Ready to spray" width="215" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy, too, was already in his "painting attire", i.e. never-mind-if-it-gets-dirty-and-stained attire.

In short, we were ready to spray... *<em>grinz</em>*

So, here comes the painter.

[caption id="attachment_1185" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Squirt... squirt..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1185" title="142_spray_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Squirt... squirt..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

To my surprise, even though the spray left purple dots all over the little guy's T-shirt, the patterns on the paper barely looked purple! &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_1186" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Plain Water?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1186" title="142_spray_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Plain Water?" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I guess I had used too much water to thin the paint. Oops... :(

But, of course, there are certainly no mistakes in art. There is just another opportunity to learn something new... ;)

Once the little guy was done spraying, I took down the paper and went to get some food coloring.

We dripped some food coloring onto the wet paper and watched in awe as the colors blended.

[caption id="attachment_1187" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Real Work of Art"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1187" title="142_spray_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The Real Work of Art" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Then, I let the little guy use a skewer to mix colors and draw on the paper.

[caption id="attachment_1188" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Just Add a Skewer"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1188" title="142_spray_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Just Add a Skewer" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Very fun. And very messy... :P

Good thing we did this outside!

In the end, the paper was too wet to keep. So, the picture above was the only thing we have to remind us about this fun experiment.

The little guy, however, had somehow grown a mustache during the process... :P

[caption id="attachment_1189" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Blue Moustache"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1189" title="142_spray_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/142_spray_07.jpg?w=225" alt="The Blue Moustache" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It disappeared after he took a bath a few hours later. Yet, before that,  he certainly had a great laugh looking at himself in the mirror.]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Mar 2011 06:47:40 +0000</pubDate>

		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[His Sistine Chapel Painting]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1198</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-03-24 14:47:40</wp:post_date>

		<item>
		<title>This Way Up</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/24/this-way-up/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Mar 2011 06:54:51 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1193</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I wasn't just taking picture of a table.

[caption id="attachment_1194" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="(Once) A Coffee Table"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1194" title="143_paint_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_01.jpg?w=300" alt="(Once) A Coffee Table" width="300" height="249" /></a>[/caption]

Go on. Take a closer look.

Yeah.. that's the little guy under the table, with his palette full of paint.

We are still in the midst of exploring different ways of painting. And a couple of days ago was certainly the right time to introduce the little guy to a different perspective of painting... :)

This time round, we placed our drawing paper underneath the coffee table. I also put some cushions under the table, so that the little guy would still feel comfortable while painting.

[caption id="attachment_1195" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="A Different Perspective"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1195" title="143_paint_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_02.jpg?w=217" alt="A Different Perspective" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I found this kind of painting challenging, but fun. Obviously, the little guy found it exciting, too. We kept the drawing paper there for a few days as he kept asking to explore different methods and "enhance" his painting... :P

Or, in his own words, "color... more..."

[caption id="attachment_1196" align="aligncenter" width="230" caption="Exploring One Method..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1196" title="143_paint_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_03.jpg?w=230" alt="Exploring One Method..." width="230" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1197" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="..and Another"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1197" title="143_paint_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_04.jpg?w=225" alt="..and Another" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hm... forget about the discomfort from tilting the head while painting. I wonder if Michelangelo shared the same excitement when he painted <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sistine_Chapel_ceiling" target="_blank">Sistine Chapel ceiling</a>. Hee hee... :P

Anyway, this was how our Sistine Chapel ceiling looks like.

[caption id="attachment_1198" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="His Sistine Chapel Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1198" title="143_paint_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/143_paint_05.jpg?w=300" alt="His Sistine Chapel Painting" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Drip &#039;n Splatter!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/24/drip-n-splatter/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 24 Mar 2011 07:11:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1200</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Okie. So, we've been trying different ways of painting.

But, there is still one method that I wish to explore, but I'm still mustering the courage to do it: splatter painting.

You know, just like <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jackson_Pollock" target="_blank">Jackson Pollock's</a>.

I'm not that worried about the mess. We could always do it outside. I'm more worried that the little guy, a generous when it comes to pouring paint, would pour out the whole bottles of paint... &gt;_&lt;

Oh well, as we wait for that right moment, let's just explore <a href="http://www.jacksonpollock.org/" target="_blank">the digital version</a>, shall we? ;)

It's pretty addictive. The little guy often asks for it when he sees that the computer is on.

I managed to capture some of his artworks... :)

[caption id="attachment_1201" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="With White Background"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/144_pollock_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1201" title="144_pollock_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/144_pollock_01.jpg?w=300" alt="With White Background" width="300" height="157" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1202" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="With Green Background"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/144_pollock_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1202" title="144_pollock_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/144_pollock_02.jpg?w=300" alt="With Green Background" width="300" height="175" /></a>[/caption]

You should give it a try, too... ;)

Have fun!]]></content:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to Running a Hospital</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/25/the-little-guys-guide-to-running-a-hospital/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Mar 2011 06:34:52 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1205</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Certainly, spending time with a busy toddler is never an easy task for those who are sensitive to noise.

No, I'm not one of them. I must admit, though, when he first started pushing the towel rack around the house, I winced at the sound it made. I nearly shouted at him, pleading him to stop that irritating sound.

Yet, after seeing the little guy pushing my towel rack around with  his beloved dinosaur on top, I decided to run a hospital with him instead... :)

[caption id="attachment_1206" align="aligncenter" width="223" caption="One Patient from the A &amp; E!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1206" title="145_hospital_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_01.jpg?w=223" alt="One Patient from the A &amp; E!" width="223" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Our story began with Dino coming in from the Accident &amp; Emergency department. We tried to tickle him, but he didn't respond... so, we declared that he had suffered a loss of consciousness...:P

[caption id="attachment_1207" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Done with the Treatment"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1207" title="145_hospital_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Done with the Treatment" width="300" height="202" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy, M.D. then decided to wrap a bandage around the head and place adhesive bandages near his nose. Uh oh... I hope they didn't block Dino's nose... &gt;_&lt;

Don't look at me, it was the doctor's idea. I was too busy with the camera to show him what to do... :P Besides, I didn't want to spoil the fun... :)

I must claim, however, that our hospital delivers first-class services. Just see what the little guy did next.

[caption id="attachment_1208" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Special Kiss-it-better"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1208" title="145_hospital_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_03.jpg?w=225" alt="A Special Kiss-it-better" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He kissed Dino and wished him to get well soon! Awww... so sweet of him!

Anyway, it was quite a busy day at the hospital. So, the little guy couldn't really spend much time with Dino. He then dashed to see his other patient, Duckie.

[caption id="attachment_1211" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Jab for Duckie"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1211" title="145_hospital_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_04.jpg?w=225" alt="A Jab for Duckie" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I wasn't sure what happened to Duckie, but the little guy decided to just give him a jab and moved him to another ward (i.e. on the table... no more comfy bed for you, Duckie!).

Or, perhaps, the little guy just thought that Duckie's case wasn't that exciting. Plus, we needed a place for our next patient: Whalee.

[caption id="attachment_1209" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Coming in...!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1209" title="145_hospital_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/145_hospital_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Coming in...!" width="300" height="286" /></a>[/caption]

I wondered what happened to Whalee... It was just getting more exciting!

In the end, I couldn't resist to stop taking pictures and just join the fun... &gt;:P We handled quite a number of patients that day!

And hey, do you know something, the sound didn't bother me anymore! ;)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<title>146_sticker_02</title>

		<item>
		<title>Where the Forest Creatures Are</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/25/where-the-forest-creatures-are/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 25 Mar 2011 06:47:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Stickers]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="stickers"><![CDATA[Stickers]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1213</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Remember <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/10/paint-a-forest/" target="_blank">this forest of ours</a>?

Well, we decided to make full use of it... :)

[caption id="attachment_1214" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Sticking the Forest Creatures"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/146_sticker_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1214" title="146_sticker_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/146_sticker_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Sticking the Forest Creatures" width="300" height="224" /></a>[/caption]

All we need is just a clear plastic folder and some stickers... :) Just place the painting inside the folder, and we've got ourselves a perfect thing to keep the little guy occupied for a few minutes while we are at the church!

I'm so glad I didn't throw the sticker base straight away. The little guy somehow thinks it is fun to place the stickers back after putting all the stickers on the forest.

[caption id="attachment_1215" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Placing the Stickers Back"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/146_sticker_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1215" title="146_sticker_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/146_sticker_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Placing the Stickers Back" width="300" height="201" /></a>[/caption]

Or maybe he simply loves matching the stickers to the silhouettes on the base. Just like solving a jigsaw puzzle... :)

Not bad for <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/11/11/razzle-dazzle-puzzle/ ‎" target="_blank">someone who didn't seem to be interested in jigsaw puzzles a few months ago</a>.... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Beads Monster</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/28/the-beads-monster/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Mar 2011 05:55:13 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beads"><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Playdoh]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="playdoh"><![CDATA[Playdoh]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1219</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ever since I gained that confidence that the little guy wouldn't pop any beads into his mouth, wow... the possibilities are simply endless!

We could <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/15/beads-to-the-rescue/" target="_blank">thread beads onto a wire</a>.

Or, we could just open the Playdoh's lid, poke some spaghetti and start threading.

[caption id="attachment_1222" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Bead Sticks"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1222" title="147_beads_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Bead Sticks" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

If that proves to be too easy, we could just take the Playdoh out and start threading again.

[caption id="attachment_1223" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Playdoh Ball"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1223" title="147_beads_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Playdoh Ball" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Or, you could start asking daddy to turn that ball into a monster. Mommy would be more than happy to lend some googly eyes..

[caption id="attachment_1224" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Monster in the Making"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1224" title="147_beads_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Monster in the Making" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

... and even a pom-pom ball.

[caption id="attachment_1225" align="aligncenter" width="235" caption="Bead Monster in Action"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1225" title="147_beads_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_04.jpg?w=235" alt="Bead Monster in Action" width="235" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

No, no... don't get scared of our little monster. He was such a cutie. Completely harmless, he wouldn't bite.

Even when you sit on him! Like what the little guy had proven for himself... :P

[caption id="attachment_1226" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Flattened Monster"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1226" title="147_beads_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/147_beads_05.jpg?w=225" alt="Flattened Monster" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Oops... I'm afraid that was how the story of the Beads Monster ended.]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Blocks, etc.</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/28/blocks-etc/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 28 Mar 2011 06:56:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Blocks]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="blocks"><![CDATA[Blocks]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1229</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I can't remember precisely how we get to the point of having tons of blocks.

I do remember the first time we bought our first <a href="http://www.megabrands.com/Shop/MEGA_Bloks/" target="_blank">Mega Bloks</a>, though. Nothing special. There are only 20 pieces. I guess we bought it simply because we were in love with the pull-along wagon.

Yet, two birthday parties later... and we now have lots of blocks, in different colors and different sizes.

Splendid!

We've been building lots of things: towers, dogs, giraffes, bridges... and some other unknown objects. Of course, most of the time, the little guy still follows the concept of "uBuild, mommy... and iDestroy".

Lately, however, we have been using the blocks for other purposes... :)

Like, to hold the rulers in place as we bring Thomas for roller-coaster rides.

[caption id="attachment_1230" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Buckle up, Thomas!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1230" title="148_block_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Buckle up, Thomas!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

There is also something addictive about practicing using tong to grasp and dump some small blocks. Trust me, because of that, I haven't been able to get that tong back to the kitchen. The little guy has declared the tong as his and he keeps it inside his block container!

[caption id="attachment_1231" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Grasp and Dump"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1231" title="148_block_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Grasp and Dump" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy had also used that same plastic tong and different blocks to give a new twist to how to play the shape sorter toy.

[caption id="attachment_1232" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Sorted with a Tong"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1232" title="148_block_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Sorted with a Tong" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And, speaking about sorting, those blocks also provide a great way to learn about colors.

[caption id="attachment_1233" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Name That Color!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1233" title="148_block_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/148_block_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Name That Color!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Hmm... I wonder what else we could use our blocks for... :D]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Cookies Galore!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/30/cookies-galore/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 29 Mar 2011 16:40:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1236</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<em>If you are about to read this post without anything edible near you, I'm afraid I have to stop you here. </em>

<em>Please. Stop. Right here. </em>

<em>
</em>

<em>Oh... you do have something yummy there? Okie... go on then!</em>

Last Sunday, my husband, the little guy and I had quite a lazy hazy afternoon. All three of us were down with either mild diarrhea or blocked nose. Hence, we stayed at home.

Then, my husband asked that question, "What do you think we should do?"

And so the quest to ransack the kitchen began. It wasn't long, though. I knew exactly what we <span style="text-decoration:underline;">all</span> could do... *<em>grinz</em>*: bake cookies!

The first assignment was to prepare the chocolate chips. I only had one big block of dark chocolate at home. So, my husband helped to cut it into small pieces, while the little guy helped him put the pieces into a container... :)

Sounds like a great teamwork, eh?! ;)

[caption id="attachment_1237" align="aligncenter" width="209" caption="Teamwork"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1237" title="150_cookie_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_01.jpg?w=209" alt="Teamwork" width="209" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Uhm, well... that was just like... theoretically speaking. They were supposed to do just that... But, judging from the amount of chocolate chips that went into the container vs. how big the chocolate block previously was, I suspect the teamwork went beyond that!

Somebody had been eating my chocolate while I got busy preparing the cookie dough!!!

[caption id="attachment_1238" align="aligncenter" width="177" caption="Tried and Tested"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1238" title="150_cookie_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_02.jpg?w=177" alt="Tried and Tested" width="177" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Anyway, we were soon ready to move to the next assignment. So, this time round, my husband was to shape the cookie dough and place them on the baking tray, while the little guy took the duty of "sprinkling" the chocolate chips.

Look how generous he was!

[caption id="attachment_1239" align="aligncenter" width="188" caption="Counting Chips..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1239" title="150_cookie_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_03.jpg?w=188" alt="Counting Chips..." width="188" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

But, that was it... After the first 2 batches, only my first assistant remained. The little one... uhm, went about his business... :P

He certainly did not know what he had missed! While he was busy with his trains and cars, I went from "whooo" to "wheee..." seeing my cookies in the oven.

[caption id="attachment_1240" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Whooo..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1240" title="150_cookie_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Whooo..." width="300" height="172" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1241" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Whee..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1241" title="150_cookie_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Whee..." width="300" height="178" /></a>[/caption]

And when we were done... Cookies!!!

[caption id="attachment_1242" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Glorious Cookies!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1242" title="150_cookie_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Glorious Cookies!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The whole family turned into some sort of cookie monsters... :P ﻿﻿

Even the little guy thinks one should always have one for each hand!

[caption id="attachment_1244" align="aligncenter" width="197" caption="One for You, Two for Me"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_071.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1244" title="150_cookie_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/150_cookie_071.jpg?w=197" alt="One for You, Two for Me" width="197" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

What a Sunday! By the time the cookies were ready, we no longer had diarrhea... no more blocked nose either.

Just cookies.

And a little more cookies...

Uh oh, wait... who took my cookies?!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to the Best Exercise</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/31/the-little-guys-guide-to-the-best-exercise/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 31 Mar 2011 14:19:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1249</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Okie... we're guilty as charged. We've been eating too much cookies... &gt;_&lt;

But, don't worry, we've been trying hard to keep our hands away from the cookie jar.

We tried to exercise. We thought of flying kites...

[caption id="attachment_1251" align="aligncenter" width="213" caption="Only on Weekends"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/151_sport_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1251" title="151_sport_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/151_sport_03.jpg?w=213" alt="Only on Weekends" width="213" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

But, playing kites is reserved for the weekends...

We attempted to do some sports with a badminton racket and a shuttlecock then.

[caption id="attachment_1250" align="aligncenter" width="243" caption="Indoor Sport"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/151_sport_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1250" title="151_sport_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/151_sport_01.jpg?w=243" alt="Indoor Sport" width="243" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy, however, was more interested to use the racket as a golf stick... &gt;_&lt;

But, how about this? Say, do you think we can consider this one as a kind of sport, too? We did exercise our muscles there, you know!

[caption id="attachment_1252" align="aligncenter" width="201" caption="Paper Weaving and Peek-a-Boo!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/151_sport_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1252" title="151_sport_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/03/151_sport_02.jpg?w=201" alt="Paper Weaving and Peek-a-Boo!" width="201" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

At least, our facial muscles, when we laughed... hee hee... :P]]></content:encoded>

				<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"600";s:6:"height";s:3:"699";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:22:"height='96' width='82'";s:4:"file";s:89:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2011/04/149_magnet_02.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1300963103";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:3:"320";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:17:"0.033333333333333";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[A Different Kind of Magnet Painting]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>Sticky, Sticky Magnet</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/01/sticky-sticky-magnet/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Apr 2011 05:22:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1255</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The latest series in our various activities to explore different ways of painting involved some paper clips and fridge magnets.

This activity didn't take long to win his heart. In fact, this seemed to be another favorite of his... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paper clips (we used 2, but you could certainly use as many as you like!)</li>
	<li>fridge magnets (or any other strong magnets)</li>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>chairs (or table)</li>
	<li>clear tapes</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

I first arranged the two chairs: next to each other, but not too close to each other. The two chairs would serve as a kind of platform for the drawing paper. Then, using clear tapes, I sealed the drawing paper across the two chairs.

[caption id="attachment_1257" align="aligncenter" width="244" caption="Ready to Paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1257" title="149_magnet_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_01.jpg?w=244" alt="Ready to Paint" width="244" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

As you could see from the picture above, I placed the paper clips on top of the paper. We would be using the fridge magnets to move these paper clips from underneath the paper... :)

After putting some paint, of course.

[caption id="attachment_1258" align="aligncenter" width="257" caption="Making Colorful Tracks"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1258" title="149_magnet_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_02.jpg?w=257" alt="Making Colorful Tracks" width="257" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

As we continued moving the paper clips using the fridge magnets, our artwork slowly appeared. Whohoo...

[caption id="attachment_1259" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Check out the Swirls!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1259" title="149_magnet_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Check out the Swirls!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It was really fun! Apart from the tiny splatters from the moving paper clips, this was also not as messy as I thought it would be. Since the little guy was only moving one fridge magnet underneath, his fingers were relatively clean! :p

When I thought the little guy had lost interest to continue, I taught him how to peel off the clear tapes so that I could leave the painting outside to dry. He seemed to enjoy peeling off the clear tapes, so I left him on his own to keep the paper clips away.

When I came back, I found him adding some colors to the drawing paper. Not with paper clips, of course. He had somehow invented another way of painting... :P He made a large ball of crumpled clear tapes, dipped it into paint *<em>yeah, he opened the bottle himself.. &gt;_&lt;</em>* and started stamping.

[caption id="attachment_1260" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Introducing Clear Tape Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1260" title="149_magnet_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Introducing Clear Tape Painting" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

So, once again, the little guy was busy painting. After a while, he asked for the paper clips again.

Hehehe, not bad... since this whole painting activity kept him occupied, we had quite a peaceful morning.

I also love the artwork that we've got at the end... :)

[caption id="attachment_1261" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="An Abstract Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1261" title="149_magnet_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_05.jpg?w=300" alt="An Abstract Painting" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I could easily tell that the little guy also loves this painting method. Later that day, after his nap, he pulled out and arranged the chairs, just like how I arranged the chairs that morning.

He then gave me his widest smile and said, "color...?"

Yeah... a signal that he wanted to do it again... :P

I let him use finger paint this time round.

[caption id="attachment_1262" align="aligncenter" width="203" caption="Experimenting with Finger Paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1262" title="149_magnet_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_06.jpg?w=203" alt="Experimenting with Finger Paint" width="203" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was stickier and rather "heavy" to move around, though.

So, after a while, the little guy decided to re-purpose the fridge magnet... :P

He placed the fridge magnet on the paper and started moving it around, just like a sponge.... hee hee...

[caption id="attachment_1264" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Different Kind of Magnet Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_071.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1264" title="149_magnet_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/149_magnet_071.jpg?w=300" alt="A Different Kind of Magnet Painting" width="300" height="216" /></a>[/caption]

Now, that <span style="text-decoration:underline;">was</span> messy! :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Busy Panda</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/02/the-busy-panda/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 01 Apr 2011 17:23:28 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1273</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Help!

I've been turning into a panda lately... Yup, I'm referring to those dark circles under my eyes... &gt;_&lt;

I've been sleeping later and later these days. No, not because of deadlines. And definitely not because I suffer from insomnia.

Let me tell you the reasons:

<strong>Reason #1:</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1274" align="aligncenter" width="256" caption="The Blue Elephant Project"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/153_project_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1274" title="153_project_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/153_project_01.jpg?w=256" alt="The Blue Elephant Project" width="256" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Actually, I'm referring to that blue elephant applique on the little guy's T-shirt. But yeah, you could say that the person who was wearing that T-shirt is partly responsible for the dark circles... @_@

If he refuses to sleep early, of course I could only start working on the projects much later...*<em>sigh</em>*

<strong>Reason #2:</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1275" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Blue Dolphin"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/153_project_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1275" title="153_project_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/153_project_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Blue Dolphin" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The blue dolphin was something I had promised a dear friend last year. Yup, that long! I won't be surprised if she has even forgotten that she has once asked me to make for her... :P

Hey, you could make one, too... Just find the tutorial <a href="http://nuno-runo.blogspot.com/2010/09/dolphin.html" target="_blank">here</a>... :)

<strong>Reason #3:</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1276" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Blue Ribboned Pouch"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/153_project_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1276" title="153_project_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/153_project_03.jpg?w=300" alt="The Blue Ribboned Pouch" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Finally, a hand phone pouch for myself! Yayy.. ^o^

I used the fabric scraps from the little guy's <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/11/mission-accomplished/" target="_blank">shirt</a> and followed <a href="http://www.noodle-head.com/2010/04/gathered-clutch-tutorial.html" target="_blank">this tutorial</a>.

It isn't that neat, but I love how it looks. Not too feminine, thanks to the cute, colorful patterns. And not too boyish either, thanks to the blue ribbon.

The only problem is, the little guy likes it, too... &gt;_&lt;

Or maybe what he really wants was to play with my phone...hee hee.

&nbsp;

Okie, enough for this week. I want my beauty sleep! :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Well Done, Well Said</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/04/well-done-well-said/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 04 Apr 2011 07:20:08 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1279</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[It was an early Saturday morning. At least, early enough for a person who had been <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/02/the-busy-panda/" target="_blank">spending late nights</a> nearly the whole week.

The little guy was, of course, Mr. Oblivious. He knows no calendar. He knows no time. When he thinks it is time for him to wake up, he will.

He would then roam around and play with whatever catches his interest first. Last Saturday, it was the 6-pot paint strip that comes with the Paint-Your-Own Wooden Race Car that I bought for my husband last Christmas.

[caption id="attachment_1281" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Early Bird Gets to Paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1281" title="154_car_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Early Bird Gets to Paint" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It might be a present I gave to my husband. Yet, that box had been sitting inside the little guy's room ever since it got unwrapped. The little guy had declared to all that the wooden race is his the moment he managed to open the box... :P

Still, he had never really played with the paint strip until that Saturday morning.

Slowly, he approached his dad.

What happened next really made us jump out of the bed: The little guy said his first fullest, longest sentence ever without our help! "Daddy... may I ... have color, please? Thank you."

Forget about the wrong choice of words. Or even the grammar. That sentence, coming from a toddler who adopts the principle of "Actions speak louder than words" most of the time, was really something that we should appreciate.

Gee, what am I saying?! This calls for a celebration! We had been waiting for this moment for the longest time ever!

And so began the father-son bonding activity. Hee hee.. yup, that was our way to celebrate... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1282" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="At the Beginning..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1282" title="154_car_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_02.jpg?w=300" alt="At the Beginning..." width="300" height="263" /></a>[/caption]

Me? Hee hee... I chose to stay on the sidelines this time. Hey, I should not be too greedy... I've got my shares of painting during the weekdays! :)

Anyway, the wooden race car got more colorful in no time.

[caption id="attachment_1283" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="... Getting More Colorful..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1283" title="154_car_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_03.jpg?w=225" alt="... Getting More Colorful..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I couldn't help but to think that it was certainly the best kind of gifts. No assembly required. Just paint, and you would get one personalised car to show off and play with. Yeah, can't agree more with you... *<em>nod, nod</em>* the person who chose this fun gift is indeed a very thoughtful person! Mwahaha... *<em>grinz</em>*

After a while, staying on the sidelines was, of course, boring. So, I left the two guys to have fun on their own while I prepared breakfast.

I absolutely had no idea what happened later on. Somehow, when I came back, the final product seems to have different colors from what I saw at the beginning... :P The hood was no longer blue. It is now pitch black!

[caption id="attachment_1285" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="... and Tadaa!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1285" title="154_car_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_04.jpg?w=300" alt="... and Tadaa!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Hee hee... It looks cool, though... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1286" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to Vroom! Vroom!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_051.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1286 " title="154_car_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/154_car_051.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready to Vroom! Vroom!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Start your engines, gentlemen! It's racing time... ;)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>When You Wish Upon a Star</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/05/when-you-wish-upon-a-star/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Apr 2011 07:19:01 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Oil Pastel]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="oil-pastel"><![CDATA[Oil Pastel]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1290</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Although it has been quite some time since I first introduced the little guy to oil pastels, it is only recently that he seems to like using oil pastels very much.

[caption id="attachment_1291" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Smelly, Messy, but Fun"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1291" title="155_pastel_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Smelly, Messy, but Fun" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Yes, he still likes to peel the paper. But, he would doodle and scribble majority of the time.

[caption id="attachment_1292" align="aligncenter" width="246" caption="Peeling is Fun, too"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1292" title="155_pastel_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_02.jpg?w=246" alt="Peeling is Fun, too" width="246" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Just like with colored pencils, it is easy to tell which color the little guy is into with the oil pastels. Each time, there would be one certain color that he would use more than the others.

Like this one.

[caption id="attachment_1293" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Black!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1293" title="155_pastel_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Black!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Strangely, he continues to like black for more than a week.

Even though I don't share the same delight in his choice of color, I should still respect his choice... :) Even when we use other tools to draw.

So, off we went in our quest to draw something black, yet different. We drew the inspiration from one of Eric Carle's books, <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Draw-Me-Star-Paperstar-Book/dp/0698116321" target="_blank">Draw Me a Star</a>.

First, we read the book together again, or rather, attempted to read together a couple of pages before he ran away to grab the brush.

Next, we painted the paper in black, blue and white.

[caption id="attachment_1296" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Paint the Sky Dark..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1296" title="155_pastel_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Paint the Sky Dark..." width="300" height="236" /></a>[/caption]

We left it to dry overnight.

The next day, we took different paint colors. To make my life easier (read: no meltdown, in case the little guy still insisted on black), I only brought out selected colors.... Hee hee... :P

The little guy then painted the "stars".

[caption id="attachment_1297" align="aligncenter" width="190" caption="Drawing the Stars..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1297" title="155_pastel_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_05.jpg?w=190" alt="Drawing the Stars..." width="190" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Easy peasy! :)

[caption id="attachment_1298" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Eric Carle&#039;s vs. The Little Guy&#039;s"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1298" title="155_pastel_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/155_pastel_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Eric Carle's vs. The Little Guy's" width="300" height="212" /></a>[/caption]

Now all we need to do is make some wishes. We have lots of stars to wish upon! ;)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>It Runs in the Family!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/06/it-runs-in-the-family/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2011 15:29:45 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beads"><![CDATA[Beads]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="beans"><![CDATA[Beans]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1301</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There has been this famous story about how my husband, when he was much younger, could spend hours *<em>I am not sure if it was literally "hours"</em>* playing with his marble run.

So, I thought, hey, if that marble run could be so fascinating to my husband, wouldn't the same apply to the little guy? Hee hee... in my mind, I could already picture that quiet, peaceful time I could have while the little guy plays on his own...&gt;:p

Days went by as I tried to figure out how to build a marble run. I thought of using kitchen towel rolls, but I wasn't sure if those rolls, glued on a cardboard with normal glue, could withstand the little guy's strength.

Then, I saw <a href="http://twochicksandahen.blogspot.com/2011/03/toilet-paper-tube-marble-run.html" target="_blank">this post</a>. So glad to know that it really <span style="text-decoration:underline;">is</span> possible to build a marble run using those rolls... :)

And guess what glue she used?! Glue gun!!! Yayyy... that solved my problem... :)

Uhm, partially...

You see, we do have a glue gun, but I just don't quite like the smell.

It wasn't that difficult to solve that part of the problem, though... :) With a little nudge here and there, my husband agreed to build the marble run for us. Yipeee... ^o^

Anyway, it wasn't that difficult to make. Or, maybe I should say, it didn't seem that difficult to make... :P

The following day, the marble run was ready for the little guy to destr... err, I mean, to use.

[caption id="attachment_1302" align="aligncenter" width="181" caption="Clang...Clang... Plop!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/156_marble_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1302" title="156_marble_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/156_marble_01.jpg?w=181" alt="Clang...Clang... Plop!" width="181" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We don't have marbles at home. So, we use wooden beads and metal bells
that we used for threading games <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/17/for-whom-the-bells-toll/" target="_blank">before</a>. I think they make nicer sounds!

Anyway, that thing about being fascinated by the marble run, I guess it really runs in the family! Although the little guy doesn't really spend hours each time, he really had a blast!

It's amazing how such a simple game could make this kind of priceless expression...

[caption id="attachment_1303" align="aligncenter" width="115" caption="Priceless..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/156_marble_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1303" title="156_marble_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/156_marble_02.jpg?w=115" alt="Priceless..." width="115" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Since then, he had proceeded to try out putting the beads at different points (e.g. at level 2, 3, and so on). He had also tried putting his cars and trains there, hoping that they, too, would roll down... :S

And oh, does the marble run last, you ask?

Sadly, a few days later, the little guy decided to peel off one of the side rolls... &gt;_&lt; Geee! Seriously, if there is any manufacturing company out there that looks for anyone to help them test whether a product is sturdy enough, the little guy would be the right candidate!

But, no worries, daddy and his glue gun would fix it... ;)

Right, daddy? *<em>wink, wink</em>* It would be even better if you could turn it to <a href="http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=C_CDLBTJD4M" target="_blank">this</a>....:P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Walk the Talk</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/06/walk-the-talk/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Apr 2011 15:52:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1307</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One sunny afternoon and the little guy was playing with two horses and a car.

When he started banging one of the horses and shouted, "Please... please", never would I have suspected that he was teaching the horses a lesson.

[caption id="attachment_1310" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Whose Turn?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/157_horse_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1310" title="157_horse_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/157_horse_011.jpg?w=225" alt="Whose Turn?" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

A lesson on sharing, it was ... :)

The little guy was actually running a kind of show. There was only 1 car, so the two horses had to share the car. The horse that shouted "Please... please" was simply asking for its turn to ride the car. It also politely said "Thank you" after it finally got its turn.

Cute!

Let's just hope that this little preacher continues to practice what he preaches about sharing... :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>It Takes a Village...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/11/it-takes-a-village/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 11 Apr 2011 06:53:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1314</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[On certain days when the little guy tends to be very active, it takes a village to invite him to sit down and read some books... (so that his poor mommy could take a rest, too...hee hee)

[caption id="attachment_1315" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Private Storytelling for Husky"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/158_read_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1315" title="158_read_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/158_read_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Private Storytelling for Husky" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

No, I'm not joking.

It really takes a village ... of soft toys! Just take a look at the line of soft toys...

[caption id="attachment_1316" align="aligncenter" width="282" caption="(Actually) Public Storytelling"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/158_read_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1316" title="158_read_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/158_read_01.jpg?w=282" alt="(Actually) Public Storytelling" width="282" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I must say, though, that the above picture didn't really do the rest of the soft toys justice... :P I missed out those behind the green crocodile and the possum.

And, oh, by the way... it doesn't just take a village. It takes a mommy-made tent, too!]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Oh yeah, the little guy is <span style="text-decoration:underline;">still</span> into threading beads.

		<title>The Train of Thought</title>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After two years and four months...

[caption id="attachment_1327" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Very Long Trains"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/160_draw_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1327" title="160_draw_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/160_draw_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Very Long Trains" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

...thanks to the little guy, my drawing skill has much improved!

My previous drawing teachers would have been proud... :)

My current drawing teacher, aka the little guy, however, thinks there are still so much for me to learn so that I could draw longer trains, faster. And with the right number and the right kind of windows... &gt;_&lt;]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Making Tracks to a Peaceful Day</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/14/making-tracks-to-a-peaceful-day/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Apr 2011 05:27:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1332</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Picture this, and tell me who wouldn't like this.

One early morning, and you find that your little ones already know what they want to do for the day and they are determined to do it straight away. Yup, even when they are still in their PJs.

I know... what a joy! At least, you know you don't need to pull your hair finding things to keep your toddlers <span style="text-decoration:underline;">positively</span> busy.

That was exactly how I felt that morning when the little guy pointed at the pots of paint after he got up from his bed.

Slowly, he painted. Probably with his eyes half closed, too...

[caption id="attachment_1333" align="aligncenter" width="244" caption="The Sleeping Style"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1333" title="161_paint_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_01.jpg?w=244" alt="The Sleeping Style" width="244" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He got more excited with each stroke.

[caption id="attachment_1334" align="aligncenter" width="193" caption="More Awake Now..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1334" title="161_paint_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_02.jpg?w=193" alt="More Awake Now..." width="193" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He was happy. So was I.

It seemed to be such a perfect way to start a peaceful day...

That was until the little guy decided to be a little bit more creative... ^_^"

[caption id="attachment_1337" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_032.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1337" title="161_paint_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_032.jpg?w=300" alt="Stomp! Stomp! Stomp!" width="300" height="189" /></a>[/caption]

He must have thought that his feet needed some morning exercise... &gt;_&lt;
<div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter" style="text-align:left;"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1338 " title="161_paint_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/161_paint_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Ready to Leave Colorful Tracks" width="225" height="300" /></a></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">Ready to Leave Colorful Tracks</dd></dl></div>
He must have thought that his mommy needed some exercise too, i.e. by mopping the floor for the second time that morning... :P

Yeah, right... the perfect way to start a peaceful day!

Love it!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1332</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-04-14 13:27:31</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-04-14 05:27:31</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>making-tracks-to-a-peaceful-day</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<item>
		<title>A Measure of Fun</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/14/a-measure-of-fun/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 14 Apr 2011 05:47:27 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1342</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Check out what the little guy is into nowadays.

[caption id="attachment_1344" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Measuring His Dinosaur"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/162_measure_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1344" title="162_measure_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/162_measure_011.jpg?w=300" alt="Measuring His Dinosaur" width="300" height="198" /></a>[/caption]

Yes, measurement; be it with a ruler, my sewing measuring tape, or with his daddy's metal measuring tape.

He would measure almost anything.

[caption id="attachment_1345" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="Measuring His Bear"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/162_measure_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1345" title="162_measure_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/162_measure_02.jpg?w=198" alt="Measuring His Bear" width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The bigger, the better.

[caption id="attachment_1346" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Measuring cum Muscle-Stretching"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/162_measure_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1346" title="162_measure_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/162_measure_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Measuring cum Muscle-Stretching" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Not bad. While he got busy measuring, I could get things done in the kitchen... :)

I wonder why no one ever told me that the easy way to get dinners ready might include such tools!]]></content:encoded>
