		<item>
		<title>The Flying Dino</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/15/the-flying-dino/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 15 Apr 2011 15:53:25 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1351</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I've finally figured out what to do with <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/17/the-art-of-the-drummer/" target="_blank">one of the little guy's masterpieces</a>... :)

So, before it got accidentally thrown, I quickly went to find the picture of dinosaur that my husband drew for us months ago. Using that picture as a pattern, we soon had two dinosaurs ready to be cut... :)

[caption id="attachment_1352" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Ready to Cut"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1352" title="163_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Ready to Cut" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I did think of making more dinosaurs. Too bad the little guy took over the black marker and drew on the paper while I was busy cutting... &gt;_&lt; Unless we don't mind to have black dinosaurs, I guess we just had to accept this kind of cause for the extinction of the dinosaurs... :P Two dinosaurs are good enough.

After I finished cutting the dinosaurs, the little guy decided to run a puppet show.

[caption id="attachment_1353" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Talking Dinos"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1353" title="163_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Talking Dinos" width="300" height="196" /></a>[/caption]

He seemed to enjoy his own show so much that I didn't have the heart to continue with my plan. Obviously, he didn't know that his two dinosaurs would soon be glued into one... &gt;:P

I waited until he left the two dinosaurs alone before I glued the two dinosaurs on the cardboard that I had prepared.

And, finally... :)

[caption id="attachment_1354" align="aligncenter" width="229" caption="The One and Only of Its Kind"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1354 " title="163_dino_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_03.jpg?w=229" alt="The One and Only of Its Kind" width="229" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

There are actually two holes on the middle part of the cardboard. Those are meant for us to put our fingers in.

Here, let the little guy show you...

[caption id="attachment_1355" align="aligncenter" width="260" caption="Ready for the Walking Dino?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1355" title="163_dino_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_04.jpg?w=260" alt="Ready for the Walking Dino?" width="260" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We can then just wiggle our fingers inside, rocking the dinosaurs back and forth, so that it would look as if the dinosaur is walking.

But, of course, the little guy thought walking was not fun for the dinosaur at all.

Flying was much more fun!

[caption id="attachment_1357" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Here Comes Super-Dino!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_051.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1357" title="163_dino_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/163_dino_051.jpg?w=300" alt="Here Comes Super-Dino!" width="300" height="187" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1351</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-04-15 23:53:25</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-04-15 15:53:25</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>the-flying-dino</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_last</wp:meta_key>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Baa, Baa, Brown Goats]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>School of Fun Goes to the Farm!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/17/school-of-fun-goes-to-the-farm/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 16 Apr 2011 16:27:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1361</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One of the good things about getting involved in social activities - like in our case, with the choir group - is that, once in a while, we get to avoid from becoming a lazy bum on a Saturday.

So, this morning, though the comfortable bed tempted us to just continue sleeping, we pulled ourselves out of the bed. Surprisingly, it wasn't that difficult to wake the little guy up either. He must have sensed the exciting outing we were about to have!

It was sunny when we reached <a href="http://www.bollywoodveggies.com/" target="_blank">Bollywood Veggies Farm</a> at about 930 AM. Still, the hot scorching sun did not deter us from entering further.

[caption id="attachment_1362" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Welcoming (Real!) Lizard"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1362 " title="164_farm_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Welcoming (Real!) Lizard" width="300" height="206" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy got really excited seeing such huge space for him to run around and explore. Ah... there you go, another good thing about going there in a group: mommy and daddy got to rest, while someone else watched over the very active little guy... :P

[caption id="attachment_1363" align="aligncenter" width="212" caption="Victim no. 1"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1363" title="164_farm_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_02.jpg?w=212" alt="Victim no. 1" width="212" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

In short, the little guy really got to channel his rambunctious energy there...

[caption id="attachment_1365" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="Mastering the Free Run!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1365" title="164_farm_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_031.jpg?w=207" alt="Mastering the Free Run!" width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Just forget about getting him to learn anything about vegetables or plants. I only managed to get his attention when it came to showing him wild creatures that he doesn't get to see everyday.

Like this lizard...

[caption id="attachment_1366" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Hullo, Little Lizard!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1366" title="164_farm_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Hullo, Little Lizard!" width="300" height="192" /></a>[/caption]

... and this snail.

[caption id="attachment_1367" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Run, Snail, Run!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1367" title="164_farm_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_08.jpg?w=225" alt="Run, Snail, Run!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The only plant that managed to catch his attention was the mimosa, the one with the leaves that quickly close when touched.

[caption id="attachment_1368" align="aligncenter" width="203" caption="Touch and Close"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1368" title="164_farm_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_05.jpg?w=203" alt="Touch and Close" width="203" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

But then again, this plant wasn't something new to him. We often saw and "played" with this plant near where we stay back <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/10/31/at-home-with-bob-the-builders-team/" target="_blank">when the bob the builder's team hasn't taken away our precious field</a>... :'(

He also loved playing with the drops of water on the leaves after the heavy rain, but of course... there was no further attempt to learn anything else about the plants... :P

[caption id="attachment_1370" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Water Drops"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1370" title="164_farm_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_06.jpg?w=225" alt="The Water Drops" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We also visited <a href="http://www.haydairies.com.sg/" target="_blank">Hay Dairies Goat Farm</a> later in the afternoon, giving the little guy his first introduction to the animals called goats. Obviously, the little guy isn't as lucky as me who got to see goats nearly every day when I was his age. Back then, lines of goats paraded down the road in front of my house nearly every day. Although I am pretty sure I wouldn't find it amusing now, it was such an entertainment back then... :P

[caption id="attachment_1371" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Baa, Baa, Brown Goats"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1371" title="164_farm_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/164_farm_07.jpg?w=225" alt="Baa, Baa, Brown Goats" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And how did the little guy handle the first introduction to goats? Well, since the goats were pretty far away from him, he didn't get scared nor excited. He just happily sang "Baa, Baa, Black Sheep".

Uh oh... I think I have to fix this misconception soon! :P

Speaking about misconception, hey... I have just got to learn that one way to differentiate between a sheep and a goat, other than by the wool, is <a href="http://www.sheep101.info/sheepandgoats.html" target="_blank">by looking at the tail</a>... :)

So, at the end of the trip to the farms:

learning about farm animals - checked
learning about snails, lizards, ants, caterpillars, butterflies, etc. - checked
learning about mimosa - checked
learning about fruits, vegetables, herbs and spices plants - ....*<em>oops</em>*

Don't worry... there would certainly be another visit next time... ;)

And, oh by the way, one more thing:

feeding the mosquitoes - checked checked checked

&gt;_&lt;]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to be Quiet</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/18/the-little-guys-guide-to-be-quiet/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 18 Apr 2011 06:06:58 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1376</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I recently decided to make a cloth book for the little guy.

I desperately need something to keep the little guy occupied whenever we are at the church. Something that doesn't make much noise, of course... You see, cars usually work well... until he starts banging or crashing the cars... &gt;_&lt;

So, when I finally managed to complete this cloth book project, I got very excited. It was really hard for me to wait and keep quiet about it until Sunday came... :P

[caption id="attachment_1377" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Crumpled Cloth Book"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1377" title="165_book_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Crumpled Cloth Book" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I finally let him play with it on a Friday. It surely got his attention! You could surely tell how much that cloth book has endured by looking at how crumpled it is in the above picture... :P So glad it is made of cotton fabric, not paper! Otherwise, I could just forget about bringing it along on that Sunday... hee hee.

The first page comes with a kind of flower. The petals are colorful felt fabrics, with snap on buttons to open and close the petals. This usually keeps the little guy occupied for about a minute or two. Sometimes, he just doesn't have the patience to carefully place the buttons. Then he would take longer time to close all the petals... :)

[caption id="attachment_1378" align="aligncenter" width="260" caption="One Flower"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1378 " title="165_book_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_02.jpg?w=260" alt="One Flower" width="260" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The second page is very easy: building two ice cream cones. All the little guy needs to do is just placing the ice cream on top of the cones, and the ice cream cones are ready to be served. Too easy!

[caption id="attachment_1379" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Two Ice Cream Cones"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1379" title="165_book_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Two Ice Cream Cones" width="300" height="244" /></a>[/caption]

The third page is even easier: traffic light. Well, that is, as long as he gets the sequence of the light correctly... :)

[caption id="attachment_1380" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Three Lights"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1380" title="165_book_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Three Lights" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

The fourth page is, of course, his favorite. It has 4 cars lined on 4 threads. He can slide the cars left and right. He could easily spend the longest time in this page.

[caption id="attachment_1381" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Four Cars"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1381" title="165_book_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/165_book_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Four Cars" width="300" height="207" /></a>[/caption]

So, how did this cloth book score as a quiet hours toy?

The good news is ... the time he spends on it each time is almost as long as the time needed to make this cloth book. During that period, though not as quiet as a mouse, he would be such a wonderful boy at the church.

The not-so-good-news is ... it didn't take me long to make this book... &gt;_&lt;

Oh well, at least, the little guy still gets excited whenever I take this book out. Now if I could just figure out how to hide this book on other days so that it would still be exciting to him every Sunday... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1376</wp:post_id>

		<item>
		<title>166_bear_01</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/19/the-little-guys-guide-to-the-story-of-goldilocks/166_bear_01/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Apr 2011 06:09:52 +0000</pubDate>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to the Story of Goldilocks</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/19/the-little-guys-guide-to-the-story-of-goldilocks/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 19 Apr 2011 06:39:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1385</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is the story of Goldilocks.

Duh... what am I saying?! Of course this is not the story of Goldilocks. This is the story of the little guy re-enacting the story of Goldilocks and the three bears... :)

One day, the little guy came upon a house. The three bears, Papa Bear (aka Frosty Bear), Mama Bear (aka PeeWee Bear) and Baby Bear lived in this house. That morning, they were having their snack time.

Being polite, the little guy knocked and walked right in. He was certainly no Goldilocks who came in when no one was around.

[caption id="attachment_1386" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="At the Dining Table"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1386" title="166_bear_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_01.jpg?w=300" alt="At the Dining Table" width="300" height="190" /></a>[/caption]

Now, you see, Papa Bear was such a big bear, so he sat on a big chair. The second chair, which belonged to Mama Bear, was slightly smaller, but more comfortable. The biggest chair, however, had to be Baby Bear's. Otherwise, it would be kinda difficult for Baby Bear to reach the table... :P

Ah wait, let me put all the three bears to one side so that you could see the three chairs... :)

[caption id="attachment_1387" align="aligncenter" width="209" caption="The Bears and the Chairs"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1387" title="166_bear_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_05.jpg?w=209" alt="The Bears and the Chairs" width="209" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy didn't try all the chairs like Goldilocks. He straight away knew which chair to choose: the biggest and most colorful one! Hee heee...

Anyway, after learning about big-medium-small, we came to the part where Gold... oops... I mean, the little guy, would have to "try" the snack... with the bears' permissions, of course.

Papa Bear loves anything hot. He had a big glass of hot water. Not too hot, of course... we certainly didn't want anyone to get burnt, did we? :)

The little guy then dipped his right hand into the big glass.

[caption id="attachment_1388" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="It&#039;s Hot, Papa Bear!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1388" title="166_bear_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_02.jpg?w=300" alt="It's Hot, Papa Bear!" width="300" height="272" /></a>[/caption]

Mama Bear likes anything cold. She had a medium sized glass of iced water. With lots of ice cubes for the little guy to play...

[caption id="attachment_1389" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="It&#039;s Cold, Mama Bear!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1389" title="166_bear_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_03.jpg?w=300" alt="It's Cold, Mama Bear!" width="300" height="195" /></a>[/caption]

Baby Bear had the smallest glass, with room temperature water. But by the time it was his turn, the little guy had pulled all the other two glasses and lined them in front of him. The little guy happily dipped his right hand into all the glasses, one after the other.

[caption id="attachment_1390" align="aligncenter" width="238" caption="Hot... Cold... Just nice!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1390" title="166_bear_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/166_bear_04.jpg?w=238" alt="Hot... Cold... Just nice!" width="238" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And the story ended with puddles of water for mommy to clean... ^_^"

No, the little guy didn't need to run way into the forest. The three bears didn't chase him out. They went to take a nap with him instead... :)

What a story!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Little Guy&#039;s Guide to De-shelling Eggs</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/20/the-little-guys-guide-to-de-shelling-eggs/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 20 Apr 2011 05:50:16 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1393</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[A couple of days ago, our dinner menu included egg mayo salad.

The little guy kindly offered his help to de-shell the hard-boiled eggs... :P

[caption id="attachment_1394" align="aligncenter" width="214" caption="The First Step"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1394" title="167_egg_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_01.jpg?w=214" alt="The First Step" width="214" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Although I taught him to first tap the eggs on a hard surface, he still thought that his way was much more fun: breaking each egg into two. Surprisingly, each time he somehow managed to keep the yolk as round as a ball.

Next, since the eggs were already broken into two, I taught him how to "peel" the shells.

[caption id="attachment_1395" align="aligncenter" width="231" caption="The Second Step"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1395" title="167_egg_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_02.jpg?w=231" alt="The Second Step" width="231" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I was surprised he actually persevered! Hee hee... I thought he would stop after the first half.

Anyway, here is what we got:

[caption id="attachment_1396" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Well done!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1396" title="167_egg_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Well done!" width="300" height="258" /></a>[/caption]

Thankfully, the eggs were meant for egg mayo salad. The eggs were to be mashed anyway... :P

While I got busy mashing the eggs, the little guy occupied himself "mashing" the shells.

[caption id="attachment_1397" align="aligncenter" width="213" caption="Smashing Shells"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1397" title="167_egg_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/167_egg_04.jpg?w=213" alt="Smashing Shells" width="213" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Although he proved himself well, especially as a first-timer, this little kitchen assistant obviously did not come cheap. He charged me a big glass of grass jelly drink after the salad was ready... :P]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is just fun!

[caption id="attachment_1403" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Marble Painting Fun"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/168_easter_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1403" title="168_easter_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/168_easter_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Marble Painting Fun" width="300" height="205" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1402" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Crackin&#039; Fun!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/168_easter_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1402" title="168_easter_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/168_easter_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Crackin' Fun!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Can't believe I've been letting the little guy climb and stand on a chair! &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_1409" align="aligncenter" width="277" caption="What an Ear-to-Ear Grin!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/169_copter_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1409 " title="169_copter_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/169_copter_01.jpg?w=277" alt="What an Ear-to-Ear Grin!" width="277" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It's all because of this:

[caption id="attachment_1410" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Orange Culprit"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/169_copter_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1410" title="169_copter_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/169_copter_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Orange Culprit" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

... and this <a href="http://www.exploratorium.edu/science_explorer/roto-copter.html" target="_blank">Roto-Copter instruction</a>.

Wheeee... fly... ^o^]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is what I call teamwork at its best.

Daddy put his shirt on the laundry bin. Mommy washed and ironed the shirt.

And the little guy... helped to button the shirt.... :)

[caption id="attachment_1414" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Introduction to Button 101"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/170_shirt_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1414" title="170_shirt_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/170_shirt_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Introduction to Button 101" width="300" height="237" /></a>[/caption]

Psst... wanna know the little secret of how I managed to get him to do just that?

[caption id="attachment_1415" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Dino in a Shirt"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/170_shirt_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1415" title="170_shirt_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/170_shirt_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Dino in a Shirt" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Just get his favorite dinosaur involved... :P Hee hee...

Don't worry, daddy... the dinosaur is as clean as he could be...*<em>grinz</em>*]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Train vs. The Lion</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/25/the-train-vs-the-lion/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 25 Apr 2011 07:38:43 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="toilet-paper-roll"><![CDATA[Toilet Paper Roll]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1419</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Early this year, the little guy started to love lining his cars like a long train.

[caption id="attachment_1420" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Long, Long Train"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1420" title="171_train_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_01.jpg?w=225" alt="A Long, Long Train" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

All of a sudden, without me realizing it, this little guy, who used to only like cars and trucks, has added trains to his favorite toys.

We don't really have many trains at home. So, yup, go figure... the little guy just <em>has</em> to improvise.

[caption id="attachment_1421" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Still Loving His Truck..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1421" title="171_train_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Still Loving His Truck..." width="300" height="193" /></a>[/caption]

Then, I had this beautiful plan of making a train out of toilet paper rolls. Not just an immobile train. I want to make one with wheels that could go round and round... :P

I searched online and found this cool <a href="http://www.looledo.com/index.php/oatmeal-express.html" target="_blank">oatmeal express</a>. Impressive, but I think I'll go for something simpler.

So, I thought I would just modify <a href="http://www.looledo.com/index.php/simple-tp-dozer.html" target="_blank">this Simple TP Dozer instruction</a> to make a train.

At first, I was really excited! That time, the little guy was also on a painting spree. So, getting him to paint the toilet paper rolls wasn't a problem... :)

[caption id="attachment_1422" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Red"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1422" title="171_train_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Red" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1423" align="aligncenter" width="248" caption="Purple"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1423" title="171_train_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_04.jpg?w=248" alt="Purple" width="248" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

In fact, within that same day itself, we managed to paint 5 carriages for the train. Sweet!

[caption id="attachment_1424" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to Roll!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1424" title="171_train_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready to Roll!" width="300" height="182" /></a>[/caption]

Lots of mess to clean... but, beautiful... :)

[caption id="attachment_1425" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Lovely Colors!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1425" title="171_train_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Lovely Colors!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And guess what, ladies and gentlemen, three months have passed and I still haven't completed the train... ^_^"

I did manage to make one carriage - the green one. Yet, the combination of the difficulty in making the holes on the thick roll and the lack of the right tool simply put me off. The little guy had also managed to break it even before I got the chance to take a picture of it... :S

So, the four other rolls sat on my desk for the longest time.

One down... though only recently, when I decided to turn it into a lion to accompany our <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/01/22/little-bunny-foo-foo/" target="_blank">Little Bunny Foo Foo</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1426" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Lion and The Rabbit"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1426" title="171_train_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_07.jpg?w=225" alt="The Lion and The Rabbit" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy seemed to like it very much. For a couple of days, he would bring the lion and the rabbit inside his bag whenever we went for a walk.

It also seems that he would make a good storyteller, too... :)

[caption id="attachment_1428" align="aligncenter" width="222" caption="The Storyteller and His Props"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1428" title="171_train_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/171_train_08.jpg?w=222" alt="The Storyteller and His Props" width="222" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Now... if I could just figure out what other characters to make out of the other 3 rolls... ^_^]]></content:encoded>

				<wp:attachment_url>http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_07.jpg</wp:attachment_url>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_metadata</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"530";s:6:"height";s:3:"800";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:22:"height='96' width='63'";s:4:"file";s:89:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2011/04/172_forest_07.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1303207204";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:2:"80";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:5:"0.025";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[A Tree in Bloom]]></wp:meta_value>

							</item>
		<item>
		<title>One Happy Tree</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/29/one-happy-tree/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 28 Apr 2011 16:57:19 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1431</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Back when the little guy was into <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/05/when-you-wish-upon-a-star/" target="_blank">black</a>, one of the other activities that we did was this blow painting.

[caption id="attachment_1433" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Blow, blow...Pfft!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1433" title="172_forest_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Blow, blow...Pfft!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We did something similar <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/01/blow-blow-the-paint/" target="_blank">before</a>, but I thought it would be easier if we used a straw this time round. Yet, it was actually more difficult. Or maybe, we just didn't get the right consistency of the paint. Not watery enough, perhaps...

So, the little guy really needed a lot of help to make this one. We really had to make use of gravity to get the paint move. We held the paper upside down to make the "trunks". We only managed to blow for the "branches" and "twigs".

[caption id="attachment_1434" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="The Tree"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1434" title="172_forest_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_02.jpg?w=217" alt="The Tree" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We put it aside to dry and eventually, forgot all about it for weeks... :P

I only remembered about it when we had just finished our effervescent vitamin C. The lid just reminded me of the little guy's favorite stamps. So, I stuffed in some crumpled clear tapes and we were all ready to "stamp"... :)

[caption id="attachment_1435" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Introducing Brush #1"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1435" title="172_forest_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Introducing Brush #1" width="300" height="223" /></a>[/caption]

While the little guy loves the stamping part, I love the fun patterns the crumpled clear tapes made... :)

[caption id="attachment_1436" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="Let the Stamping Begin"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1436" title="172_forest_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_04.jpg?w=217" alt="Let the Stamping Begin" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I also prepared another "brush", a scouring pad.

[caption id="attachment_1437" align="aligncenter" width="233" caption="Introducing Brush #2"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1437" title="172_forest_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_05.jpg?w=233" alt="Introducing Brush #2" width="233" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

... and we got more fun patterns (look at the orange ones!) for our tree... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1438" align="aligncenter" width="231" caption="Just Keep Stamping!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1438" title="172_forest_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_06.jpg?w=231" alt="Just Keep Stamping!" width="231" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And here's what we got:

[caption id="attachment_1439" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="A Tree in Bloom"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1439" title="172_forest_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/04/172_forest_07.jpg?w=198" alt="A Tree in Bloom" width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

One happy tree... :)

I'll share about what we used this painting for in another post next time... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>School of Fun Goes to the Beach</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/01/school-of-fun-goes-to-the-beach/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 01 May 2011 08:21:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1442</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When it was raining heavily on a Saturday morning, we thought the weather would be just nice in the afternoon... :) So, we got our bags ready and went to the beach.

I suppose we were quite right about the weather. It was, however, a bit too sunny to handle after a while. With the little guy around, we simply had so many things that we could do at the beach. And guess what, we brought almost everything that we needed, except one: sunblock... &gt;_&lt;

Oh well... let's just hope a little sunburn wouldn't hurt... :)

Let's just take a look at what we managed to accomplish there... ;)

<strong>1. Chasing the waves and getting wet</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1443" align="aligncenter" width="223" caption="Again, Daddy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/174_beach_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1443" title="174_beach_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/174_beach_01.jpg?w=223" alt="Again, Daddy!" width="223" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Okie... I think that probably also includes building some muscles for the little guy's daddy... :P

<strong>2. Counting Ships</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1445" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="One, Two, Three..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/174_beach_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1445" title="174_beach_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/174_beach_021.jpg?w=225" alt="One, Two, Three..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Okie, not really... there were more boats than ships to count. Both made the little guy excited anyway... :) They could even make him sit quietly like a mermaid for some time. Hee heee... &gt;:P

<strong>3. Sand Play</strong>

Going to the beach just wouldn't be complete without playing with the sand. We bought some sand molds as well as a plastic watering can. Just the perfect combination!

[caption id="attachment_1447" align="aligncenter" width="231" caption="The Busy Builder"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/174_beach_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1447" title="174_beach_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/174_beach_03.jpg?w=231" alt="The Busy Builder" width="231" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Seriously, we could have spent longer time at the beach if only the sun wasn't that fierce!

We certainly look forward to another trip to the beach... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1442</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-05-01 16:21:37</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-05-01 08:21:37</wp:post_date_gmt>

		<item>
		<title>It&#039;s a Dino-sock!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/03/its-a-dino-sock/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 03 May 2011 06:56:11 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1452</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This is usually what happens when daddy is at home for the day:

Mommy gets the chance to use her needles and work her magic to make a dinosaur out of an old pair of socks... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1453" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Hello, Dino!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/175_dino_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1453" title="175_dino_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/175_dino_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Hello, Dino!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

So, did the dino survive the little guy's itchy hands?

[caption id="attachment_1454" align="aligncenter" width="196" caption="Meet the Itchy Hands!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/175_dino_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1454" title="175_dino_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/175_dino_02.jpg?w=196" alt="Meet the Itchy Hands!" width="196" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, it came through unscathed! *<em>impressed with my own sewing skills</em>... :P*]]></content:encoded>

		<title>Once Upon a Tree</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/03/once-upon-a-tree/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 03 May 2011 07:27:36 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="box"><![CDATA[Box]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="stickers"><![CDATA[Stickers]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1457</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Remember this <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/29/one-happy-tree/" target="_blank">one happy tree</a>?

[caption id="attachment_1458" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Getting the Props Ready"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/176_theatre_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1458" title="176_theatre_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/176_theatre_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Getting the Props Ready" width="300" height="210" /></a>[/caption]

This is what we use the tree for... :) A backdrop for our storytelling session!

[caption id="attachment_1459" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Story of the Monkey and the Snake"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/176_theatre_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1459" title="176_theatre_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/176_theatre_02.jpg?w=225" alt="The Story of the Monkey and the Snake" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We only need to insert the picture into an old cardboard box and stick some cute stickers on some thin, long cards (we used the leftover after we cut the opening on the cardboard box).

Easy peasy and fun!]]></content:encoded>

		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[One fine morning... when the little guy decided to wake up much later than usual...

[caption id="attachment_1464" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Mommy Got Her Playtime"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/177_food_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1464" title="177_food_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/177_food_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Mommy Got Her Playtime" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad the little guy seemed to have a built-in sensor. He woke up the moment I took a picture of the first batch. And that, obviously, ended the playtime... :P

But then again, he still looked sleepy, didn't he?! Hee hee..

[caption id="attachment_1465" align="aligncenter" width="216" caption="A Very Big Yawn"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/177_food_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1465" title="177_food_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/177_food_02.jpg?w=216" alt="A Very Big Yawn" width="216" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Gee... I should have just continued... &gt;:P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Befriending the Sun</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/06/befriending-the-sun/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 06 May 2011 11:11:32 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1468</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Yup, that's a camera he's holding.

[caption id="attachment_1469" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Not Going to Take any Picture!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/178_light_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1469" title="178_light_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/178_light_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Not Going to Take any Picture!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

But, nope, he wasn't just playing with the camera.

He was playing with the sunlight reflection... :P

[caption id="attachment_1470" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Reflection on the Ceiling"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/178_light_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1470" title="178_light_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/178_light_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Reflection on the Ceiling" width="300" height="207" /></a>[/caption]

That is one great way, albeit simple, to distract a toddler who would otherwise keep begging you to bring him down to the playground when the sun is scorching hot!

Trust me, I'm speaking from my experience... :P]]></content:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"800";s:6:"height";s:3:"600";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='96' width='128'";s:4:"file";s:87:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2011/05/179_boat_02.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1303405410";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:3:"800";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:5:"0.008";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<item>
		<title>We Saw a Ship a-sailing!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/08/we-saw-a-ship-a-sailing/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 07 May 2011 18:01:05 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paper-plate"><![CDATA[Paper Plate]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1473</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy was recently into boats and ships. So far, we only have one small boat for him to play with. He would play with it every now and then... He would even bring it along when he was about to take a nap... &gt;_&lt;

Interestingly, he also kept asking to do the boat puzzle! For once, the train puzzle, which he used to solve first before moving to other jigsaw puzzles, seemed to be forgotten...

This certainly called for another boat to be made!

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>paint</li>
	<li>paintbrush</li>
	<li>paper plate</li>
	<li>drawing paper</li>
	<li>black marker</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

First, I cut a long slit... err, maybe I shouldn't really call it a slit... I actually made it wavy, instead of straight, since I really wanted it to look like waves.

[caption id="attachment_1474" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Not Really a Slit"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1474" title="179_boat_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Not Really a Slit" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

The next step required my little painter to paint the ocean and the sky... :)

[caption id="attachment_1475" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Blue Ocean"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1475" title="179_boat_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Blue Ocean " width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

See how I folded the paper plate? Obviously, it was hard to convince the little guy to leave the "sky" away from that blue paint... :P Just see that tint of blue on the "sky" in the picture below!

[caption id="attachment_1476" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Sky and the Ocean"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1476" title="179_boat_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_03.jpg?w=300" alt="The Sky and the Ocean" width="300" height="232" /></a>[/caption]

We didn't stop painting there. The little guy asked for the green paint and smudged it on the "ocean". He also painted his feet green to stamp on a drawing paper... :S I must admit that, ever since we did our <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/11/the-little-guy…project-runway/" target="_blank">project runway</a>, the little guy considers this feet painting a must-do before we end our painting session.

[caption id="attachment_1479" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Flexibility is Key!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1479" title="179_boat_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Flexibility is Key!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Anyway, while he was busy painting his feet, I drew a boat on one of his <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/23/happy-easter/" target="_blank">marble painting artworks</a>.  After cutting it out, I pasted it on a small bookmark which we got during the Singapore 2010 Youth Olympic Games. Initially, I wanted to paste it on a ice cream stick. Too bad, I somehow couldn't find that stick... :S

[caption id="attachment_1480" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Boat"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1480" title="179_boat_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_05.jpg?w=225" alt="The Boat" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And finally...

[caption id="attachment_1481" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Boat on the Water"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1481" title="179_boat_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_06.jpg?w=300" alt="A Boat on the Water" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

... off we went sailing! :)

<em>I saw a ship a-sailing,</em>
<em>A-sailing on the sea.</em>
<em>And, oh, but it was laden</em>
<em>With pretty things for thee.</em>

It turned out that the size of the hole was just perfect for the little guy's finger. This paper boat could go up and down, left and right as the little guy pull the bookmark using his finger.

If you're thinking of making something similar, you might want to stick some clear tapes on the left and right sides of the long slit. Especially if you have a rough toddler like the little guy... :P My strong little guy tore one of the sides on his first attempt to operate his boat... :S

And oh, speaking about boats, did you know that if you put a small drop of liquid soap in the hole of a bread tag, you could turn your bread tag into a little speedboat? Go on, give <a href="http://sciencesquad.questacon.edu.au/activities/soap_powered_boat.html" target="_blank">it</a> a try! ;)

[caption id="attachment_1482" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Hooray for Bread Tag Speedboats!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1482" title="179_boat_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/179_boat_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Hooray for Bread Tag Speedboats!" width="300" height="222" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1473</wp:post_id>

		<item>
		<title>Journey to the Past</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/09/journey-to-the-past/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2011 06:58:37 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1486</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[If you ever run out of ideas of what to do with your restless toddler, you might want to consider bringing them to a nursing home.

Yes, I wasn't joking. A nursing home, indeed!

You'll be surprised by how well your toddlers and the residents there could entertain each other. At least, I was pleasantly surprised during our last visit... :)

[caption id="attachment_1487" align="aligncenter" width="244" caption="Playing Connect Four"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/180_old_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1487" title="180_old_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/180_old_01.jpg?w=244" alt="Playing Connect Four" width="244" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Perhaps it was because it wasn't our first visit and the little guy has finally felt at ease with the people there. Or perhaps that Connect Four game helped them...

Whichever the reason is, I'm just glad they both enjoyed themselves... :)

And oh, by the way, here's a little treat for the little guy at the end of the day: he got to push the wheelchair around... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1488" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="Fun Ride"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/180_old_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1488" title="180_old_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/180_old_02.jpg?w=207" alt="Fun Ride" width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Oh yeah, he loves it!

Thankfully, he was very careful, too. So, I guess, the lady was just as happy as the little guy was... ;)

Wait a minute... that wasn't all. There was a little bonus, too!

The little guy got the chance to admire the fish tank. With up close view!

[caption id="attachment_1489" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Here, Fishy!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/180_old_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1489" title="180_old_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/180_old_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Here, Fishy!" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

What a trip! :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Yellow Container</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/09/the-yellow-container/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2011 07:03:50 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Dress Up]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="dress-up"><![CDATA[Dress Up]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1492</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I just knew it!

I knew that container would come handy. And I knew that yellow is just the perfect color to choose! *<em>grinz</em>*

Look who's been playing with that yellow container these days... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1493" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Back-to-School Attire"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/181_helmet_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1493" title="181_helmet_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/181_helmet_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Back-to-School Attire" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1494" align="aligncenter" width="169" caption="Bob the Builder: Yes, We Can!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/181_helmet_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1494" title="181_helmet_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/181_helmet_02.jpg?w=169" alt="Bob the Builder: Yes, We Can!" width="169" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Falling Fish</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/09/the-falling-fish/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 09 May 2011 07:43:24 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Straw]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="straw"><![CDATA[Straw]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1498</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I'd been wanting to try making this <a href="http://madebyjoel.com/2011/03/blow-fish-toy.html" target="_blank">blow fish toy</a> ever since I saw it.

[caption id="attachment_1499" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Little Propeller that Could"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1499" title="182_fish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Little Propeller that Could" width="300" height="261" /></a>[/caption]

Yet, when we finally managed to make our own fish, somehow neither of us could make the fish move by blowing... :P We could only move the fish by pushing and pulling it along the line. Probably the combination of the wrong straw (we used a big straw) and the wrong kind of string (we used a thick yarn) just makes our fish sluggish.

Still, the little guy loves it. So, I decided to put one end higher. That way, we could just leave it to the gravity to make the fish zoom down the line... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1500" align="aligncenter" width="199" caption="Dive in, Fish!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1500" title="182_fish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_02.jpg?w=199" alt="Dive in, Fish!" width="199" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

It was also just a matter of time to see another favorite thing of his being added to the line.

[caption id="attachment_1501" align="aligncenter" width="273" caption="Choo...Choo..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1501" title="182_fish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_03.jpg?w=273" alt="Choo...Choo..." width="273" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Very simple to make, yet very fun to play with... :)

Sadly, while no fish was harmed during this game, I must admit that my wall became a victim as soon as we started playing... :(

[caption id="attachment_1502" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Our Poor Wall"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1502 " title="182_fish_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/182_fish_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Our Poor Wall" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Obviously, the little guy thought he was so light that the yarn could sustain his weight as he jumped around... :P He must have thought that yarn was a kind of jumping rope... &gt;_&lt;

I should be more careful next time... ^_^"]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Stamping Out the Heat</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/12/stamping-out-the-heat/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2011 09:45:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Blocks]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="blocks"><![CDATA[Blocks]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1509</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As the weather gets too hot, it just gets difficult to think of anything fancy to do with the little guy. Well, except water play, of course... but that shall be in another post... :)

So, when the little guy asked to paint, I just handed him a paint brush and 2 bottles of paint.

I sat next to him, but honestly, at first I didn't really feel like painting... :P I was just there to make sure he didn't paint anything that he shouldn't... hee hee...

And guess what he wanted to paint?

Come on, give it a try. It isn't that hard to guess...

Well, his feet, of course! ^_^"

[caption id="attachment_1510" align="aligncenter" width="196" caption="Still Loving It!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1510" title="184_megablok_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_04.jpg?w=196" alt="Still Loving It!" width="196" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Nowadays, it's kinda difficult to find an artwork of his that doesn't have any footprints... :P

Since there were some <a href="http://www.megabrands.com/" target="_blank">Mega Bloks</a> lying around, I just quickly grabbed one of them and showed the little guy how to paint and stamp it on the paper.

Ha! Certainly the quickest way to stop him from painting his feet! :P

[caption id="attachment_1511" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Painting the Blocks"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1511" title="184_megablok_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Painting the Blocks" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1512" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="...and Stamping"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1512" title="184_megablok_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_02.jpg?w=225" alt="...and Stamping" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I was glad he wasn't painting his feet and making a mess (which was something I didn't look forward to in this hot weather!), while the little guy was happy he could still stamping something... Perfect!

And we all got to admire something cool... :P

[caption id="attachment_1513" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Something Cool"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1513" title="184_megablok_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/184_megablok_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Something Cool" width="300" height="206" /></a>[/caption]

Yup, it turned out to be a cool thing to do in the hot weather after all.

But, seriously, if somebody could just pass me the thermostat... It's getting atrociously hot here... :S]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Magic Pillow Ride</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/12/magic-pillow-ride/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 12 May 2011 10:05:17 +0000</pubDate>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1518</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Introducing the latest version of magic carpet ride...

[caption id="attachment_1519" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Daddy-powered Pillow Ride"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/185_pillow_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1519" title="185_pillow_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/185_pillow_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Daddy-powered Pillow Ride" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

A very exciting ride ... and we don't even need to call the genie! *<em>grinz</em>*]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Plainly Egg-citing!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/13/plainly-egg-citing/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 13 May 2011 05:59:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Plastic Egg]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="plastic-egg"><![CDATA[Plastic Egg]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1525</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Last Easter, we've got ourselves quite a number of colorful plastic eggs... :)

With so many colorful eggs, the possibilities are just endless!

For example, in our house, a horse could crack out of an egg... :P *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1526" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="An Orange for an Orange"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1526" title="186_egg_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_01.jpg?w=300" alt="An Orange for an Orange" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Sometimes we also put magnetic letters into the eggs for the little guy to open and name the letter.

[caption id="attachment_1527" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="C for Caterpillar"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1527" title="186_egg_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_02.jpg?w=300" alt="C for Caterpillar" width="300" height="200" /></a>[/caption]

And here's the little guy's favorite: stacking up the shells... :D

[caption id="attachment_1528" align="aligncenter" width="245" caption="Higher and Higher"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1528" title="186_egg_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_03.jpg?w=245" alt="Higher and Higher" width="245" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

... and shrieking happily when the tower tumbles.

[caption id="attachment_1529" align="aligncenter" width="221" caption="And It Fell Down!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1529 " title="186_egg_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_04.jpg?w=221" alt="And It Fell Down!" width="221" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And oh, he loves lining them, too! :)

Not just lining them up randomly, though... He seems to follow a certain pattern. He barked at me when I tried to replace one of them... Tsk tsk tsk... so much for thinking that he still doesn't know much about color!

[caption id="attachment_1530" align="aligncenter" width="223" caption="A Long Line"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1530" title="186_egg_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/186_egg_05.jpg?w=223" alt="A Long Line" width="223" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hmm... wonder what else we could do with these eggs... :D]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_key>_wp_attachment_image_alt</wp:meta_key>
		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[Yumm-O!]]></wp:meta_value>
		</wp:postmeta>
							</item>
		<item>
		<title>A Cake Story</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/17/a-cake-story/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 16 May 2011 17:15:23 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Food]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="food"><![CDATA[Food]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1533</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[This was what happened when the little guy refused to take a nap when his mommy was dying to try out a recipe: the little guy got to bake a butter cake! :)

It was kinda difficult at first. I would say it took me longer to complete the whole thing.

More mess to clean up was inevitable. No one else was around at home. Otherwise, I could have had an extra pair of eyes to watch what the little guy was doing and prevent any spill.

The little guy also enjoyed the whole experience. So, for certain things, I decided to just let him play for a little longer.

But, overall, it wasn't a recipe for disaster to get him involved... ;) We both had fun!

So, what exactly did he get to do?

1. <strong>Measurement</strong>

This part was the reason why I said "it was kinda difficult at first". I had to do this part, yet at the same time, I had to make sure the little guy didn't add anything to what I'd measured.  And yup, I also had to make sure he didn't throw or spill anything... :P

He was already very excited by then. So, to keep him away from my butter and flour, I let him measure the raisins. Obviously not the main ingredients... so I really didn't mind if he didn't put enough... :P And even if he put more than enough, I certainly wouldn't object either. The more, the merrier....;) *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1535" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Yummy Raisins!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1535" title="187_cake_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Yummy Raisins!" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

He also helped me mixing the raisins with some flour... :)

[caption id="attachment_1536" align="aligncenter" width="201" caption="A Serious Mixing"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1536" title="187_cake_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_02.jpg?w=201" alt="A Serious Mixing" width="201" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

<strong>2. Preparing the Tin</strong>

After I greased the tin, I let him do the flouring part.

[caption id="attachment_1537" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Flour Splattering in Progress..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1537" title="187_cake_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Flour Splattering in Progress..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He must have thought the tin was a kind of drum... :P He kept tapping the tin and giggled!

<strong>3. Sifting the Flour</strong>

I know, I know... Everything about it spells messy.

[caption id="attachment_1538" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Writing on the Flour"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1538" title="187_cake_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Writing on the Flour" width="300" height="228" /></a>[/caption]

Although it was easy to see that he enjoyed playing with the flour very much, it wasn't that great an idea to actually let him do this part. Hey, I did try to minimize the mess... I laid down newspaper underneath. So, everything seemed to be under control at first... :P

Then I went to put the flour ... lo and behold, somebody tried to be helpful! The little guy followed behind me, pulling the newspaper with him... :P

Yup, we've got flour ...all over the floor!  &gt;_&lt;

<strong>4. Mixing</strong>

Ah, the joy when we finally reached this part!

[caption id="attachment_1539" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Are We There Yet?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1539" title="187_cake_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Are We There Yet?" width="300" height="216" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy loved it when I held his hand along with the mixer. He also loved to play with the spatula... thankfully, he didn't think of flicking a spatula full of the cake batter... :P

<strong>5. Cleaning Up</strong>

Yayy.. almost done!

[caption id="attachment_1540" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="And the Dish Ran Away with the Spoon..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1540" title="187_cake_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_06.jpg?w=300" alt="And the Dish Ran Away with the Spoon..." width="300" height="233" /></a>[/caption]

He actually helped me with the dishes! :')

And, finally... our big reward... tadaaa... ^o^

[caption id="attachment_1543" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Yumm-O!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_072.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1543" title="187_cake_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_072.jpg?w=300" alt="Yumm-O!" width="300" height="209" /></a>[/caption]

Hmmm... I think it calls for a tea time party! :D

Right, Dino? ;)

[caption id="attachment_1548" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Too Busy to Answer..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1548" title="187_cake_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/187_cake_08.jpg?w=225" alt="Too Busy to Answer..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
