		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1550</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[<p>Something that used to be cute now begins to irk me. </p><p>Remember how the little guy loves to <a target="_blank" href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/03/02/the-magnet-dino/">hide his dinosaurs inside the rice box</a>? Well, he also likes to hide his alphabets, only to dig and search for them later on, flicking rice grains all over the floor... &gt;_&lt;</p><p> You see, I don't mind if he plays with the rice grains. But throwing rice grains is a BIG NO-NO. In fact, I find it rude to waste food. </p><p>Lecturing the little guy doesn't seem to show any result so far. So, to appease both of us, I lend him a small ice cube tray and a plastic spoon. </p><div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/188_rice_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1552" title="188_rice_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/188_rice_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Each a Spoonful" width="300" height="225"></a><br></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">Each a Spoonful</dd></dl></div><div class="mceTemp mceIEcenter"><dl class="wp-caption aligncenter"><dt class="wp-caption-dt"><a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/188_rice_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1553" title="188_rice_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/188_rice_02.jpg?w=300" alt="... and Ready for Replay" width="300" height="221"></a><br></dt><dd class="wp-caption-dd">... and Ready for Replay</dd></dl></div><p>There you go... as long as he keeps his hands inside the box, I could expect no more wasted grain. </p><p>Let's just hope he won't get bored too soon... ^_^"<br></p>]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"800";s:6:"height";s:3:"473";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='75' width='128'";s:4:"file";s:86:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2011/05/191_pig_02.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1305630185";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:3:"400";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:4:"0.04";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<item>
		<title>This Little Piggy</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/18/this-little-piggy/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 18 May 2011 14:51:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="cardboard"><![CDATA[Cardboard]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Finger Prints]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="finger-prints"><![CDATA[Finger Prints]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1567</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Remember how the little guy seems to love painting his own feet and sometimes his hands, too?

Well, surprisingly, he seemed to object when I drew on his thumb... :P

But, of course, he quickly changed his mind when he figured out what I actually wanted to do...

[caption id="attachment_1568" align="aligncenter" width="245" caption="This Little Piggy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/191_pig_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1568" title="191_pig_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/191_pig_01.jpg?w=245" alt="This Little Piggy" width="245" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We were inspired by this <a href="http://www.busybeekidscrafts.com/Pig-Finger-Puppet.html" target="_blank">Pig Finger Puppet</a>. Cute, eh? :)

I also made another one... not sure whether I should call it a cow or a hippo. It doesn't look like any of them either ... &gt;_&lt;

Still, they are cute. Just look at how they pose as they're waiting for stories to act on... ;)

[caption id="attachment_1569" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Got a Story?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/191_pig_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1569" title="191_pig_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/191_pig_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Got a Story?" width="300" height="177" /></a>[/caption]

I think we should make more!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Cook Together, Stay Together</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/22/cook-together-stay-together/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 22 May 2011 08:40:21 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Food]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="food"><![CDATA[Food]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1572</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I once saw a tagline that goes "A family that cooks together stays together". It may just be another version of "A family that prays together stays together". Still, I think it was worth trying.

[caption id="attachment_1573" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Cookie Cutting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/192_cookie_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1573" title="192_cookie_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/192_cookie_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Cookie Cutting" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And true enough, at least for that very few minutes, all three of us stayed around the dining table as we baked our own cookies... :) *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1574" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Part where He Ran Away"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/192_cookie_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1574 " title="192_cookie_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/192_cookie_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Part where He Ran Away" width="300" height="154" /></a>[/caption]

It could be longer, if only we didn't finish the cookies in such a short time... :P

[caption id="attachment_1575" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Happily Munching His &quot;Boats&quot;"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/192_cookie_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1575" title="192_cookie_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/192_cookie_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Happily Munching His &quot;Boats&quot;" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

While the little guy might still be too young to have that sense of accomplishment, I must admit that I've learned a lot after these cooking together episodes. I learn to stop being too much of a mommy that interferes as the little guy tries to figure out things himself, with his own ways. Yup, interference is futile... :P And that also means that I get to learn to let go and not to clean compulsively all the time.

My goodness... I think I even learn to enjoy the mess!!!]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Come Rain or Shine</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/25/come-rain-or-shine/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 25 May 2011 08:19:26 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1579</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I used to think erratic weather only harms the wildlife. Or at most, various harvest products. Yet, spending 24 hours a day with a toddler at home makes me realize that erratic weather also does affect the life of a toddler... :P

It upsets him when he couldn't go to the playground when the urge strikes. And to think that this urge often strikes <span style="text-decoration:underline;">exactly</span> at the wrong time, e.g. when it's raining cats and dogs or when the sun is scorching hot, I really should devise a plan to avoid a meltdown and keep my sanity intact... ^_^"

Since late last month, I find that keeping a box of ice cubes in the freezer helps, especially if <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/02/25/a-fish-tale/" target="_blank">they are in the shape of a fish</a>... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1581" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Fish and the Ring"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1581" title="193_fish_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Fish and the Ring" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I don't bother to put food coloring anymore, though... Just to make the aftermath slightly less messy. Hee hee... :P

Unfortunately, without the food coloring, it is kinda difficult to see the fish the moment we put it in the tub. Thankfully, we have some colorful plastic rings to put on each cube.

The little guy could spend more than half an hour catching fish. It could be more if only I let him... He would use his hands or a strainer.

The plastic rings also allow him to use chopsticks to catch the fish. Another venue for him to practice his chopstick skill... :)

[caption id="attachment_1582" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Daddy Got the Fish!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1582" title="193_fish_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Daddy Got the Fish!" width="300" height="263" /></a>[/caption]

Of course, during this hot weather, our fish supply runs out pretty fast. We usually then continue to enjoy our water play using some cups and containers.

[caption id="attachment_1583" align="aligncenter" width="192" caption="Just Keep Filling!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1583" title="193_fish_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_03.jpg?w=192" alt="Just Keep Filling!" width="192" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We really love that long neck plastic bottle. The little guy is at the stage where he loves seeing the bubbles that are formed when he pours the water into that bottle. The bubbles pop very quickly, yet he would giggle for long enough!

He would giggle even longer when I place some rings inside... :P

[caption id="attachment_1584" align="aligncenter" width="232" caption="Bubble, Bubble... Do you see my rings?"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1584" title="193_fish_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/193_fish_04.jpg?w=232" alt="Bubble, Bubble... Do you see my rings?" width="232" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Ah, the joy is indeed in the simple things!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Brown Button Caterpillar</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/30/the-brown-button-caterpillar/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 May 2011 06:49:53 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1588</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As the little guy gets older, I feel more comfortable leaving him with a brush and bottles of paint.

[caption id="attachment_1589" align="aligncenter" width="218" caption="Hum while You Paint"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1589" title="194_caterpillar_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_01.jpg?w=218" alt="Hum while You Paint" width="218" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Every now and then, he would ask me to help him open the bottle (when the lid is stuck, otherwise he would open it himself) and start painting. Most of the time, I can't really tell what he's painting, though he seems to try to explain as he goes along... (yup, he still speaks gibberish, and sometimes sings, as he draws... :P)

They all look abstract to me. Just take a look yourself.

[caption id="attachment_1591" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Abstract #1"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1591" title="194_caterpillar_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Abstract #1" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1592" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Abstract #2"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1592" title="194_caterpillar_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Abstract #2" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1593" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Abstract #3"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_07.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1593" title="194_caterpillar_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_07.jpg?w=300" alt="Abstract #3" width="300" height="207" /></a>[/caption]

But, hey... this painting is an exception!

[caption id="attachment_1590" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="His Very Hungry Caterpillar"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1590" title="194_caterpillar_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_02.jpg?w=300" alt="His Very Hungry Caterpillar" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It's his very own version of <a href="http://www.eric-carle.com/home.html" target="_blank">Eric Carle</a>'s <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/The_Very_Hungry_Caterpillar" target="_blank">The Very Hungry Caterpillar</a>!

While the resemblance is probably pure coincidence (I'm not even sure if the little guy would even agree!), I love the feeling of finally figuring out what he painted... hee hee... :p

So, to celebrate, I made him his very own hungry caterpillar to play with. *<em>grinz</em>* A reddish brown button for the head and a long green ribbon for the body... There you go, his caterpillar is ready to "eat" all the felt fruits, just like in the story. In fact, I used similar shape and the same numbers of fruits for each kind of fruit.

[caption id="attachment_1594" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Very Full Caterpillar"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1594" title="194_caterpillar_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_03.jpg?w=300" alt="A Very Full Caterpillar" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

He seems to enjoy putting in all 15 felt fruits one by one. Bwahaha... bet he didn't realize that it was part of the tricks to get him to practice buttoning!

[caption id="attachment_1595" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Gobbling the Plum"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1595" title="194_caterpillar_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/194_caterpillar_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Gobbling the Plum" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

I also had the chance to let a 4-year-old try and this caterpillar seemed to work wonders in keeping him quietly occupied. Whoohoo... I guess the little guy wouldn't outgrow this caterpillar anytime soon then. Now that is what I call a good investment!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Unfinished Business</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/30/the-unfinished-business/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 30 May 2011 07:04:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="soft-toy"><![CDATA[Soft Toy]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1599</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I haven't quite finished sewing this dog, which I made from an old pair of socks.

[caption id="attachment_1600" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Unfinished Business"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/195_dog_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1600" title="195_dog_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/195_dog_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Unfinished Business" width="300" height="189" /></a>[/caption]

There are still a gap near its tail to seal and four feet to sew.

I stopped sewing after seeing that it didn't look as cute as it should be. It didn't even look like a dog... &gt;_&lt;

But somebody has recently lifted up my spirit... :)

[caption id="attachment_1601" align="aligncenter" width="198" caption="Best Friends"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/195_dog_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1601" title="195_dog_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/195_dog_02.jpg?w=198" alt="Best Friends" width="198" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy has been playing with it pretty often after he snatched it from my sewing table that day. And each time he holds it, he would make that "woof... woof" sound and tell me, "mommy... look! Look! Doggy!".

I haven't even told him that it was supposed to be a dog! So, I guess it does look like a dog, somehow!

Gee, maybe I really should get it done quickly... :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Oeey-Goeey Fun</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/31/oeey-goeey-fun/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 31 May 2011 14:41:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1611</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy really <em>is</em> into cutting. He's been using his own kid's scissors, as well as my scissors... &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_1612" align="aligncenter" width="182" caption="His Latest Craze"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1612" title="197_cut_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_01.jpg?w=182" alt="His Latest Craze" width="182" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Obviously, the kid's scissors easily frustrate him as it isn't that easy to cut using that pair of scissors. There's nothing wrong with the scissors. I believe that is for safety reason.

Anyway, I thought I should make full use of his craze. So, I got him to cut small pieces of aluminium foil.

[caption id="attachment_1613" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Something Sparkling to Cut"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1613" title="197_cut_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Something Sparkling to Cut" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Those pieces make great glitters to put in our simpler version of <a href="http://www.stevespanglerscience.com/experiment/00000035" target="_blank">lava lamp</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1614" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Oil vs. Water"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1614" title="197_cut_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Oil vs. Water" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

It's the "simpler version" of lava lamp since we didn't use any Alka-Seltzer tablet. Hence, there is no floating bubble to watch.

Still, I think the little guy was pretty impressed. Ha! :P

[caption id="attachment_1615" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Blobs"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1615" title="197_cut_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/05/197_cut_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Blobs" width="300" height="190" /></a>[/caption]

He found it cool to scribble on it using his fingers, too! :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>(Once Again) At the Beach</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/02/once-again-at-the-beach/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Jun 2011 04:06:47 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1624</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We had just spent another day at the beach last week. We thought it would be great to visit Siloso beach on a weekday before the school holiday kicked in.

And yup, we were right. It felt like having the beach for ourselves!

[caption id="attachment_1628" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="A Very Private Beach"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/199_beach_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1628" title="199_beach_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/199_beach_011.jpg?w=300" alt="A Very Private Beach" width="300" height="209" /></a>[/caption]

Hm... come to think of it, maybe it actually had nothing to do with whether it was school holiday or not. It was atrociously hot that day. So, I guess everyone else, except us, was wise enough to stay away from the beach... ^_^"

Oh well, we did have a great time anyway.

Where was the little guy, you ask?

He was busy playing with the shadows and sand, while tailing his dear uncle.

[caption id="attachment_1626" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Catching Shadow, Kicking Up Sand"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/199_beach_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1626 " title="199_beach_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/199_beach_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Catching Shadow, Kicking Up Sand" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Dawn of Technology</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/02/the-dawn-of-technology/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 02 Jun 2011 04:45:30 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Rubber Band]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="rubber-band"><![CDATA[Rubber Band]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1631</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I bet this happens to almost all other parents, too.

We think of something fun and cool to do with our little ones so that we could spend some quality time with them, only to find that they are not as interested in it as we expect them to be. I know, kids are kids. They could get easily distracted at times. Still, I have not yet come to terms with the fact that he ditched one such fun activity for a small box called iPad.

I know. Sadly, technology engages <span style="text-decoration:underline;">and</span> distracts... ^_^"

Just like when we did our snap painting, an activity suggested in one of <a href="http://www.gryphonhouse.com/authors/index.asp?ID=KOHM" target="_blank">MaryAnn Kohl'</a>s books (I can't remember which one, though...).

At first, I thought we got off on the right foot. The little guy watched closely as I stretched some rubber bands over a plastic container. He was also excited when I asked him to put some paint on those rubber bands.

[caption id="attachment_1632" align="aligncenter" width="224" caption="The First Encounter"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/200_snap_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1632" title="200_snap_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/200_snap_01.jpg?w=224" alt="The First Encounter" width="224" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I taught him how he could pull the rubber bands and snap them, just like playing guitar. He seemed to think it was cool, especially with the sound effect and the splashy print they made.

[caption id="attachment_1633" align="aligncenter" width="192" caption="The Second Encounter"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/200_snap_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1633" title="200_snap_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/200_snap_02.jpg?w=192" alt="The Second Encounter" width="192" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

However, after less than than 5 minutes, he asked to play with my brother's iPad... &gt;_&lt; *<em>sob, sob</em>* He no longer showed any interest to continue with the painting! Arrrgh.... speaking of the dawn of technology in the house!

This is all we could get that day.

[caption id="attachment_1634" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Blotchy and Splashy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/200_snap_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1634" title="200_snap_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/200_snap_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Blotchy and Splashy" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Don't worry... I am so going to try this again! Just you wait... :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>When the Trucks Traverse the Ocean...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/03/when-the-trucks-traverse-the-ocean/</link>
		<pubDate>Fri, 03 Jun 2011 06:39:10 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1640</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I know. I should stop procrastinating.

I've wanted to make a more exciting track for the little guy (I mean, more exciting than <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/12/17/goin-on-a-wild-ride/" target="_blank">this one</a>), but I've been putting it off since last month.

Now see how the little guy has to make do with the map!

[caption id="attachment_1641" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Truck Goes to Europe"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/201_truck_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1641" title="201_truck_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/201_truck_01.jpg?w=300" alt="The Truck Goes to Europe" width="300" height="230" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1642" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption=".. and The Truck Traverses the Sea"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/201_truck_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1642" title="201_truck_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/201_truck_02.jpg?w=217" alt=".. and The Truck Traverses the Sea" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>The Tall Totem Tale</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/06/the-tall-totem-tale/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 06 Jun 2011 08:48:48 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1646</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[The little guy seems to have outgrown the stack and nest cups.

That, however, doesn't mean he doesn't like stacking anymore. I actually have to lend him my containers to fulfil his craving!

[caption id="attachment_1647" align="aligncenter" width="178" caption="Building His Totem"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/202_stack_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1647" title="202_stack_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/202_stack_01.jpg?w=178" alt="Building His Totem" width="178" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

No, don't get me wrong. I really don't mind. Especially when I get to see his totem pole dance after he has done... *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1648" align="aligncenter" width="210" caption="Totem Pole Dance"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/202_stack_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1648" title="202_stack_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/202_stack_02.jpg?w=210" alt="Totem Pole Dance" width="210" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Hey... sometimes he even sings!

This kind of entertainment always makes my day! :)]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Two and a Half</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/09/two-and-a-half/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 09 Jun 2011 05:49:17 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="make-believe"><![CDATA[Make Believe]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1651</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We recently celebrated the little guy's 2 1/2 birthday... :)

The special treats for the day? Well, first, he could finally bring his bike, which we bought for him last month, out from the storeroom.

After practising delayed gratification for more than a week, he could finally unwrap his precious gift. What a joy!

[caption id="attachment_1652" align="aligncenter" width="228" caption="Finally!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/204_half_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1652" title="204_half_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/204_half_01.jpg?w=228" alt="Finally!" width="228" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And guess whom he brought along for a ride?

[caption id="attachment_1653" align="aligncenter" width="180" caption="The Lucky Passenger"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/204_half_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1653" title="204_half_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/204_half_02.jpg?w=180" alt="The Lucky Passenger" width="180" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I think I need to find or make him a proper basket for his bike soon... :P

That first treat, however, wasn't quite his most favorite. The second treat was.

The second treat involves getting him to sing the happy birthday song and blow out a candle.

[caption id="attachment_1654" align="aligncenter" width="222" caption="Again!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/204_half_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1654" title="204_half_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/204_half_03.jpg?w=222" alt="Again!" width="222" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He really loved that second treat! He made sure the candle was lit again as soon as he blew it out.

I think we must have done this whole thing a thousand times on that special day!]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>two-and-a-half</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Check this out.

Our little creatures were queuing up...

[caption id="attachment_1668" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="At the Queue"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/207_weigh_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1668" title="207_weigh_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/207_weigh_01.jpg?w=300" alt="At the Queue" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

		<item>
		<title>The Adventure of Mister Roley</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/13/the-adventure-of-mister-roley/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Jun 2011 00:05:41 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1658</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[When we visited an art supply store in the downtown area last month,  we decided to just get that roller sponge brush. I had been thinking of getting one when I first saw it long time ago, but I kept telling myself to just use normal sponge instead. People use rollers when they want do a quick job when painting a wide area. Us? We never really paint on anything bigger than A3 paper! Moreover, we haven't quite ventured into water-based paints yet.

In short, we bought it simply because the price tag was nothing, as compared to the transportation cost incurred to get there. I would certainly scream at myself if one day I had to drag myself all the way there again just to get such a small item.

The little guy, however, thought the roller was a cool thing to play with as soon as I handed it over to him. Although he didn't really make that "vroom... vroom" sound when he played with it, he must have thought it was the latest model of a dump truck or something.... :P How else could you explain why he rolled it all around the house?!

It was a different story when I finally gave him some paint to use the roller with. Probably a clean freak's worst nightmare...

[caption id="attachment_1677" align="aligncenter" width="189" caption="Roleeeeey...."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1677" title="203_seahorse_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_01.jpg?w=189" alt="Roleeeeey...." width="189" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

He turned the drawing paper into a wet sponge! &gt;_&lt; Eeeks...

The drawing paper was soon too wet to appreciate. Let alone to keep. And don't get me started describing how messy the floor was... (I forgot to laid out some newspaper!)... &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_1678" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Part that Survived the Flood"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1678" title="203_seahorse_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_02.jpg?w=300" alt="The Part that Survived the Flood" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

We decided to just keep a portion of it and left it to dry overnight.
It somehow reminded us of the scenes in <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Mister-Seahorse-Eric-Carle/dp/0399242694" target="_blank">Eric Carle's Mister Seahorse</a>.

And, yup, we saw another opportunity to do snap painting... :)

[caption id="attachment_1679" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Ready to Snap"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1679" title="203_seahorse_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Ready to Snap" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1680" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Enjoying the Jam Session"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1680" title="203_seahorse_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Enjoying the Jam Session" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

And finally...

[caption id="attachment_1681" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Under the Sea"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1681" title="203_seahorse_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_05.jpg?w=300" alt="Under the Sea" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

We then cut out our seahorse from<a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/04/23/happy-easter/" target="_blank"> an old masterpiece of his</a>.

Cute, eh?

[caption id="attachment_1682" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Mister Seahorse, the Good Father"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1682" title="203_seahorse_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/203_seahorse_06.jpg?w=300" alt="Mister Seahorse, the Good Father" width="300" height="256" /></a>[/caption]

I think we'll name our seahorse Mister Roley... :)

And oh, he makes just the perfect gift for this year's Father's day!]]></content:encoded>

		<content:encoded><![CDATA[I thought color sorting was just not the little guy's cup of tea yet.

		<item>
		<title>Mix and Wash</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/13/mix-and-wash/</link>
		<pubDate>Mon, 13 Jun 2011 01:38:42 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1689</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[And so I had this plan to do a simple science experiment about color mixing...

The plan was to dip paper towel (with some spots of food coloring) and watch as the two colors mix.

[caption id="attachment_1690" align="aligncenter" width="243" caption="Blue + Yellow"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1690" title="205_mix_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_01.jpg?w=243" alt="Blue + Yellow" width="243" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

The little guy, however, had a different idea. He let the paper drown in the water and shouted excitedly when he saw the color of the water changed... ^_^"

[caption id="attachment_1691" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Green!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1691" title="205_mix_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Green!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And another one...

[caption id="attachment_1692" align="aligncenter" width="219" caption="Red + Yellow"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1692" title="205_mix_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_03.jpg?w=219" alt="Red + Yellow" width="219" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

This little experiment of ours of course then turned into a water play... :P

He helped me wash the container, though... :)

[caption id="attachment_1693" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Wash... wash..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1693" title="205_mix_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/205_mix_04.jpg?w=300" alt="Wash... wash..." width="300" height="208" /></a>[/caption] ]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

We've got our very own in-flight entertainment ready.

[caption id="attachment_1697" align="aligncenter" width="241" caption="In-flight Entertainment #1"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/210_trip_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1697" title="210_trip_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/210_trip_01.jpg?w=241" alt="In-flight Entertainment #1" width="241" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

		<item>
		<title>Back</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/06/29/back/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 29 Jun 2011 05:38:12 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1702</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[After a fulfilling 2-week holiday in Indonesia, we're finally back in Singapore.

And while mommy was busy with the damage control *<em>looking proudly at the tall pile of clothes to wash and iron that is slowly decreasing...</em>*, the little guy just had to entertain himself.

With anything possible...

[caption id="attachment_1703" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Cleaning His Sandals"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/211_back_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1703" title="211_back_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/211_back_01.jpg?w=300" alt="Cleaning His Sandals" width="300" height="212" /></a>[/caption]

Even my old sequins were given a chance...

[caption id="attachment_1704" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Construction Sites with Sequins"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/211_back_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1704" title="211_back_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/06/211_back_02.jpg?w=225" alt="Construction Sites with Sequins" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Surprisingly, of all the things in the house, he seemed to miss his humble toy collection the most, such as <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/05/09/the-falling-fish/" target="_blank">the fish and the truck</a> and the <a href="http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2010/08/30/gone-fishin/" target="_blank">fishing game</a>. He didn't even ask me to turn on the PC like he usually did!

Weird! Really!

But I guess that speaks volumes about what a toddler remembers and hopefully what he would continue to cherish. He never cares about whether a toy comes with an expensive price tag. Or whether it is featured on TV or the talk of the town.

Often, the joy is indeed in the simple things.

And I'm glad both my husband and I could be part of those childhood memories that the little guy could treasure as he grows up... :)]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Angry Birds Attack!</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/07/03/angry-birds-attack/</link>
		<pubDate>Sun, 03 Jul 2011 07:50:57 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Playdoh]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="playdoh"><![CDATA[Playdoh]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1708</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[Ahh... the freedom.

After dealing with a vicious case of stomach flu - during and after the holiday - for the longest time ever, the little guy and I have officially recovered. Fully. It really feels great to finally be able to go around without having to think whether we could find a toilet fast enough if anything should happen... :P

And so, on Saturday, off we went to an art supply store.

No, we didn't actually need to get anything there. Yet, the sight of the colorful stationery and paint nearly made me empty my wallet... &gt;_&lt;

Thankfully, chasing a toddler proved to be a great way to curb compulsive spending. Yet, on the other hand, feeling tired after chasing a toddler, we contemplated sending him to one of the art workshops there, just so that we could "rest" for a while... :P There you go, we did spend after all!

It happened that <a href="http://www.jumpingclay.co.uk/" target="_blank">Jumping Clay</a> was running an Angry Birds workshop that afternoon. Being a true blue Angry Birds fan, the little guy watched curiously as two older kids were busy making their red angry birds with the instructors.

It really looked interesting. You see, Jumping Clay is something like Playdoh, but when it dries, it becomes light weight. Almost like <a href="http://www.sculpey.com/" target="_blank">Sculpey</a>, minus the baking part.

Anyway, the instructor really had to work hard while helping the little guy make his angry bird. At one time, when he tried to put one of the eyes, he squeezed both the red and white clays together. Bwahaha... If only the instructor didn't get him a new set, the little guy would certainly get himself an angry bird that looks like a flat pizza!

In the end, they somehow managed to complete one cute angry bird.

[caption id="attachment_1715" align="aligncenter" width="244" caption="Plump and Dry"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_051.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1715" title="212_bird_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_051.jpg?w=244" alt="Plump and Dry" width="244" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

While we waited for the clay to dry, my husband saw another workshop taking place not far inside: tile painting. If I went on my own, I would certainly not consider taking part. Showing any brush and paint to the little guy equals to getting ourselves to bring home an abstract painting... :P

Yet, as the workshop offered free membership to the art supply store, we decided to participate.

The two of them immediately bonded over their love of painting.

[caption id="attachment_1716" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="Father and Son"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_011.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1716" title="212_bird_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_011.jpg?w=207" alt="Father and Son" width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Sadly, the above lovey-dovey scene didn't last for long. The little guy quickly decided that he was a better painter and wanted to take over the brush from his daddy. So, I had to take him to sit next to his dad instead and let him continue painting on the paper covered table.

[caption id="attachment_1718" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="On His Own"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_031.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1718" title="212_bird_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_031.jpg?w=300" alt="On His Own" width="300" height="217" /></a>[/caption]

Only then could his daddy continue painting and carefully hide the smudge the little guy made. Once in a while, he got the little guy to help coloring some parts of the painting.

Wanna guess what they painted?

[caption id="attachment_1719" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Another Angry Bird"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1719" title="212_bird_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/212_bird_021.jpg?w=300" alt="Another Angry Bird" width="300" height="210" /></a>[/caption]

And so that's the story of how we went home bringing two Angry Birds artworks.

Tsk tsk.. Our household has certainly been attacked by the <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Angry_Birds" target="_blank">Angry Birds</a> fever... ^_^"]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>

		<wp:meta_value><![CDATA[a:5:{s:5:"width";s:3:"800";s:6:"height";s:3:"752";s:14:"hwstring_small";s:23:"height='96' width='102'";s:4:"file";s:89:"/home/wpcom/public_html/wp-content/blogs.dir/c91/14930725/files/2011/07/213_museum_12.jpg";s:10:"image_meta";a:10:{s:8:"aperture";s:3:"2.7";s:6:"credit";s:0:"";s:6:"camera";s:8:"DSC-W350";s:7:"caption";s:0:"";s:17:"created_timestamp";s:10:"1307541762";s:9:"copyright";s:0:"";s:12:"focal_length";s:3:"4.7";s:3:"iso";s:3:"400";s:13:"shutter_speed";s:4:"0.04";s:5:"title";s:0:"";}}]]></wp:meta_value>

		<item>
		<title>A Day at the Museums</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/07/05/a-day-at-the-museums/</link>
		<pubDate>Tue, 05 Jul 2011 07:28:49 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1724</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[We made the trip to several museums exactly last month. Yet, it was only recently that I could sort through the photos and finally write something about it... &gt;_&lt;

I know. I couldn't believe it myself. It felt like it was just yesterday we packed so much fun into a day!

<a href="http://www.nationalmuseum.sg/EventDetail.aspx?id=262&amp;cat=5" target="_blank"><strong>The Playdome at National Museum of Singapore</strong></a>

[caption id="attachment_1725" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="To the Playdome"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1725" title="213_museum_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_01.jpg?w=300" alt="To the Playdome" width="300" height="151" /></a>[/caption]

We reached the museum quite early, about 1040 AM. I thought we would just visit the Playdome, but a friendly staff approached us. She somehow managed to coax us into joining their 45-min interactive tour.

At first, I was rather reluctant. I thought it would be too much for the little guy to handle. The thought of having to chase the little guy, keeping him away from anything breakable, was just too daunting.

[caption id="attachment_1726" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Practising Martial Arts with One of the Guides"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_15.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1726 " title="213_museum_15" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_15.jpg?w=300" alt="Practising Martial Arts with One of the Guides" width="300" height="205" /></a>[/caption]

In the end, it was not that kind of tour I imagined. The story-telling and role playing had the little guy's attention from start to end. Geee... I wish I'm just as good as those guides!

[caption id="attachment_1730" align="aligncenter" width="204" caption="Testing out the Audio Headset"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1730" title="213_museum_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_05.jpg?w=204" alt="Testing out the Audio Headset" width="204" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Anyway, we then decided to go to the Garden @ The Playdome first before it got too hot to play out there.

[caption id="attachment_1728" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Selecting a Binocular"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1728" title="213_museum_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Selecting a Binocular" width="300" height="231" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1729" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="...To See the Umbrella"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1729" title="213_museum_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_021.jpg?w=300" alt="...To See the Umbrella" width="300" height="210" /></a>[/caption]

Next, we visited the Black Box.

The giant kaleidoscope quickly won his heart.

[caption id="attachment_1731" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Mesmerized..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1731" title="213_museum_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_04.jpg?w=225" alt="Mesmerized..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

There was also a Wayang Play stage not far from the kaleidoscope. After exploring the stage, the little guy sat down to color his face-mask. My tired feet really wished we could stay there longer, but the little guy still thought the kaleidoscope was the coolest thing ever and that he shouldn't waste his time anywhere else... :P

When I finally managed to drag him away from the kaleidoscope, we visited the 2 1/2 D cinema. The idea was to let him experience "being inside a movie". The little guy, however, thought we were playing shadow puppets... :P

And that was how we got all those silly poses... :P

[caption id="attachment_1732" align="aligncenter" width="240" caption="Walking on Water"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_06.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1732" title="213_museum_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_06.jpg?w=240" alt="Walking on Water" width="240" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

We also visited the Clay Musescapes at the Sensory Lab.

The little guy may be too young to make anything significant there, but he was certainly an expert in squeezing things... :P I am just glad we went out of the place without destroying anything... ^_^"

&nbsp;

<strong>Art Garden: Children's Season at Singapore Art Museum</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1734" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Big Walter Rabbit"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1734" title="213_museum_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_08.jpg?w=300" alt="The Big Walter Rabbit" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

After lunch, we decided to visit the Art Museum. Not only was it free, but it also turned out that they were in the midst of transforming the museum for the Children's Season!

The whole museum was like a playground to the little guy. Even the elephant statue...

[caption id="attachment_1735" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Dancing Tot and the Playful Elephant"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_09.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1735 " title="213_museum_09" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_09.jpg?w=300" alt="The Dancing Tot and the Playful Elephant" width="300" height="251" /></a>[/caption]

Instead of posing nicely in front of the elephant when I took out my camera, the little guy went to dance around the elephant. Tsk tsk... The lunch had certainly given him an energy boost!

There was also a three-tiered cake (it was supposed to be a cake for mommy! *<em>grinz</em>*) for him to decorate and some dolls to dress up, using his favorite: velcro.

[caption id="attachment_1736" align="aligncenter" width="211" caption="One Big Cake for Himself"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_10.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1736" title="213_museum_10" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_10.jpg?w=211" alt="One Big Cake for Himself" width="211" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1737" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Green and Yellow for Her..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_11.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1737 " title="213_museum_11" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_11.jpg?w=225" alt="Green and Yellow for Her..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And look who also got to paint in the museum (at the Tree of Love)...

[caption id="attachment_1738" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Caught in the Act"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_12.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1738" title="213_museum_12" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_12.jpg?w=300" alt="Caught in the Act" width="300" height="282" /></a>[/caption]

At the Paper Fruit Market, we took the template to make a paper orange, which the little guy happily cut out. He didn't have the patience to wait for the glue to dry, though... We just brought it home to make later on.

Too bad the Paramodelic-Graffiti that was built out of toy train tracks wasn't ready for us to explore yet... Otherwise, the little guy would certainly have loved to spend more time there...

[caption id="attachment_1739" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="The Tantalizing Tracks..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_13.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1739" title="213_museum_13" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/213_museum_13.jpg?w=225" alt="The Tantalizing Tracks..." width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Oh well, it was supposed to be a day at the museums anyway. Not a night at the museums... :P]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>Holiday in a Nutshell</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/07/06/holiday-in-a-nutshell/</link>
		<pubDate>Wed, 06 Jul 2011 15:52:20 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="field-trip"><![CDATA[Field Trip]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1744</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[More often than not, holiday takes so long to arrive, only to end so quickly...

Thankfully, last holiday wasn't a wasted holiday at all as we traveled to Surabaya and Jakarta (13 - 27 June 2011). It may be holiday, but the learning process continues... :)

&nbsp;

<strong>How to Win Friends and Find Your Partners in Crime</strong>

With the limited resources (read: interesting things to play with), the little guy certainly had to practice his "negotiation skill" to get what he wants... :P Sometimes, to the little guy, it could simply mean sharing the limited resources. Yet, some other times, he translated it into smacking older kids to gain sole proprietorship... *<em>gasp</em>*... &gt;_&lt;

[caption id="attachment_1745" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="One for All, All for One"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1745" title="214_holiday_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_04.jpg?w=300" alt="One for All, All for One" width="300" height="141" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1746" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="Together We Climb, Fall I Shall Not..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_08.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1746" title="214_holiday_08" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_08.jpg?w=207" alt="Together We Climb, Fall I Shall Not..." width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

<strong>Discovering a New Hobby</strong>

One night, before we went to bed, the little guy somehow found a new hobby: folding. He took one of the curtain tiebacks and started folding and unfolding it. After that episode, he seems to be interesting in attempting to fold his clothes. Ha! I should quickly make good use of that hobby! *<em>grinz</em>*

[caption id="attachment_1747" align="aligncenter" width="205" caption="Fold Here..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_09.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1747" title="214_holiday_09" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_09.jpg?w=205" alt="Fold Here..." width="205" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

<strong>Experiencing the <em>Real</em> Marble Run</strong>

There you go... the little guy finally could try out his daddy's ancient marble run.

[caption id="attachment_1748" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Simply Engrossing!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1748" title="214_holiday_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_05.jpg?w=225" alt="Simply Engrossing!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

&nbsp;

<strong>A Jackson Pollock for a Day</strong>

Just because one has found a new hobby, one should not abandon the old hobby. And so the little guy borrowed some brushes from his grandmother and showed off his skill.

[caption id="attachment_1749" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="Green for the Background..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1749" title="214_holiday_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_01.jpg?w=207" alt="Green for the Background..." width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1751" align="aligncenter" width="179" caption="The Strong Brush Strokes"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_021.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1751" title="214_holiday_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_021.jpg?w=179" alt="The Strong Brush Strokes" width="179" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And finally he got to paint like <a href="http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jackson_Pollock" target="_blank">Jackson Pollock</a>.

[caption id="attachment_1752" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Splash &amp; Drip Painting"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1752" title="214_holiday_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_03.jpg?w=300" alt="Splash &amp; Drip Painting" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

I'm just glad he didn't stain anything... hehehe...

&nbsp;

<strong>Experiencing the Local Culture</strong>

[caption id="attachment_1754" align="aligncenter" width="239" caption="A Very Short Intro to Gamelan"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_071.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1754" title="214_holiday_07" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_071.jpg?w=239" alt="A Very Short Intro to Gamelan" width="239" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

As much as I have hoped that he would get to learn more about the local culture like the above Gamelan, I fear the only local culture he got to experience the most was... shopping.. ^_^"

[caption id="attachment_1756" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Race Me if You Dare"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_061.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1756" title="214_holiday_06" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_061.jpg?w=225" alt="Race Me if You Dare" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Oops... :P

At least, he didn't mind getting down and dirty as we explored the markets.

[caption id="attachment_1758" align="aligncenter" width="219" caption="Comparing Traditional vs &quot;Modern&quot; Drink"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_12.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1758" title="214_holiday_12" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_12.jpg?w=219" alt="Comparing Traditional vs &quot;Modern&quot; Drink" width="219" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1757" align="aligncenter" width="217" caption="An Avid Shopper in Action"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_10.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1757" title="214_holiday_10" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_10.jpg?w=217" alt="An Avid Shopper in Action" width="217" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

[caption id="attachment_1759" align="aligncenter" width="179" caption="Taking a Break"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_11.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1759" title="214_holiday_11" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/214_holiday_11.jpg?w=179" alt="Taking a Break" width="179" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Too bad, it was just a short holiday...*<em>sigh</em>*

Geee... how I wish the next holiday would quickly come.]]></content:encoded>

		<item>
		<title>When He Wanted to Rock the Boat...</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/07/07/when-he-wanted-to-rock-the-boat/</link>
		<pubDate>Thu, 07 Jul 2011 15:30:31 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Straw]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="straw"><![CDATA[Straw]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="water-play"><![CDATA[Water Play]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1764</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[As wonderful as they look on the photos posted in this blog, I must admit that sometimes, say probably about 3 out of 10, the activities that I planned out for the little guy didn't turn out as I expected. It could be because of his lack of interest (blame it to the terrible two!) or simply because he had a totally different idea on how to do things (again, blame it to the terrible two!). Even so, most of the time, the outcome could still be considered rather 'positive'.

There are, however, some that give an outcome that I don't quite fancy... :(

Like when I taught him how to blow water bubbles through a straw...

[caption id="attachment_1765" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Bubbles!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1765" title="215_blow_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_01.jpg?w=225" alt="Bubbles!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I remember teaching him that before and there was no incident AT ALL. Yet, obviously this time, it just had to be different.

It started off as a lesson on how the wind could move a boat. We had our paper boat ready. So all we needed then was a little bit of gust.

Ah.. there! The little guy huffed and puffed with all his might...

[caption id="attachment_1766" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="A Hurricane&#039;s A-blowing"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1766" title="215_blow_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_02.jpg?w=225" alt="A Hurricane's A-blowing" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Then we moved on to learning about waves: observing how the wind causes the waves and how the waves, in turn, would bring the boat up and down.

Too much for a 2-year-old? Most definitely!

It didn't take him long to figure out that if he pushes the straw deeper instead, he would get bubbles...

Lots and lots of them....

[caption id="attachment_1767" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Who Needs Waves when You Have Bubbles?!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1767" title="215_blow_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Who Needs Waves when You Have Bubbles?!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

And see that cheeky smile?

[caption id="attachment_1768" align="aligncenter" width="254" caption="*gulp*"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1768" title="215_blow_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_04.jpg?w=254" alt="*gulp*" width="254" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

I knew it! He just took a gulp of the water... Yikes!

Fortunately, it was drinking water. Yet, I never thought that he would even try to suck at the straw...

And just as I tried to recover from the shock, he gave me a long "Ahhhhhh!"... and told me how yummy "the drink" was... Duh!

[caption id="attachment_1770" align="aligncenter" width="193" caption="Ahhhhh!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_051.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1770" title="215_blow_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/215_blow_051.jpg?w=193" alt="Ahhhhh!" width="193" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

So, people, the next time you want to try this, make sure you prepare clean drinking water. Just be prepared for the unexpected, will you...]]></content:encoded>
		<excerpt:encoded><![CDATA[]]></excerpt:encoded>
		<wp:post_id>1764</wp:post_id>
		<wp:post_date>2011-07-07 23:30:31</wp:post_date>
		<wp:post_date_gmt>2011-07-07 15:30:31</wp:post_date_gmt>
		<wp:comment_status>open</wp:comment_status>
		<wp:ping_status>open</wp:ping_status>
		<wp:post_name>when-he-wanted-to-rock-the-boat</wp:post_name>
		<wp:status>publish</wp:status>
		<wp:post_parent>0</wp:post_parent>
		<wp:menu_order>0</wp:menu_order>
		<wp:post_type>post</wp:post_type>
		<wp:post_password></wp:post_password>
		<wp:is_sticky>0</wp:is_sticky>
								<wp:postmeta>
		<wp:meta_key>_edit_lock</wp:meta_key>

		<item>
		<title>The Dancing Giraffe</title>
		<link>http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/2011/07/09/the-dancing-giraffe/</link>
		<pubDate>Sat, 09 Jul 2011 07:24:35 +0000</pubDate>
		<dc:creator><![CDATA[schooloffun]]></dc:creator>
		
		<category><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years"><![CDATA[Age &lt; 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="age-2-years-2"><![CDATA[Age 2 years]]></category>

		<category><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<category domain="category" nicename="paint"><![CDATA[Paint]]></category>

		<guid isPermaLink="false">http://schooloffun.wordpress.com/?p=1775</guid>
		<description></description>
		<content:encoded><![CDATA[There's nothing new about this little curious cook aka the little guy that I have at home. He seems to rate my kitchen utensils way above his toy collection. Whatever I do in the kitchen never seems to fail to amaze him.

Like when I cut some potatoes into cubes. There was no way I could escape from letting him try when he was that wide awake...

[caption id="attachment_1776" align="aligncenter" width="207" caption="Cutting Corners..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_01.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1776" title="216_giraffe_01" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_01.jpg?w=207" alt="Cutting Corners..." width="207" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

With a bread knife instead of a proper knife, the little guy just had to cut corners... So, instead of nice cubes, we got some nice<em> unidentified </em>shapes<em>... :P</em>

[caption id="attachment_1777" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="Too Nice to Throw..."]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_02.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1777" title="216_giraffe_02" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_02.jpg?w=300" alt="Too Nice to Throw..." width="300" height="210" /></a>[/caption]

Yes, they were certainly too nice to throw.

Since the little guy recently likes to read <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Giraffes-Cant-Dance-Giles-Andreae/dp/0439287197" target="_blank">Giraffes Can't Dance by Giles Andreae</a>, I thought we should use those potatoes to make our own giraffe... :)

<strong>What we had</strong>:
<ol>
	<li>paper</li>
	<li>marker</li>
	<li>scissors</li>
	<li>brown paint</li>
	<li>potato pieces</li>
</ol>
<strong>Let the Fun Begin!</strong>

All I needed to do was to draw a giraffe on a construction paper. The rest of the steps, well except the cutting, of course, was the little guy's to complete... :)

Yup, he just needed to dip the potato pieces into the paint and start stamping. That easy!

[caption id="attachment_1778" align="aligncenter" width="225" caption="Stamp!"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_03.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1778" title="216_giraffe_03" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_03.jpg?w=225" alt="Stamp!" width="225" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

Fast and easy, in fact. I even had to find another way to entertain him while we waited for it to dry, giving him another episode of Being the Curious Cook.

[caption id="attachment_1779" align="aligncenter" width="228" caption="Making Good Use of His Energy"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_04.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1779" title="216_giraffe_04" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_04.jpg?w=228" alt="Making Good Use of His Energy" width="228" height="300" /></a>[/caption]

There was, however, one problem. As the picture of the giraffe was plain at first (i.e. no patches), the little guy insisted that it was a horse, not a giraffe. So, when we finally got our giraffe ready, he kept calling it, "Dancing horse!"

[caption id="attachment_1780" align="aligncenter" width="300" caption="The Dancing Giraffe"]<a href="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_05.jpg"><img class="size-medium wp-image-1780" title="216_giraffe_05" src="http://schooloffun.files.wordpress.com/2011/07/216_giraffe_05.jpg?w=300" alt="The Dancing Giraffe" width="300" height="225" /></a>[/caption]

Oops! :P]]></content:encoded>
